resources.string: Thank you.
Me says thank you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come on... I helped you out more than that.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me says you can do better. More money, yuh?
I didn't help you for chump-change. Do you want to get hurt?
You make me mad. I needs more gold!
Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> And when all of those Neverwintans starve so you can get some extra gold...
Me guesses me can't makes you budge?
You look like someone with some sense to them. Why don't you go talk that chump into getting me the marble, so I can ship off to Waterdeep.
You believe that chump? I got a chance to ship some marble into Waterdeep - that's some good gold in that deal! And he's throwing morality at me.
You look like the kind of <lad/lass> I need - nice and gruff. Why don't you scare some sense into the dock-master, so I can get my marble and leave for Waterdeep.
Have a nice chat with ol' Prichev there? He fill your head with moralistic nonsense? I hope you're not fool enough to believe it all.
Well, looks like I get to ship off to Waterdeep. Wouldn't be right not to give you a small cut. So here, take this.
Yes. Goodbye - and let us all hope that ends more heroically than it has started.
Captain Mung, you can call me. And I own the boat that'll bring any goods from Port Llast to points beyond - points beyond that *I* choose.
Especially not when my choice is risking my life, or getting some marble to Waterdeep for a real pay-day. I'm talking good money!
Thank you. I won't hold you to any promises, but if you can get him to give me the good shipment, I'd be thankful.
What? You're taking his side? I'm not risking my life, or my men's life. Don't believe that the plague is cured.
You can't tell me what to do! Who are you?! You do not tell me what to do!! That's it, I'm leaving. Forget about Port Llast. I don't need either shipment.
Time for me to get on to work. I'm heading off to Waterdeep, and I ain't got much time to show for the work to do.
But that no good dock-master is making my life miserable. Tell me, would you be shipping into Neverwinter when you could be off to Waterdeep?
That bum wants me to go to Neverwinter, but they got plague there. And I'm not risking my life to deliver some food and supplies.
Argue with someone else, <lad/lass>. I'm not interested. And I'm not going in there. It's not worth what I'd be making.
Pay? You'd pay me to go to Neverwinter? Is it that important to you? Well, all right. I'm a businessman. What's your offer?
Well, that's a fair offer, I suppose. Fine, I'll take it. I always wanted to do the right thing anyway. Just needed a push. Nice doing business...
Yeah, you do that. You make sure he tells you the truth of this, and none of those pulling-my-heartstring lies.
Bah. If you got any sense in you, you'll talk to that dock-master and give him a piece of my mind, before I strangle him!
Ah, thank you. It'll be a nice pay-day to get at the end of this next voyage, thanks to you. And now, it's time to say farewell.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> What the heck - I suppose I'm feeling generous. You've gotten me a nice reward, after all. Here, take this then.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I'm taking every last coin I can get. I'm not trying to make money so that I can give it away.
I should have known better than to think this could be done out of kindness. Profit is always the reasoning behind things, isn't it?
Here, take this money. At least I can be contented in the knowledge that the shipment will make it to Neverwinter.
Yes, goodbye. Pleasure to have met you, so says my gold purse. Ha ha!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> 100 gold? And all I have to do is dump some food off in Neverwinter? All right. I'll do it. Nice doing business...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, 100 gold is a nice offer, but it's not quite enough to make me want to risk a quick and ugly death.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> 50 gold? All right. It doesn't cover the difference, but if it means that much to you... nice doing business with you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry. While 50 gold is a nice start, it's not enough. Maybe you got some more in that purse of yours?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You had to put it like that, didn't you. Fine. I'll take the shipment. But you just leave me alone, now, all right? I got work to do.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Ain't nothing you can say that ol' dock-master hasn't already tried, so beat off will you? Scram!
Hey, you get that chump to open up the port yet? I ain't going nowhere without that marble. And I'm going straight in to Waterdeep for a pay-day!
You back again? I'm telling you, arguing with that fool dock-master Prichev is driving me insane. Why don't you go do something about this argument?
Nope.
I done told you already that I ain't taking any goods. I'm packing up and leaving this place. Now, get gone!
Stop bothering me so much, will ya? I got to get them goods packed up for Neverwinter, and time is tight.
Stop bothering me so much, will ya? I got to get them goods packed up for Neverwinter, and time is tight.
Who are you?
What's going on between you and that other guy?
Who you be?
Why you is arguing with guy, yuh?
Goodbye.
I'll speak with the captain about taking the Neverwintan shipment.
Isn't there some compromise that can be worked out?
I spoke with the captain.
Me will go and gets his agreement, again.
Me think you be too demanding. You make bargain?
Me spoke to captain. Me makes deal.
Nevermind. I'll talk to him again.
I agree with him. You should give him the Waterdhavian shipment.
Listen, how about you give the captain the Waterdhavian shipment?
Me thinks you gives Waterdhavian shipment to captain.
Go on. I want to hear this.
You tells me, yuh? Me listens.
Sorry - this doesn't sound interesting. Goodbye.
Me not cares. Bye bye.
Isn't there some compromise that can be worked out?
Nevermind. I'll talk to him again.
I agree with him. You should give him the Waterdhavian shipment.
Isn't there some compromise that can be worked out?
I understand now. I'll speak with him.
Oh, me get it. Me talk to him now.
That's easy for you to say. You get paid either way.
He do what good for him. You win either way, yeah? No fair.
Give up that shipment, or I'll kill you and hand it to him myself.
Me gives you gold, yeah? Changes mind?
Perhaps some gold would change your mind?
Me can kill you and take shipment if you no do it.
No one asked you to. Just tell me your decision.
That 'cause you stupid. Now, what choice you make?
Thank you. Helping Neverwinter was the right thing.
Me say thank you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That's not a thank you. But a little more would be.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me feels more thank'd if you gives more gold, yuh?
You can give me more, or I can go talk to the captain again.
Me goes talk captain, change things. Or more money, yeah?
Goodbye.
Look, I don't mean to be rude - arguing with Captain Mung is draining. So you'll excuse me if I can't talk, all right? I've got supplies to move.
Aw - what do you want? I'm telling you, this ain't the best of days so far. Captain Mung won't stop arguing with me.
Hey, I'm not in the mood to talk right now. I have food and supplies to move, and I'm stuck arguing with Captain Mung. This is *not* a good day.
Look, I saw you speaking with Captain Mung. I'm sure he told you some lies about me. At least let me tell you my side before you proclaim anything, will you?
I don't even know what happened, but I got a bunch of goods that are making their way out to Neverwinter now. Let me thank you for it with this.
Yes. Goodbye. Now, back to trying to convince a money-hungry pig to do something charitable.
What does it matter to you, huh? Ahh... I'm sorry. The name's Prichev - and I'm a little pressed for time right now if you can't tell.
Good Captain Mung's only got room for one shipment. Of course, he wants the money from the valuable shipment - but the people of Neverwinter *need* this relief shipment.
Thank you. I won't hold you to any promises, but if you can get him to change his mind, well... it would be the right thing.
Yes, and what did he say? Will he take the Neverwintan shipment after all? To think of those desperate souls. Please tell me you talked some sense into him.
Are you serious? Do you not understand what the situation is? Port Llast has come together to help Neverwinter's citizens - that shipment needs to be made.
I wish there was, but really - this is black and white. The people of Port Llast have worked hard to help Neverwinter. I want that effort to be carried out.
What? No! I won't give up the Waterdhavian shipment. That relief package needs to get to Neverwinter right away. I have to ship it now.
I can't believe it. Well, I guess money is more important to everyone these days. What a shameful day. I hope it's worth it to you.
What?! I should have known I couldn't trust you. Things get a little too risky for you, and suddenly the agreed-upon price isn't good enough.
Hey pal - business is business. I do you a favor and you do one right back for me, all right? And this has nothing to do with risk.
Besides, if I started doing things out of the kindness of my heart, I wouldn't be in business now would I? I do as I -
I give out the jobs, and you take them. I need this shipped to Neverwinter. If you want work, you'll take this package.
Well, if the difference is between a wealthy shipment to Waterdeep, and a trip into that plague-ridden town - count me out.
How am I supposed to reason with you? The plague has been cured! And those citizens are desperate. Put yourself in their shoes!
I don't trust what people say about a plague that can kill you. I'm staying away. I'm not bringing that shipment to Neverwinter.
Hey, I don't mean to be burdening you with my troubles, but... well, I sure could use an ear. And who knows - maybe you can help?

I've got two shipments - one going to Waterdeep, and one to Neverwinter. The Waterdhavian shipment is worth more, but the Neverwintan package is for relief - put together by the citizens of Port Llast.
Great - just great. The captain's gone. Now, neither shipment is going out. Thanks for your *help,* okay? Sickening, that's what this is.
I wish there was, but really - this is black and white. The people of Port Llast have worked hard to help Neverwinter. I want that effort to be carried out.
This will help their lives immensely. I understand the value of money, but it's not everything, you understand. This is for the good!
You would - threaten me - over this? For someone else's profit? I don't understand.
Surely you can find a better use of your gold than ensuring another's profit? Take your bribes elsewhere, won't you?
I don't care for your arguments or accusations. I'm not thinking business - I'm thinking aid. If you cannot help me, leave this matter alone.
I know I might seem tense, but - it is the situation that does this to me. Please, speak to him. I trust you will do well.
Now, is there something else? I have a shipment to get to Neverwinter, and apparently no boat to take it there. If you'll excuse me?
Though you sicken me - fine, I will release the shipment. Now, do not speak with me further.
I understand. This really isn't your business anyhow. I apologize for attempting to pull you into it.
And this day, this act of kindness - ah, my faith in humanity is strong. Thank you, kind <sir/madam>. Thank you.
Well, in the end, it's been a good day. Port Llast came together, and we got some aid out to Neverwinter. Good people do exist, after all.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Yes, I suppose it would. You have done well, and I am in good spirits. Fine, take this extra gold to go with my thanks.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Port Llast has spent much already, just to prepare these goods. To ask more would be too much. I must ask you to withdraw your request.
I should have known better than to think this could be done out of kindness. Profit is always the reasoning behind things, isn't it?
Here, take this money. At least I can be contented in the knowledge that the shipment will make it to Neverwinter.
Yes, goodbye. Let us part ways knowing that a good deed has been done.
It seems to me that you're working toward a mediation. And while normally I'd agree with that, I don't believe this issue is one for mediation.
Did you want to talk about something else? I'm sorry if I seem distracted - I just can't get over the argument I'm having with Captain Mung.
I can't believe it. Well, I guess money is more important to everyone these days. What a shameful day. I hope it's worth it to you.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
I need information about Port Llast.
Urth? Who's that?
Do you know anything about the surrounding region?
What you know of Port Llast?
What you mean Urth? Who that?
What you know happen outside Port Llast?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone else that could help me? A local, maybe?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It's okay to tell me. I want to help.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Who are the Eisenfeldts? Where do they live?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You trusts me, yes? Me help.
I just need some directions.
Me need help with directions? You can, yes?
Is there an inn nearby?
Is there a temple in town?
I need to buy some equipment.
Are there any rangers or druids within town?
Me tired. Me wants sleep, yuh?
Me look for holy place. Me needs temple, yuh?
Me needs new stuff to buy.
Where me hire people - help me fight?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
Me asks something else. Okay?
Yes, I am an adventurer.
Me yes - is adventurer <man/woman>.
I need to hire some adventurers.
Me wonders if Port Llast got rangers or druids?
Tell me about Ander.
Who Ander be?
There are werewolves in Port Llast?
You gots werewolfs at Port Llast?
Do you know anything about this knight?
Who knight be? You know?
You shouldn't get so excited about adventuring. It's a rough life.
You want being adventurer? Too rough for anyone. Bad stuff.
Who? Me? I'm no adventurer.
Me not adventurer - no how, no way!
Does your pop not like adventurers?
What pop got against me adventuring people?
Let me ask something else.
Me gots other question.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> "Whiny" Shaldrissa? Who's that?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> What you says "whiny" Shaldrissa? Who she?
Where might I find Ander?
Me maybe talk to Ander?
Are you an adventurer or something?
You're a nice person. Do you want to play a game sometime?
Bye, bye stranger. You're a pretty nice <mister/missus>, after all.
Bye...
Um... I guess I can answer a question for you. What did you want to know? Hey, is this about Urth? I don't want to get him into trouble.
Ah - what kind of stuff were you wanting to ask me about?
I - guess so. Um. I guess.
Ummm... I don't really know what - most people just go to Neurik when they got a question about local stuff. He's at the Tyrran temple.
Urth is my friend. He lives on the Eisenfeldt farm. But... I don't know. He's been weird lately. I shouldn't say anything else.
Ummm... you could probably talk to Neurik. He's at the Tyrran Temple, but he pretty much knows all sorts of stuff. Maybe he can help.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I don't know. I don't see him much anymore. I saw him the other day and he ran away from me. He's kind of scary now.
Can we talk about something else? Did you have another question?
They're our neighbors. All of the Port Llast farms are south of town. I'm sure you can go over and talk to them, maybe.
Yeah? What do you want? My folks ain't want me talking to no adventurers. You're an adventurer, right?
Are you an adventurer? You look kind of... I don't know - are you one?
Sure. What are you looking for? I've been living here my whole entire life. I know where everything is.
Um... okay, I guess.
Yeah. You'll probably want to go to the Alliance Arms, by the north gate into town. There's lots of people like you there.
Yeah - Neurik runs the Tyrran temple and looks after all of us - at least as much as he can. The temple's by the north gate.
You can buy swords and everything at the Cracked Anvil - it's on the west side of town. My pop says it's all a waste of money, though. No offense, <mister/missus>.
Yeah, there's one in the northeast part of town - in a grove. You could probably talk to him if you wanted to.
Do you want to know where anything else is?
I think I saw Urth yesterday.
And then the big werewolf came and ate up all of the little ones! Grrrrr!
I bet you're still in love with Jimmy, aren't you.
Really? Was he - was he all right?
I don't know. I called out his name and he ran away from me. He jumped the wall.
You couldn't catch him? You were always the faster one.
He was running fast and he leapt over that wall like nothin'. Something's different with him. I don't know if I wanted to catch him.
I don't want you playing with me. You're not nice.
You're just scared of the werewolves is all. You're just a baby!
Am not!
Am too!
Yuck! Boys are so gross!
Then why do you spend all day watching them?
So we can tattle on them when they do something Mother says they shouldn't. Isn't it obvious?
We get lots of adventurers in Port Llast now-a-days. Pop says they all come from Neverwinter, 'cause they want to live here instead.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Pop says I shouldn't talk about people behind their back. I shouldn't say anything more.
Ander might be able to help you, too. He's so neat! He worked with a knight to hunt werewolves!
You could probably ask the guys at the barracks. They all come and go and know stuff like that. It's the place just south of the Tyrran temple.
If you go to the barracks just south of the temple and the inn, you can find some people like you there. Maybe one will let you hire them?
That's what my pop's always saying. He says to get my head out of the clouds, and that Port Llast has good soil or crops.
Ander's one of my friends. He got recruited to go on an adventure to get werewolves with that knight!
I want to be an adventurer, but pop says that it's a waste of time - um, no offense, <mister/missus>.
No, my pop says there aren't. But that knight came in and took and Ander and some others and made them go hunt some.
No. He came in like you and hired some people and went away. I think his name was Karathis.
I don't know. He says not to talk to them. I guess it's because we're farmers. He doesn't like fighting.
We get lots of adventurers in Port Llast now-a-days. Pop says they all come from Neverwinter, 'cause they want to live here instead.
I want to be an adventurer myself, some day. Pop says that's a waste of time, but I always like talking to the adventurers who come through here.
Ummm... okay.
Umm... you mean like off of the farm? My pop doesn't let me go too far. He says there's criminals or something outside of town. Of course, whiny Shaldrissa swoons over all of them.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, she's just some girl. She's the mayor's daughter, and she's always talking about wanting to leave town.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Aw, I shouldn't have said "whiny" - I didn't mean nothing by it. Pop says not to talk about others behind their backs. Sorry.
I guess I think it would be fun to go adventuring, too, but she's just someone who won't stop talking about it. My dad says she's got her head in the wrong place.
Oh, he spends his time at the Alliance Arms Inn. You can find him there if you want to talk to him.
If you're looking for magic supplies, you should go to Eltoora Sarptyl's! You can find her on the hill at the north end of town.
Go wash up, son. You've got the smell of the sea on you.
In a minute, ma.
We've got guests here, hon. Go make yourself presentable.
I'm perfectly presentable as I am, mother.
And you'll make a perfectly presentable spinster someday, too, so go put on a nice blouse.
You're impossible, mother!
Are you ready for your sewing lessons, dear?
There's not enough light. I'll just end up stitching myself to my dress again.
All right, but tomorrow afternoon I want you home to work on it.
You've been playing Soldiers and Thieves again, haven't you?
Billy made me do it...
Well then, you're going to have to make Billy not do it, aren't you... ?
Yes'm.
Hullo, Missus. What can I do for you?
Did my husband finally bring in the plow?
Not the plow itself but he talked to me about it. He'll bring it in tomorrow, he said.
All right. Well here are some beets and onions to pay for it when he comes in, then.
Well that will make a fine soup, then.
Excuse me, I don't have time to talk, <mister/missus>.
Don't you be pesterin' the likes of me, now.
Nice to see people of quality in our town. Welcome to Port Llast!
Can I ask who you are?
Have you dug your grave, lycanthrope? It's time to die.
Neurik gave me these silver charms. I think they can help you.
Who you be? Me wants to know.
Me kill you, wolfy...
Wait, me help! Me have silver charms from healer-man.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Don't be shy, handsome - it won't hurt you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Nonsense. Neurik made it and, if you can't trust him, you can't trust anyone.
Look, kid. Take it or I *will* kill you. It's that simple.
All right, kid, dig your grave.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Grrrr... You so handsome when you angry, wolfy.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Neurik good man. He no hurt you.
You no take potion thingy, me kill you, yuh? So take it.
Grrr... That's it, me hurt you now...
Why you no have ring?
Why don't you have your ring?
Tell me how you became a werewolf.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I've been sent to end the werewolf menace. If you give me your ring, I'll leave and no one will come searching for you in the future.
Look, sit tight, okay? I'll see if I can find help for you.
You stay here, yuh? Me come back later. Helps you?
Uh, wha' happen to you?
I won't kill you. I promise.
Do you know where I can find Urth?
What came of Ander? Where is he now?
Would you know where would I find Geth?
Where is Karathis now?
Where me is finding Urth now?
Where Ander went? You says he make away.
Where Geth be now? You know?
Where Karathis be now?
Let's talk about something else.
We talk 'bout another thing.
Grrrr. Get out of my cave...
Yuck, this place smells horrible! I'm going to get some fresh air, all right?
Grrrr... I died when I became this - beast. This battle can only end my misery.
Grrrr... silver? You're trying to kill me, aren't you?
I am Bran, from Port Llast - at one time normal, not afflicted with this... grrr... lycanthropic disease. Why don't you take your sneering self away from here?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> No one's called me handsome before... grrrr. Give me one of those charms, then. I ain't scared of it...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Exactly - I can't trust anyone. Grrrr... Now back off.
Grrrr, you think I'm scared of death... give me the charm, then, and I'll prove it to you.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Grrr... Neurik's been good to me since I was a baby, hasn't he... all right, give me one of those charms...
Grrrrr... if you're looking for my ring, I don't have it.
Some adventurers came by. They told me if I gave it to them, people would stop searching for me. I guess they lied.
It - It worked, I can feel it. Thank you so much. Here, take my ring and bring it to Neurik so he knows I'm all right!
My adventuring ring? Grrrr. You mean you won't kill me if I just give it to you?
Grrrr... take it back to Neurik, then, and tell him I'm dead or cured or something. Just leave me and my cave alone, all right?
Grrr... if you insist...
The battle, of course, didn't fare as we expected. Karathis became a werewolf, or was killed. I don't know. Or care. The rest of us fled. Only Ander escaped becoming a werewolf.
It - It worked, I can feel it! I never thought I would be normal again, but - you proved me wrong!
I came out here on an expedition with Sir Karathis and some friends, Urth, Ander and Geth. We were hunting a - grrr - werewolf.
Urth was running back to Port Llast. I tried to stop him, but - I just didn't want to see anyone from Port Llast hurt.
Ander escaped, but I'm not sure where he is. It is likely he returned to Port Llast. If I were healthy, that is where I would be.
Geth? No... I don't know where he got to, if he managed to get anywhere that is.
I don't know where Karathis is, but I would hunt him down if I did. He ruined my life. This isn't even a life. Not anymore.
Please! I am myself again! Don't kill me!
Grrr - Please! - Grrrrr - Can't control... Myself!
I need to get out of this place.
What did you want to talk about?
Go away. We don't want you bringin' trouble on this house.
Don't you go near those stairs...
Oh, Urth, there's someone coming up! You look - presentable, don't you my boy?
If you want to blather at me, you'd best do it from outside where I can't hear you.
Thank you, good <sir/madam>! We treated you so poorly but you have been so kind...
Our boy Urth is himself again! 'Tis like having him back from the very grave!
You heard the missus. Now move on.
They're rickety an' - an' it's a danger to climb them, you hear?
Damn it, woman, grab yer weapon and pray we won't be needin' it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Actually, I could use another 100 gold.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Actually, I could use another 50 gold.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Actually, I could use another 25 gold.
That's more than enough. May the gods bless you.
Nice try. Give me everything you've got or your precious boy gets it.
Ooh, you too kind. You take care, yuh?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But me need big heap more gold, yuh?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But me need little pile more gold, yuh?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But me need just teeny bit more gold, yuh?
No, you give me big heap more gold or me kill Urth-boy!
All right, then, nevermind.
Oh. Uh, me go now, then...
I'm warning you - If you be lookin' for our boy Urth, he ain't here.
You've done the three of us a fine favor, <lad/lass>, and I'd like you to have somethin' that's been in our family awhile.
'Twas my great grandfather's sickle, but it always seemed too beautiful to use for simple harvest work.
A chest of 300 gold. 'Twas my inheritance but I've been too scared to spend it. Now's as good a time to be rid of it as any.
A chest of 150 gold. 'Twas part of my inheritance but I've been too scared to spend it. Now's as good a time to be rid of it as any.
May the winds be ever at your back, my friend.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Of course, good <FirstName>. It's not easy being an adventurer, as Urth learned almost too late.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Of what use are your deeds if we all starve over the winter? I'm sorry, that's too much for me to give.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Of course, good <FirstName>. It's not easy being an adventurer, as Urth learned almost too late.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Of course, good <FirstName>. It's not easy being an adventurer, as Urth learned almost too late.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Of what use are your deeds if we all starve over the winter? I'm sorry, that's too much for me to give.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Of what use are your deeds if we all starve over the winter? I'm sorry, that's too much for me to give.
Why, may the weather rot you, <FullName>! We'll starve the winter, rest assured, but here be your devil's gold.
Aye, this has become a happy home again.
Don't you hurt our boy!
Get out of here, you dirty scoundrel.
Who are you?
I'm here to kill you, Geth. Are you ready?
I have silver charms - from Neurik.
Me says you tell me your name.
Me kills you, Geth. Now!
Me gots silver charms. They works, yuh!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> If you want to change the future, you must do it yourself.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This charm comes from Neurik. It is safe.
Take the charm, or I'll see you dead myself.
I don't care. I'm killing you now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Neurik give charm. Is good!
You gets charm, or me kills you!
Grrr... me kills you now!
What means you? Me not knowing.
Huh? What are you talking about?
How did you become like this?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I've been sent to end the werewolf menace. If you give me your ring, I will leave and no one will come searching for you in the future.
I'll try to find some help for you. Stay here.
You stays here. Me goes to get help, then come back, okay?
What makes you become werewolf?
Do you know where I can find any of them?
Where me find these people? You know.
Excuse me. I will leave.
Me sorry. Me go now.
What are you doing here? Why have you come? I do not wish to be bothered.
I am overjoyed. I am human again! Thank you, stranger, thank you. I am forever indebted!
I do not fear death - not as a beast as I am now. If you come for death, then I shall make sure you have it.
Silver? I might be despondent about my future, but I do not wish it prematurely ended, either.
Geth - at one time a normal man, and not a horrific beast - who hails from Port Llast. Why do you care?
I suppose you're right. If I sit here and do nothing, then nothing will change, right? Fine, give me your silver charm.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Karathis told me that I would be safe at his side, and look at me now. No, I think I'll pass on your offer.
Well, if those are my choices, then I suppose I will take the charm. Death this way or death that way - what does it matter?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I felt a - flicker of hope. Could it be truth, then? Fine, give me the charm and we will see what happens.
I should have known better. To think, I believed these intrusions would end with the gift of a ring.
An adventurer visited me, and told me that if I gave up my ring these intrusions would end. Yet here you are, likely looking for that ring.
I - am human again! Is this a joke? A dream that I will wake from? Let it be truth! Oh, take my ring, and bring it to Neurik.
Fine, take it. I need it not. It will not change the course of my life.
As if I have any interest in going elsewhere. But you wouldn't understand. Fine, farewell - just leave me alone.
It sounded fun, but this is how it ended. Everyone ran. We all became werewolves except for Ander. As far as I know, he wasn't caught.
Karathis brought me out here with some of my friends: Urth, Bran and Ander. He wanted us to help him kill a werewolf.
No, I don't. And I grow weary of this conversation. Perhaps we can put it to an end, yes?
Thank you...
Stop hurting me! I will no longer attack you!
Grrr - Please! - Grrrrr - Can't control... Myself!
I really must go.
I've come to talk, nothing more.
You failed the boys of Port Llast. Prepare to die.
Neurik gave me these silver charms. I think I can help...
Me talk, yuh? Dat all.
Me kill you, wolfy...
Wait, me help! Me have silver charm thingies from healer-man.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This is magic, representative of Tyr's justice.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If it was normal silver, perhaps, but this bears Neurik's holy blessing.
I offer you a choice, Karathis - Take it or I kill you.
Enough about cures and poisons, then - let us fight as warriors!
All right, no charm then... at least for now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But dis be blessed silver of da healer-priest.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But dis be special silver - it from Neurik.
You no take silver charm thingy, me kill you, yuh? So take it.
Grrr, no more words, wolfy! We fight now.
Uh, wha' happen to you?
Can you tell me what happened?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Help me fake your death and you can go free.
Stay here, Sir Karathis. Perhaps I can help you yet.
You stay here, yuh? Me come back later. Help you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Seriously - I don't know what happened.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me really isn't knowing this.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Do you know the identity of the Black Wolf?
You have come to put down the dread Sir Karathis, have you?
Now, if you'll excuse me, I must return to my order and seek penance for taking on the shape of my enemy. Read my journal well and act upon it.
If you come here out of honor, then let us fight with honor, for that I have not lost...
You come to me with silver? Do you not remember that I was a werewolf hunter? That silver would be poison to me now.
What do you want?!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Justice, you say? If it slays the wicked and cures the righteous, then I shall gladly use this charm. I know my heart!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Don't mock me with your lies...
Then I shall use your filthy charm. I am a servant of my god, however, and it is by his hand that I shall make miracles of your base attempts!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Holy-charmed silver, is it? If it slays the wicked and cures the righteous, than I shall use this charm. I know my heart!
Either kill me or cure me. It's the only way you'll ever know.
With what? An army or a cure?
There, that should be proof enough of my innocence. Take this journal I have penned and give it to Neurik. It tells the truth of what has happened.
A deceiver made me what I am today! I may look like the Black Wolf, but I shan't become like him! Take your offers elsewhere.
And would you believe me when I told the truth? Don't mark me for a fool.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmm... well, not to judge, but I do find that fairly believable coming from you. Fine, I will recount the sad tale.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> As believable as that sounds coming from you, I'll ask you to excuse me from your mockeries.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Though my mind rebels, my heart knows the better - you are being... sincere. Aren't you? Fine. I will recount the sad tale.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> As believable as that sounds coming from you, I'll ask you to excuse me from your mockeries.
I have been hunting werewolves for most of my adventuring career, and was in fact knighted for this duty I have placed upon myself.
But I was to face my greatest challenge with the Black Wolf. I brought four young men of Port Llast - Urth, Bran, Geth, and Ander - to help me.
But with tragic irony, I was afflicted with lycanthropy, and I cursed them to the same in turn, all save the youngest, Ander. It has been a dark day ever since.
I believe that I do, but I would keep that secret as my own - perhaps I might use it as a key to restore my humanity.
I have regained control. You need no longer attack me!
Grrr - Please! - Grrrrr - Can't control... Myself!
I have no time to talk right now.
Who are you? My name is <FullName>.
We must speak of the werewolves.
Who you be? Me is <FullName>.
We gots to talk 'bout werewolves.
Goodbye.
Perhaps you need some assistance?
I need some directions for town.
Me cans helps you, maybe?
Me needs directions in town.
Can you point me in the direction of an inn?
Is there a temple available?
I'll need someplace to buy equipment.
Let me ask about something else.
Me need inn to go to.
Me cannot find temple. Where one be?
Me needs buy stuff like weapon and armor.
Me think of different thing to ask.
Tell me what you would have me do.
Me not knowing what me is doing to help. You say now?
Who is this Ander you mention?
Where can I get the weapons to fight werewolves?
I will do this for you.
Me wonders who Ander is.
Me need special weapons fighting werewolves, yeah?
Me can do this.
I have some more questions about this job.
Me got some questions 'bout job.
Who is this Ander you mention?
Where can I get the weapons to fight werewolves?
Where will I find these afflicted boys?
Me wonders who Ander is.
Me need special weapons fighting werewolves, yeah?
Me not know where to start looking for werewolves.
I've some questions about the boys you wish cured.
Me gots questions about boys you wants to cure.
Remind me what you needed help with...
You reminds me what job you was wanting me do, yuh?
I found Urth. Here is his ring.
What services does Tyr provide?
Me wanting know what Tyr gives me.
I'd like to make a purchase from the temple.
Me wants to buy stuff from temple.
Can you tell me anything about Bran?
What do you know of Geth?
Where might I find Urth?
Do you know where Sir Karathis is?
Could I speak with his family?
I know the true identity of the Black Wolf, Neurik. It is Alhelor.
Me knows who Black Wolf be. It be Alhelor!
I will do as you ask.
Me will do as you asks.
Will there be a reward for this task, too?
Me can gets more gold, yeah?
I cannot accept this job now.
Me not take this job, no.
What exactly am I to do, again?
Me not remembers... what me to do, again?
Alhelor is dead. I have his tooth, here.
Me gots Alhelor tooth, yuh? He be dead.
Alhelor yet lives, so far as I know.
Alhelor still alive, so far as me knows.
Thank you for this. Farewell.
Bye bye. Thanks you, mister.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Port Llast can thank me better than this, aye?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Port Llast spends more to thank me than this, yuh?
I killed Alhelor. Give me more gold, or you're next.
Me wants more gold. Me can kills you next like Alhelor!
I found Bran. Here is his ring.
I found Geth. Here is his ring.
I found all three of them. Here are their rings.
Me finds all three. Here is rings for you.
Me finds Urth. See, here his ring.
Me finds Bran. See, here his ring.
Me finds Geth. See, here his ring.
Me looks for Bran. You know stuff?
Me maybe gets clues for where Geth is?
Where Urth be? You know?
Where me should look for Sir Karathis, you think?
I've had some success in finding the boys, actually.
Me finds out stuff about werewolf boys, yuh.
Why must I use a magical portal to enter your temple?
Let me ask about something else.
Me can ask other thing now?
Let's talk about something different.
Me changes subject now, yuh?
Let me ask about something else.
Me ask different thing now.
Let me ask about something different.
Me asks different question instead, okay?
I will find them for you.
Me finds kids. Worry not!
I've not yet found Karathis or the Black Wolf.
Me no find Karathis or Black Wolfie yet.
Tell me more about Karathis and this Black Wolf.
You tells me more 'bout Karathis and Black Wolf.
What has been happening in Port Llast?
What happens in town?
Why me need use magic portal thing to enter temple?
That makes sense.
Oh. Okay.
Welcome to the Tyrran Temple - tell me, are you here for Tyr's services, or perhaps the Lady Luck herself has guided you to us during these dark days?
I see that luck has brought you back into the wings, and back to Tyr's services - perhaps to give us a second chance at asking for your help?
It's a miracle of luck to have you returned to us. After losing brave Sir Karathis to the Black Wolf, we can't help but be overly concerned with your welfare.
Welcome back, my <brother/sister> <FirstName>. It's my pleasure, as always, to welcome you to Tyr's temple, now that things are as they belong in Port Llast.
Walk with luck gracing your every move, then. It's always a treasure to have this place graced by such capable heroes. Goodbye.
A good day to you, <sir/madam>. A very good day, indeed.
Oh, pardon my manners, good <brother/sister> <FirstName>. I am Neurik, the priest in charge of this Tyrran temple for good Port Llast.
And though it pains me to trouble you, I ask a favor of you if I might. As I alluded to, these are dark days. Days that call for a hero.
A grim topic, though I find I can think of little else. Have you been successful?
I believe I can help you find your way about the town, certainly.
The Alliance Arms Inn is likely the best around. You can find it near the north gate into town.
Well, funny that you should ask that, being as that we're in a temple. Sorry, it was a joke... ah, those who seek out Tyr's services are never turned aside.
Then I suggest you take advantage of Haljal's wares at the Cracked Anvil. He takes great pride in the quality of his craftsmanship.
Well... I'm hesitant to suggest the task because of the danger involved, but it's very important. You can be certain that I'll compensate you for the risk, should that matter to you.
I think you mean to say that... Well, far be it from me to correct you. I'm... Oh, let me just answer your question.
Let me tell you how this started. A short time ago, a foul beast settled into the area of the town. At first, few of us knew of its presence. Indeed, Port Llast has known few troubles for many years.
Ander is a youth who goes out of his way to help others. They're so naive and trusting at that age...

I have silver charms here which may yet drive the curse from their blood. You must subdue the beasts first, however, and convince them to use the charms... if you can. And then the Black Wolf, himself, must be dealt with. As I said... a terrible but vital task.
Now, please, tell me that you'ill follow through on this quest. Tell me that you'll find where the boys have gone and free them from the curse... however you are able.
I hope that it will come to such bloodletting only as a last resort. These are innocent lads under a curse. There is a peddler who came to town after hearing of our plight... his name is Alhelor.
You'll find him at the Alliance Arms Inn. He can provide you with silvered arrows, as well as access to some belladonna. But please, use them only if you must.
You don't know how relieved I am here to hear that. Here, take the silver charms. Hopefully they can be used to cure all three boys and Sir Karathis, should he still live.
Each of the boys wears a ring. They should give them up freely if cured. Bring them back to me, and then I'll know their situations are resolved.
Those children - the town prays for them, we all do. I hope you will be their savior. And may Tyr be at your side.
I'm certain of it. What I've told you would be much for anyone to absorb. What would you wish to know, <brother/sister>?
Ander is a youth who goes out of his way to help others. They're so naive and trusting at that age...
Please: tell me that you'll only use them as a last resort - these are real people, that can be saved, not mere beasts. But... not to tempt fate, you should speak with Alhelor.
The four of them - Bran, Geth, Urth, and Sir Karathis - are scattered about, and usually only to be found at night. Finding them will be difficult.
As I told you before, Port Llast is under siege by a foul werewolf known as the Black Wolf. He has corrupted our children, and a brave knight. We need your help.
Praise be to Tyr, you have done very well, indeed! We are all indebted to you for this: the boy's curse ended without the loss of an innocent life.
I am glad to hear that. I do not wish to detain you further. I will remain here in the case that you need the assistance of Tyr, or perhaps a helpful word or two.
Of course, of course - do not let me keep you waiting. Tyr will wash his luck over you this day!
Why, my <brother/sister>, I can tell you right now that all that you need can be provided to you by Tyr. Let me get into specifics.
If you need anything that could be of use to one of the devoted order, well let me say right now, my <brother/sister>: you are in the right place.

Karathis took with him four of Port Llast's younger lads to aid his task but, unfortunately, the Black Wolf was merciless. He overcame the knight and attacked the four boys... and only young Ander managed to return to us unharmed.
I've heard that he was last spotted in the Charwood area, though where, specifically, I could not say. Please don't let that dissuade you from looking. I'm sure luck will be on your side.
I know for fact that Geth traveled to the Neverwinter Wood. You know, he enjoyed being around people. I'd look for campgrounds or villages within the woods. He's sure to be close by.
Urth, I'm afraid, could be anywhere. His family has been so very fearful for him and his whereabouts. To be unable to do something for their pain....
Sir Karathis is a brave knight. Faced with his own corruption, I'm sure he would flee to the ends of the world. Perhaps if you can save the children, they will know where he might be.
Is there anything more about the boys you want to ask? I feel so helpless... perhaps I didn't know them as well as I would've liked. If only I knew better where they might have gone...
You'll find him at the Alliance Arms Inn. He can provide you with silvered arrows, as well as access to some belladonna. But please, use them only if you must.

All the boys have now been accounted for. It is a relief to see that some measure of peace has been restored at last. Your heroism has served us well, <brother/sister>. Take this reward, and my thanks.
Here is your reward, as promised. Unfortunately there are still the other children who must be found quickly. Might you have news of them, as well?
Yes, of course, the Eisenfeldts. Their farm is on the south end of Port Llast. Perhaps something they say will assist your search.

Do you speak truly? Alhelor? But he - if that is the case, I... almost cannot bring myself to say this. But, he needs to be... destroyed. The curse of the Black Wolf must be ended so it will never be spread to innocents again.

I wish I need not ask it of you, but would you seek out Alhelor and do what must be done? Please, <brother/sister>... do this and bring me his tooth so that I will know once and for all that the danger is over.
I see. The curse has taken the life of the young lad, has it? Sad though the loss might be, you have done what was asked of you and cannot be faulted. We are all grateful.
I wish you would say otherwise, though it is wrong for me to do so... should you change your mind I'll be here, and so will your reward. I hope you'll reconsider.
I know I can trust you. Your efforts have been... far beyond anything we could have hoped for. End it quickly, <brother/sister>. Let Tyr guide your hand in the name of justice.
It goes without saying that I would reward you for the task... but only if you return with a tooth of the beast. I must be sure that the deed is done.
<Brother/Sister> <FirstName> - how... how do things progress? Is Alhelor - the Black Wolf - dead? I don't think a single soul within Port Llast has stopped to take breath.
I can only hope that your appearance here suggests that you have heard our pleading, and that you intend to end Alhelor where we could not. Tell me, is my hope proven true?
Putting an end to all this... to this curse that has plagued us in the form of the Black Wolf. I do not know why this creature has chosen to live amongst us as Alhelor, but his evil must be stopped.

How many have died, or had their lives destroyed because of him? Geth, Bran, Urth... as well as the noble knight, Sir Karathis. I will permit this to go no further... find Alhelor and end his life, I beg you!
It has been a dark day for Port Llast, but you have reminded us that the sun rises yet again. For the champion of Port Llast, here is a token of our gratitude.
I know I don't have to worry about your success with this; you're a strong and noble <man/woman>. Find Alhelor and bring me his tooth... I am eager to see this grim tale done with.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh? Ah... of course, of course. Here, I had some gold bundled aside, but it would be better spent going into your pockets. Forgive us for withholding this paltry sum.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> The people of Port Llast can only give so much. To ask more of them would be... please, be content with what you have.
Port Llast is indebted to you <brother/sister> <FirstName> - our brave champion. Travel safely, and know that our thoughts are with you on this journey of yours.
Here, take this. It is something I had bundled aside for other purposes. Don't argue, just take it and be appeased. We would not anger our brave champion.
A shining, valued member of the community is now lost to us; our thoughts must be with Bran at his passing. Still, do not let our sadness affect your resolve. You've done well.
It's always sad to see someone part from this world, especially when that someone, Geth, was such a fine young man. The world will be safer for your heroism, however.
Oh! The children's blood has stained these rings. They are... dead? Forgive me if I... thank you, my <lord/lady>... you have done only as you were told.
It's said that if but one life can be spared, then we have all been touched with luck. Port Llast will give its love to young Urth, both in remembrance, and to honor your deeds.
It's said that if but one life can be spared, then we have all been touched with luck. Port Llast will give it's love to young Geth, both in remembrance, and to honor your deeds.
It's said that if but one life can be spared, then we have all been touched with luck. Port Llast will give it's love to young Bran, both in remembrance, and to honor your deeds.
Any day that is touched with death must be a sad one, as it is for Urth. Truly, however. we are blessed to have witnessed two lives kept from that same death by your able hands.
Any day that is touched with death must be a sad one, as it is for Bran. Truly, however. we are blessed to have witnessed two lives kept from that same death by your able hands.
Any day that is touched with death must be a sad one, as it is for Geth. Truly, however. we are blessed to have witnessed two lives kept from that same death by your able hands.
What wondrous luck has been shown to Port Llast! What a wondrous hero to come to our aid! You have survived, and brought the children from death with you!
You needn't worry about Bran. His situation has already been handled. I thought you might have known that already...
Thankfully, Geth's situation is one that has already been resolved. You need not spend your time worrying about his matter any further.
Urth has, mercifully, already been taken care of. You'll not have to spend any time looking into his situation.

The trouble was from no pack of wolves, however... it came from a creature much more powerful and cunning: a werewolf. The famous hunter, Sir Karathis, was sent for with orders to slay this "Black Wolf" as we came to call it.
Or perhaps you need assistance before you can attempt this daunting task. If there is anything Tyr can do to assist our brave champion, you need only let me know.
Truly! I had little doubt that you would do well. Oh, Port Llast is lucky indeed to have you in its midst.

According to Ander, the three other boys were wounded but had managed to flee. I fear that this means the curse of the werewolf will have been passed onto them. If the boys are not found and cured or... or killed... we could very well be facing even more danger than from the Black Wolf alone.
If you care to speak with him, you'll find him at the Alliance Arms Inn. Mind, however, that he's probably still shaken up from his experiences.
If you care to speak with him, you'll find him at the Alliance Arms Inn. Mind, however, that he's probably still shaken up from his experiences.
Praise be to Tyr! You have done very well, indeed. We are all indebted to you for this: a life restored and a threat pushed aside.
Praise be to Tyr! You have done very well, indeed. We are all indebted to you for this: a life restored and a threat pushed aside.

If only all of this were over with. Sir Karathis remains at large... as does the Black Wolf, himself. The task yet remains to track them both, <brother/sister>. You will, of course, be rewarded once again when that is done, I assure you.

Slowly, however, we became aware. Several of our citizens disappeared without any trace... and always on the night of a full moon. Wolf prints were found, the howling was constant... we thought the town besieged.
If you need curative scrolls or potions of different sorts, they are the steel of the finest priests...
And though it pains me to trouble you with my persistence, persist I must if I am to find a hero. Have you considered what we spoke of earlier? Of how you might be of assistance to us?
My <brother/sister>, you've returned! You have been more successful, already, than we have right to hope for, but hope we do. Now, what word do you bring?
Have you a need, then, my <brother/sister>? I shall help however I am able.
My <brother/sister>! Word has come to us that you have found the knight, Sir Karathis. Tell me, how did this meeting go? What have you learned?

Port Llast is seeing its mysteries resolved - the werewolf forms of Urth, Bran, and Geth are no longer. But still - there's no news on Karathis or the Black Wolf. Is there anything you know, my <brother/sister>?
I have no fear that you will do well in this endeavour. Time might not be on our side, but luck is. I know it.
Allow me to explain this to you in better detail, my <brother/sister>. Karathis is the brave knight who sought to slay the Black Wolf, a fierce werewolf who was the bane of Port Llast.

Sir Karathis brought along several of the local young men to aid in his quest, but they were all defeated and afflicted with the werewolf's curse. Only Ander escaped this fate and fled home to spread its news.
Fortunately, the curse that has afflicted the lads has finally been ended. There has still been no word of Sir Karathis or the Black Wolf, however. Where either might be found I have little idea.
If you find out anything at all, my <brother/sister>, bring the news to me and we will go forward from there.
Truly, I speak this story gladly! Why, Port Llast has recently been graced with the most glorious of luck in this regard. Unfortunately, the story begins in tragedy.
The scourge of Port Llast, the fierce werewolf known only as the Black Wolf, was hunted down by brave Sir Karathis and several of the local young men.
Though their adventure turned sour with all but Ander transformed into werewolves, new heroes came and saved the day, as it were.
The youths found their werewolf forms destroyed, as did Sir Karathis. In the end, Port Llast's own Alhelor was unmasked as the Black Wolf!
Luckily, Alhelor, the "Black Wolf," was slain, bringing Port Llast to peace once more. I tell you, my <brother/sister>, luck has been on our side!
I know it may seem strange to you, my <lord/lady>, but the temple within Port Llast was actually destroyed during the Time of Troubles, when the gods themselves walked the face of Faerun.

We had retreated to a cave far from the town, hidden well enough that we could carry on our Lord Tyr's orders in safety. For our efforts he blessed us with the portal that still connects us to the town and consecrated this new place.
We are no longer in danger in Port Llast, of course, but this hidden temple still serves us well. At the very least it is a safe haven should trouble ever arise again.
Why all this deceit, "Black Wolf?" What was in it for you?
Trickery! Prepare to die, Black Wolf!
Care to barter for your life, betrayer?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> If you're the Black Wolf, why did you run that store?
Black Wolf is big liar! How come?
Me no kill you. We make deal, yuh?
You die now, Black Wolf!
That sounds fair.
Sorry, I'm not interested.
Yuh, that sound good.
Ha! Me change mind, wolfy...
Can I buy some anti-lycanthropic goods from you?
Me wants buying some anti - um... anti... goods.
I would like to ask you a few questions.
Me wants ask some stuff, yeah.
Anti-lycanthropic goods? Is that what you sell here?
What means you an-ti-ly-can... um... ? You sell that?
Goodbye.
Why are you so dedicated to eradicating werewolves?
Why you want all werewolves slain?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> But why would you focus on werewolves alone?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'd know if your goods worked well with a free sample.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me gets one free, see if goods is okay?
Have you any jobs that I might perform?
Me wonders if you can hire me for stuff.
Perhaps you could help me with directions.
Me is needing for directions to place.
Do you know of any rumors in town?
You listens for rumors?
Can I ask about that expedition? About Sir Karathis?
Me wants knowing about Ander and werewolf and Sir Karathis.
Neurik sent me here to get some equipment.
Me comes from Neurik to get wolfies.
Let me ask about something different.
Me wants asking different thing.
Can you remind me of this?
Me needs remembering again.
Tell me what you know of this Black Wolf.
What you knows about Blacks Wolf?
Don't worry, young Ander, this will work out yet. Everything happens for a reason, it does.
Thanks so much for helping me, Alhelor.
Alhelor, Port Llast's only Anti-Lycanthropic Merchant, at your service! Come one, come all - defend yourself against the legend of the Black Wolf! Ha!
Mind the place, will you Ander? I am an old man, grown tired, and I should go home to catch my rest.
You have a keen nose to have tracked me here. I suppose I should welcome you to my den...
I am heading home for a bite to eat. Feel free to join me if you wish.

It was required to throw the trail away from me. A stranger, come from out of town to offer assistance? What better disguise than this? Plus it gave me the chance to develop a slow resistance to wolfbane.
We wolves are predators. It was simply time to hunt the hunter and pin my crimes upon my prey. I had played possum with Karathis long enough...
You show cunning. I like that... a simple tooth to prove my death and we both walk out of here alive?
As always, it is a pleasure doing business with you.
More questions, then? Curiosity killed the cat, remember...
I am an old and cunning wolf, my friend - not one to die so easily.
Ah, the questions of fools. Do you not realize who you face?
Craft but no conscience, will but no wit... You are an interesting one, <FirstName>.
If you have come to prove the death of the Black Wolf, I have already lost one tooth to the cause and do not care to lose another.
Why, yes. The best that you'll find for slaying werewolves, such as the Black Wolf. The more werewolves that are slain, the closer we come to realizing their eradication.
Anti-lycanthropic. That just means that my goods will put an end to any werewolf that you come across... Like the mighty Black Wolf, for instance.
Why shouldn't I be? Are they not destructive, unnatural beasts? Do they not corrupt human beings with their disease? This Black Wolf, alone, has been a terrible scourge to Port Llast.
Need I explain my every action to you? These creatures are formidable beasts... and the common people must be armed to fight them! Making a profit is the least of my worries.
Beyond that, you don't need to know, <sir/madam>. I have given you my reason, and now you will give me my peace.
Of course, let me show you what I have.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> There's no reason for you to doubt the quality of my goods but, if it pleases you, take this. I guarantee you'll be back for more.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sorry, but this is a business and my reputation is impeccable. If you're going to hunt werewolves, you'll need to buy the supplies.
Yes, of course. But let us not take up too much time with talk, for business has been quite strong, lately. Everyone's worried about the Black Wolf!
Truly, there's a rumor alive within these very walls. We've the young Ander, here. He and his band traveled out with the brave fool Sir Karathis to slay the Black Wolf.
But of that expedition, only Ander here lives to tell the tale. The rest are cursed to howl forever at the moon!
You would be better off asking young Ander. He could tell you first-hand what I could only collect from discussions.
Ah, good of Neurik that. You can never be too prepared when going up against werewolves. Would you like to buy something?
Aside from that which I have already told you of regarding the werewolves and young Ander here? No, nothing new.
Jobs are scare to come by. I have enough work for myself and Ander, here, but little else to dole out to those in need. For that, I am sorry.
I have not lived within Port Llast for very long... I came here only once I heard the tales of the Black Wolf, after all.
Perhaps young Ander can help you find what you need, yes?
Yes, and farewell to you. Keep to yourself and you'll be safer for it.
Ahhh, now that is a story, indeed. The Black Wolf is a legend in these parts: a powerful werewolf who has been about for many years, stealing children and slaying lone travelers.

Go north toward Luskan until you reach the Green Griffon Inn. The den is nearby, due east of it in fact.
I'll never forget that location for the rest of my life, and I likely will never visit it again, either.

Not long after we set up camp, Karathis came out but as a werewolf. I was so scared! I can still see his face so clearly... I couldn't help but run. We all ran. I'm the only one that... got away. The rest are probably beasts now, too. Or dead.

All right. What did you want to ask?

I... I suppose there's no harm in talking about it, if Neurik says it's okay. He said that I should try to forget about it... stop thinking about it so much. I don't know. I try. Sometimes I feel kind of normal, and then -

Karathis wanted some help, so me and some friends volunteered: Bran, Geth, and Urth. We didn't think there was any real wolf, anyway, and Karathis' coin was good. Together, we... began the hunt for the Black Wolf.

Not long after we set up camp, Karathis came out, but as a werewolf. I was so scared! Even now I can see his face so clearly. I couldn't help but run. We all ran. But only I...

I heard that Bran was cured already. I wanted to talked to him about it, I still do... I just...
Geth was in the Neverwinter Wood. I'm not sure where he is now. Either way, it's okay because he's been cured already. That's what I've heard, anyway.

We found wolf tracks and followed them to a cave. Karathis went in while we set up camp. It's just outside of Luskan, that cave... in the hills east of the Green Griffon.
It was a cave just outside of Luskan, in the hills east of the Green Griffon.

All I can see are those eyes looking out from the cave, and there's that feeling of knowing something is wrong - total fear. Anyway... Karathis was a werewolf hunter, and he came here to hunt the Black Wolf! That's what we call Port Llast's werewolf.

Well, our selection of goods run the gamut, being as that we're the general store for the good town of Port Llast. As well, my smith over there can show you a wider selection of weapons if you wish. Why don't you take a look yourself?
Not a problem, mate. Not a problem at all. If you want to see a wider selection of arms and armor than those that I have here, be sure to check with my smith.
Uh... okay! Moving right along!
Sometimes I hear stories about an area, sometimes I don't. Though when I do, it's usually about a place like the Neverwinter Wood, Charwood, or even Luskan sometimes.

Apparently the townsfolk have been but phantoms for some time now, all reliving some past horror.
An adventuring group stopped by to re-equip and mentioned that someone had poisoned the Spirit of the Wood out that way.
Not a peep coming out of them woods, so far as I were to say, though I haven't spoken with many who'd been through there.
They didn't say how the trouble got resolved, just that it's all been dealt with one way or another.
Aye - word is that there were a great conflict betwixt the High Captains therein, and much disruption to the trade routes.

Some adventurer or another were for traveling within the securities of the High Captains, and ended it with bloodshed.

A brave hero like yourself might be finding a way to exploit that situation to his own benefit, and resolve the problems therein at the time.
Actually, Ballard goes out that way now and then. You might want to talk to him. He's in the northwest section of Port Llast. You'll find him in a small grove of trees.
Well, I heard word from a merchant friend about... well, what am I saying? I wouldn't want to get my friend in trouble, repeating tales meant for my ears alone.

Fine, I see I will never have any rest from the likes of you. Come at me, then, and end this!

An intruder! Die, fool!
Haha! Oh my, all of this fighting and you don't even have a reason to kill me. And here I thought you were a bounty hunter.
