So you know about me. It appears that, try as I might, I cannot escape my past and I will never have freedom.
Truly, you do not know? Well, far be it from me to tip my hand too early! And rightly said, I wouldn't worry over it if I were you.
Do you even know who I am? Do you even care? No, I can see that you don't. Come at me, then, and end this!
Are you serious? Will you not even allow me the chance to explain myself? Will you not even allow me the chance to live on?
Do you understand the effort it has taken for me to get to this point, to have lived even this long? And you would come and slay me with no consideration?
Now, whatever the reasons that brought about our conflict, let us put them to the side and continue on our merry way. Sound fair?
Well, that seems rather blunt. But who am I to quibble? And who knows? Perhaps you'll see my story delivered to a bard, if you aren't one yourself.
I was locked away in prison many years ago. I will not defend my past, and yes, I understand what I did was despicable.
Not that I really cared. I did it, it helped me to get by... So I escaped prison.
Perhaps, if I could, I'd go back to my old life, perhaps I'd start over anew. To me, it matters little. Just to be free from that prison, so I thought, would be the difference.
Truly, you are a curious one. You seek to know every detail, it seems!
In prison I met up with some other inmates. A half-breed led them by the name of Yesgar. Like me, they were looking for a way out.
The others were named Stirge, Zor, and the prissy Wyvern. We all had our tasks. I was to deal with the guards.
We all escaped without a hitch. We escaped the most secure prison in all of Waterdeep! Even if you decide to kill me where I stand, I will be remembered for that.
Surely by now you can have no further questions. So tell me, have you made a decision as to what you will do with me?
You won't find me so easy to kill!
Perhaps you feel a kinship with me sister. It often seems like this is a man's world. No matter, let me continue with my story.
Perhaps there is something else you desire about me, besides my pretty little head. No matter, let me continue with my story.
You must be weary from all your travels. There are certain skills I possess that you might find quite invigorating.
Come now, you know what I'm getting at. We're already here in my bedroom...
I knew you'd come around. There's nothing stopping us, we could start right now.
Here, let me help you get out of all your gear.
Now it's time for some fun.
But not the kind that you expected fool! Now you die!
Another thing is the bounty on my head. I'm sure that the bounty notices specify that only my ear needs to be brought back.
Haven't you caused me enough trouble?
Sign up for what?
I'm not here to apprentice for anything.
Bite your tongue, old man.
Are you sure? I'd really like to sign up.
Er... signs for what?
Me not here to apprentice.
You bites tongue, old man!
Is you sure? Me really wants to sign up.
What kind of guild is this?
Who are you?
I'd like to ask some questions.
I need some directions.
I'll be going.
Who you?
You says this place is guild?
Me have questions.
Me need directions.
Me go now.
I am <FirstName>.
Pleased to meet you. My name is <FullName>.
You don't need to know who I am.
Me <FirstName>.
Me be pleased to meet you. Me name <FullName>.
You no needs know who me is.
What's the problem?
If the reward's right.
No, I'm not interested.
What is problem?
If me gets coin enough, sure.
No, me have no interest.
Can you train me?
Do you sell arms and armor, then?
Can I hire one of your mercenaries?
Let me ask you something else.
You train me maybe?
You sells weapons and stuff?
Can me hires a mercenary from you?
Me asks something else.
Is there a good inn nearby?
Is there a decent store in town?
What temples are nearby?
Is there a druid grove in the area?
How do I get to Luskan from here?
Can one get magical supplies in town?
Is good inn near?
Me need good store.
What temples close?
Me gets magic stuff around heres?
Is druid grove around, maybe?
How me get to Luskan?
I have one of the ears.
Me gots ear.
What have you heard about the plague in Neverwinter?
Do you know of anything odd in the area?
I'm looking for work, if you know of any.
I have some questions about the bounties.
What you hear 'bout sickness in Neverwinter?
You know about strange stuff going on?
Me looks for work.
Me has questions about escaped guys.
How much are the bounties?
Just how dangerous are these men?
So I would have to bring back their ear?
Yes, I'll do it.
No, not interested.
How much is bounties?
How bad is these guys?
So me would brings the ear?
Yes, me do it.
No, me have no interest.
Tell me about Zor.
Tell me about the Stirge.
Tell me about Wyvern.
Tell me about Delilah.
Tell me about Yesgar.
Zor's ear.
The Stirge's ear.
Wyvern's ear.
Delilah's ear.
My mistake, I don't have anything.
That Zor-fella's ear.
That Stirge-guy's ear.
That Wyvern-guy's ear.
That Delilah-gal's ear.
Oops, me no have nothin'.
Thank you, that would be fine.
Me okays with that.
I was glad to rid the world of the vermin. I need no reward.
Me happy to kills bad guy. Me need nothin' for it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Surely the town's safety is worth more than that.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Town safe, now. That's worth more golds, maybe?
Add more gold to that, or loose convicts will be the least of your problems...
You adds more gold, or me be worse than bad guys!
No, not yet.
Not yet me don't.
Not yet, no.
Me no find them yet, no.
What bounties are you talking about?
Who are you?
Who you?
Uh... me know of no bounties.
Why don't you and your men get her back?
Do you know where she's being held?
And what might my reward be for doing that?
Very well. I'll do it.
No. Not interested.
Why you and soldier guys not go gets her?
You knows where daughter is?
What I gets if me saves her?
What about bounties? Me has ear.
Okay, me do it.
No. Me have no interest.
Tell me what happened again.
Where do I find her?
I'm sorry, Kendrack... but Shaldrissa died. I tried my best.
No, she's dead. Them's the breaks.
I'll go look for her now.
Find her yourself. I have other problems.
You tells me what happen again.
Where does me find her?
Me sorry, Kendrack... but Shaldrissa dead. Me try hard.
Nope, she dead. Is bad luck, me guesses.
Me go looks for her now.
You finds her. Me have big problems of me own.
Eh? I suppose you're here to sign up, <lad/lass>, are ye? I've no time for a new apprentice, however, so off ye go.
For the bloody mercenary guild, of course. Isn't that why ye've come? Hmmm... unless ye're not here for training.
Hah! Ye've got a bit o' venom, I'll grant ye that. It won't get ye into the guild any quicker, though.
Aye? Young wits like yerself who want t' join the guild are a copper fer a dozen, these days... though ye does looks in good shape, there.
Nay? Then what's a young wit like yerself come to the guild for? Ye on official business?
Aye, aye... but I've enough lackwits about to fill the guild's roster, I don't need another. Hmmm... though ye do look in fine enough shape fer it.
Wait... now I've placed ye. Ye're one o' the folk who came with the Lady Aribeth, aren't ye? From Neverwinter?
My apologies, <lad/lass>. We get so many strangers comin' through town these days, after all. Something I can do for ye?
Me name be Kendrack, head of the guild, here, and mayor of Port Llast. Also known as the First Captain. Yer name be, then... ?
This be the mercenary guild. Here I train fighters to hone their skills, and we see to hiring them out.
Aye, I'm sure I can tell ye what ye need to know.
I know Port Llast well. Ask away.
Aye, goodbye.
Farewell to ye, then.
I wish ye the best o' luck on yer quest, <lad/lass>.
Aye. Ye does know what a guild is, I hope? I train mercenaries here, <lad/lass>, an' then we see that they gets hired out.
Aye, I think I recall the Lady mentioning ye now. She said ye be a hero, in fact... which makes me doubly glad ye're here.
Aye... the Lady mentioned ye. She said ye be a hero... though I find that a bit hard t' imagine. I be glad ye're here, however.
The mysterious type, are ye? No need... I seem to recall the Lady mentioning ye. A hero, she said, an' perhaps I should be glad ye're here.
Mayhap not, friend, but I seem to recall the Lady mentioning ye. A hero, she said. I be doubly glad to meet ye, then.
I have a problem someone competent like yerself might be able to help with... an' there's coin in it for ye, to boot. Might ye be interested?
In such a short time, it would benefit ye little, <lad/lass>. An' besides, as I already said, the guild be full.
Nay. If ye wishes such, go an' speak to Haljal at the Cracked Anvil. He would have all ye need, I assure ye.
Aye, if ye wish. Ye would need to speak to them yerself, however. They decide for themselves an' sets their own prices, after all.
Aye, of course.
Aye. The Alliance Arms is a fine inn, and ye'll find other adventurers like yerself there, this time o' year.
Haljal at the Cracked Anvil should have just about everything ye need, <lad/lass>.
The only temple in town is Tyr's, <lad/lass>. Your Lady Aribeth be there, as is Father Neurik.
Aye, if ye wish. Them Cloakwizards have built an enclave here... 'tis a strange place, but Eltoora caters to wizardly folk.
There be one off in the Neverwinter Wood, aye. Ye may wish to speak to Ballard about it... ye'll find him at his little grove just outside o' town.
Take the road north, <lad/lass>. They say the gates be closed tight due to the sickness in Neverwinter, however... an' they'll not let ye in.
Do ye need t' find something else?
Only that it be over, <lad/lass>. A mighty relief that news was, as well... folk were terrified that the plague would spread to town.
Aye, we be getting reports of all kinds o' strangeness in the region. Monsters rampagin', bandits traveling about at will, that sort o' thing.
It is most strange. I suppose maybe it's to be expected, though... neither Neverwinter nor Luskan has the manpower for patrols right now, aye?
If ye're askin' about odd things in Port Llast, hmmm... maybe ye should speak to Nuirek at the temple. I hear the cleric has grave worries as o' late.
That be too bad. 'Tis a bit of a worry for me that I'd like t' see resolved soon. Let me know if ye change yer mind, <lad/lass>.
I received word from Waterdeep not long ago that a group o' criminals escaped from the Bulwark prison. Dangerous bunch, killers all.
According to the word, the group be split up to avoid capture... but all of them be in this region. That makes me nervous, it does.
Each o' them has a sizeable bounty for their left ear, marked with the seal of the Bulwark, to prove that they be dead.
'Tis too dangerous a task to set me own men to it... but perhaps ye might be up to the challenge. What does ye think, <lad/lass>?
There be five criminals escaped, and a bounty of 300 gold pieces exists for each of them.
Not all be men, in fact... but all be quite deadly. If ye finds them, be careful. At least they be separated, now, and not all together.
Aye. They be not wanted alive, any longer. The seal of the prison on their ear identifies them... and it be easier than carryin' the body.
T'is a relief to hear that, <lad/lass>. If left free an' alive, these criminals would become a problem, I am sure. I hope ye finds them all.
The five be named as follows: Zor, the Stirge, Wyvern, Delilah and Yesgar.
I'm sure ye do. What do ye need t' know?
Zor be a minotaur, so he should stick out wherever he goes. He be strong and a fierce warrior... but is a wee bit simple in the head.
I am told that he has many friends still in Luskan. It may be that he will be there, or at least attempting to enter the city.
The Stirge be a strange one. A gnome thief, it is said, who believes himself t' be the smartest man alive.
The gnome were sighted last in the wildlands along the South Road, though he could be anywhere there.
The Wyvern is an elven man, a renowned bandit who is familiar with the ways of the wood. He be deceptive and cunning, and skilled with the bow.
The elf has not been sighted, but I have little doubt he be hidden within the Neverwinter Wood. Best search for him there.
A female halfling who is known to be cruel and wicked. She be an assassin who comes out of Luskan.
I hear the city be closed up tight, however, so I doubt she'll be there. Last word I have of that one is that she was spotted east of town, and then all but vanished.
Yesgar be a fierce half-orc murderer, and it were he that masterminded the escape of all of these criminals.
Of all the ones that have escaped, 'tis Yesgar who has remained the most elusive. I have not a clue where he might be... though he will not stray far.
Aye? Ye found one of the convicts? Which ear do ye have there?
Aye. 'Tis indeed the markings that the men of the Bulwark told me of. Congratulations, <lad/lass>, ye've done a service fer us all.
I'd be pleased to offer ye the bounty for it, then.
Ye've certainly earned it. Have ye any o' the other ears?
Well, I hope ye finds them bastards soon. Something else I can do for ye, <lad/lass>?
That is... very commendable of ye, <lad/lass>. I see the Lady's tale of yer heroism is no fable. I will pass along word t' the Bulwark... ye has our sincere thanks.
Might ye have another of them ears in yer pack?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ye be right. Me coffers be small, but I will add what I can for yer reward... ye did earn it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Aye, I wish I could, <lad/lass>. The gold the Bulwark sent to me is all I can spare, however.
Don't ye even be thinkin' of threatenin' me here, <lad/lass>. I'll add a bit onto the bounty because ye deserved it... but don't ye start any trouble.
Aye, <lad/lass>? Something I can do for ye? Has ye business with the guild?
'Tis good to see ye again, <lad/lass>. Have ye had any luck tracking down the bounties?
Greetings. Ye're one o' the heroes Lady Aribeth brought here along with <CUSTOM1007>, aye? Have ye had any luck with the bounties?
Ah... I would have assumed that <CUSTOM1007> would have told ye about it. Are ye not together?
I received word from Waterdeep not long ago that a group o' five criminals escaped from the Bulwark prison. They be called Zor, the Stirge, Wyvern, Delilah and Yesgar. Dangerous bunch, killers all.
According to the word, the group be split up to avoid capture... but all of them be in this region. <CUSTOM1007> agreed to hunt them.
'Tis a fair bounty for their left ears, proof o' their death. If ye has questions about it, I can certainly answer them.
My name be Kendrack, head o' the guild, here, an' head of the town. Mayor, if ye will. 'Tis I who told <CUSTOM1007> of the bounties.
Thank the gods you've come! While ye were gone from Port Llast, that fiend of a half-orc, Yesgar, kidnapped my Shaldrissa!
He demanded a ransom for her return, and it was paid! But still he did not return her! Please, I beg of ye... get my Shaldrissa back! She is my only child!

I... I could not endanger my daughter, and I would not trust me men to do it, if the truth be told. You, however, are a powerful <man/woman> who has done so much... I would trust you. You may be her only hope!
Aye, I do. The old Port Llast mines are to the north o' town, near the Green Griffon Inn. He holds her there, I am sure of it.
It is a treacherous place, and easy to defend, which is why I dare not approach. I can only hope ye have the skills I don't.
Reward? Ye can keep the ransom, if he has it. Just get her back safe, I beg ye!
The gods have mercy! Here... allow me to give ye the bounty money. At least it be good to know Yesgar has none of the other killers with him in this.
I... I suppose I cannot blame ye. It is very dangerous. Here be rest of the bounty for the ears.
I beg ye to change yer mind and find her. Shaldrissa is hot-headed and impetuous because she is young... she doesn't deserve this fate at the hands of a murderer.
I should have known ye would not do it. Not enough gold for ye, is it? Here... take the ear bounty, if that's all ye care about.
Go to the old mines by the Green Griffon Inn to the north of town, then. They are locked and you shall need this key. Hurry, <lad/lass>, hurry!
What is the word? Have you found my daughter? Is she safe?!
Get away from me! Some hero ye are... my Shaldrissa lies dead because of ye!
Leave me be, <lad/lass>. We have nothing to talk about.
Shaldrissa is safe and returned! I cannot thank ye enough! Ye truly are the hero the Lady told me of!
I wish ye good luck, <lad/lass>. Hopefully ye finds what ye're searching for.
The last of those escaped convicts, that murderous half-orc Yesgar... he has kidnapped my only daughter, Shaldrissa.
I already paid the ransom he demanded... but still he has not returned her. I fear for her life! Please, I beg ye to save her!
I be sure she's held at the old mines. Ye can find them north of town, near the Green Griffon Inn.
Please hurry!
Go on, then. Leave the poor lass to die, heartless wretch!
Dead? But... but how can she be... dead?
She... is... dead?
Ye killed her yerself, no doubt! Bah! I cannot believe I trusted ye! My Shaldrissa... dead!!
She... I thank ye for attempting the rescue, anyway, <lad/lass>. I suppose it could not be helped. Now, please... leave me be...
And ye stand there, not caring a whit about it. No doubt ye killed her yerself! Go on, get out! Out! I don't need to lay eyes on ye further!
I... I can scarce believe it. And ye throw it in my face, uncaring. Go, then, and leave me be. I do not want to see ye.
The girl is shaken, but otherwise she is all right. Perhaps this will serve to curb her desire for adventure, now, aye?
I wish I had more to reward ye with. If ye found the ransom, please do keep it... and as for whatever quest the Lady put ye on, I wish ye the best of luck.
Now please! You must help me find my daughter!
Here, take the bounty for Yesgar.
Stirge? You're one of the escaped criminals with a huge bounty on his head!
Stirge? You have huge bounty on head. Me want that money.
A baby killer? In that case, I'll have to kill you.
Baby killer? Okay, me kill you den.
Do you say that to everyone?
Me wonders if you always say such stuff.
Wait. What were you even a prisoner for?
Why you was prisoner?
Okay, how did you get out?
Me asks how you get out?
I'm done talking to a baby killer. Defend yourself!
Me done yapping to baby killer! Die!
So you went to the other inmates?
What kind of talent?
And what did you contribute?
Your escape hasn't been a success yet.
So now what?
All right, let's play.
Can you give me an example of how to play?
Okay, me play then.
Uh, me need example of how to play.

Hurry up and give your ear gnome!

All right, how did you get out?
Me takes bait. How you get out?
Why should I listen, gnome?
Why me listen, gnome?
You gets help from other inmates?
What kinds of talent they got?
What your role in escape?
You still trying to escape. No success yet?
Me wonders what now?
Stirge? You're one of the escaped criminals with a huge bounty on his head!
Stirge? You have huge bounty on head. Me want that money.
Why would you tell this to a stranger?
Me wonders why you tell such stuff to stranger?

You are correct, my friend. But tell me, before you decide to kill me, isn't there the slightest bit of curiosity in you? Four convicts, locked away in Waterdeep's most inescapable prison... yet here we are!

Not so fast! After all, it isn't my death that you want, but rather the proof of my death. If you had read the bounties posted the length of the Sword Coast, you'd know that you need only my tattooed ear as proof.
Of course! Always say the most unexpected things because it puts the enemy off balance.
Do you want to know how I got out of prison? Because I'd love to tell you. It really tells you something about teamwork these days!
I thought we got past the introduction phase already... remember, I say 'Greetings, I am Stirge the baby killer' while you stared with vacant eyes. Can we move on now?
I was just about to tell you. Glad to see that flicker of impatience in the air between your ears.
I found myself in prison, rather unfortunately. I wanted to get out so I can go back to doing what I do best.
I realized that escaping this Waterdhavian prison was said to be impossible, so I knew I would need help achieving the impossible.
Yes, indeed. Aren't we a quick study? Someone woke up refreshed this day! So yes, I worked out a relationship with Zor, Delilah, Wyvern, and Yesgar.
I knew they would all be interested in escaping, and unlike the others, had the talent to do so.
The only kind of talent! The kind that works together. Zor was a big brute! He could pull down gates or smash through doors!
Delilah's poisons helped us to "incapacitate" many of the guards within the prison. And Wyvern was able to call to the animals to further our escape.
He used them to deliver messages, create distractions, and even to help us shake off the guards from our trail. It was very exciting!
Me? I helped to put it all together. Mine were the brains that put the plan together, and got us all working in unison... Well, me and Yesgar but he's just the figurehead, there to inspire loyalty.
Oh, but it has! No one ever escaped from that prison! We were the first. We made it out the door. We can get caught now, after the fact, but it doesn't change anything. We escaped.
Now, we play a game. You beat me at it, and I cut off my ear and give it to you, because that's all you really want, isn't it? The bounty you'll get from my ear.
If you win I'll tell you where Delilah is and give you my valuable ear. If not we will settle this with blades.
I hope you are worthy of the challenge. Let us begin.
Let's see... Let's start easy. My word is Darkness.
Sorry, Light is the opposite of Darkness.
You lose. That means I shall neither bargain for my ear nor offer clues about the cold Delilah. On your guard!
Wind blows through the Darkness but does not defeat it.
No, the Shadow is part of the Darkness but does not defeat it.
Rock? Gosh, I don't even know how you came up with that one but it definitely doesn't defeat Darkness.
Nay, the Fog may settle in the cool belly of Darkness but it does not defeat it.
Yes, nothing like a warm Fire to hold back the Darkness. In that case, my new word is Water.
Ah yes, the Candle holds back the Darkness, if just a little bit. My new word, then, is Wind.
The Sun shines through the Wind but does not defeat it.
Aha! A well-built Wall shall keep the Wind from any home. In that case, my next word shall be War, which topples many Walls.
But Peace is the opposite of War, I'm afraid, and therefore does not qualify.
If anything, it is War that defeats the Armies, not Armies that defeat the War.
Ah, even in the outer planes, the demons and Angels make constant War. Noble as they may be, they have not defeated War itself.
Rock? I won't even hazard a guess as to what you're trying to say with that.
Nay, as long as warriors revel in the slaughter, Joy shall not defeat War.
Aye, only true Goodness of the heart, shown equally to all the world, is sufficient to defeat War. My new word is Evil.
Wait! What have I done? I spoke the opposite! Fie, I have lost at my own game!
Come, let me tell you of Delilah, then, and tear off this offending ear that I might buy my life.
Okay, while I - ow - cut this, let me tell you what I know of - ow - Delilah.
She's a poisoner, so watch her - ow - blade. Yesgar got her hired onto some caravan that passes east of town so she could lay low there for a while.
How true! The Sun's bright orb, while it creates Darkness by its shadows, also defeats it with its glare. My new word, then, is Clouds.
Interesting. If Darkness is a metaphor for unhappiness, then Joy certainly defeats it. My new word, then, is Tragedy.
Ah, Summer is a time of few Clouds but it does not defeat them.
Aye, the Wind can tear apart the Clouds. But what can beat the Wind? I think I stand defeated, my friend.
Lightning is the angry daughter of her mother Cloud. While tempestuous, she does not destroy the one who birthed her.
We just established that the Cloud defeats the Sun. If so, what you suggest cannot be true.
Rain is born of Cloud but, in its falling, it does not negate its mother.
Rocks and Clouds have very little to do with each other, I'm afraid.
Clouds often form at Sea so, surely if the Sea creates them, it cannot be said to defeat them also.
Aye, even on a Cloudy day, one can tell the difference between day and night. Daylight surely is the victor there.
My new word, then, shall be Nightfall - But wait! The two, in truth, are opposites and I have lost at my own game!
A Ship may use the Wind to fill its sails but the Ship does not defeat it.
A Bird may fly upon the Wind but the Bird does not defeat it.
Ah, a ship at Anchor drifts not with the vagrant Wind. In that case, my new word shall be Rust.
How true. All the Wind in the world cannot keep a falling Rock aloft. In that case, my new word is Frost for it shatters even boulders.
Nay, the Sky looks down upon the Winds but does not defeat them.
Indeed, Friendship is a tie that binds but that has little bearing on the Wind.
Really? How quaint!
But it is Water that helps the Rust corrode.
Ah, but the passage of Time simply causes more things to fall to Rust.
Lightning conducts through metal, be it Rusted or no, but it does not keep the Rust from continuing its slow corruption.
Aye, Fire can heat the Rusted rod but it cannot stop that Rusting once it starts.
How wise. Aye, 'tis Oil that soaks through to the core of Rust and binds it to its source. But I grow tired of this game.
Why does everyone always want to answer Rock!? A Rock may remove Rust's larger flakes but it does not cut short its progress.
Nay. By the time the Summer comes, the Frost has already long since been defeated.
Far from it. Delicate Flowers are oft laid low by morning Frost.
Ah, a well-tended Fire shall destroy the Frost about it. My new word, then, is Water.
Hmm. I believe we just established that Frost defeats Rock. How do you propose that Rock might take its revenge?
Nay, Ants hide themselves from the Frost for they know it means their death.
Ah, Mittens may keep the Frost's bite from your fingers but they will not stop the Frost itself.
Nay, for Laughing at Tragedy does not make the situation any less tragic than before.
Aha! Comedy is the opposite of Tragedy!
Ah, how wise. Only through Grieving can Tragedy be overcome and life continue on renewed.
Alas, I know not what might defeat Grieving. I do believe you have defeated me this day.
The Sun shines down on Tragedy without compassion. I'm afraid it does not defeat it.
Nay, many respond to Tragedy with Vengeance but Vengeance simply begets another Tragedy and so the cycle does repeat.
You are clearly a fool, my friend, though it would be a Tragedy if a falling Rock were not to put you out of your misery right now...
If Tragedy defeats Joy, as we have just established, then Joy cannot defeat Tragedy.
True, Justice can right a wrong and heal the wounds left by Tragedy. In that case, my new word is Zealotry.
True, Compassion from his enemies can calm the Zealot and rid him of his zeal. But I grow tired of this game.
Nay, 'tis Faith itself that creates the greatest Zealots. Do not paladins take zealous action on the basis of their beliefs?
Nay, 'tis Force that breeds Zealotry all the more. Make a martyr of a single man and a hundred of his followers rise up in his place.
Ah, some are not Destined to be Zealots but others are. Destiny is impartial in this matter.
You've been wanting to say that for some time, haven't you... It's wrong, you do realize that? *Sigh.*
Nay, an Educated Zealot is simply a more articulate one. Education does not negate the Zealotry itself.
Well I might say Darkness. If you said Light, you'd lose because that's its opposite. You could say Candle, though, to which I could say Wind.
Nay, the Cold may freeze the Water but the Water is still there come spring. It has simply changed its form, not been defeated.
The Sky looks down upon the still Waters with little care.
Very true indeed. The Sun can dry up the Water, leaving only salt behind. My new word, then, is Clouds.
Nay, Life was born in Water, consumes Water, and excretes Water. If one could defeat the other, they would not have lived so long together.
The Wind may form ripples upon the Water, or even crashing waves. While it whips the Water into a greater frenzy, it does not defeat it.
In truth, this one is in close balance but, with time and patience, it is actually the Water that wears the Rock.
Even more so than ourselves, a Fish requires Water for it to live. Why should the Fish defeat the Water and thereby go without?
Aye, the Dam stops the flow of raging Waters and thus defeats it. But, as a Flood can overtake the Dam, Flood shall be my newest word.
Ah, but Flood and Drought be opposites!
Aha, a Ship can ride out the Flood and thus defeat it... But I grow weary of this game.
Ah, Fish may revel in the Flood or die from all the silt that it upturns. But little can they do to stop it.
Haha, cry all you want. Tears will simply trickle toward the Flood and add to it their salt.
Ah, a Flood can tear even Boulders from their place and roll them along for miles.
Ah, the fates and sages may predict a Flood or cataclysm but Destiny, herself, will not avert it.

My good <boy/girl>, I have a reason for everything. After all, it isn't my death that you want, but rather the proof of my death. If you had read the bounties closely my friend, you'd know that you need only my tattooed ear as proof.
Surely you are interested in finding out how I, Stirge the baby killer, escaped from the most secure prison in Waterdeep.
Surely you have thought that there was more to it than this... five inmates escaping the Waterdeep's most inescapable prison... aren't you curious how we did it?
If you'd spare my life and listen to what I have to say, I'd be willing to cut my ear from my head and give it to you as proof.
There is no other choice but for me to concede.
That's all I know. If it's all right with you, I'm going to take my leave of you now.

If that were not enough, I'd also be willing to tell you where to find some of other escaped prisoners. They are as dastardly as I, and are worth the same reward. Come now; listen to what I have to say.
If you'd spare my life and listen to what I have to say, I'd be willing to cut my ear from my head and give it to you as proof.
If that were not enough, I'd also be willing to tell you where to find some of my companions. They are as guilty as I, and are worth the same reward. Come now; listen to what I have to say.

Ah, a worthy opponent! Greetings, I am Stirge the baby-killer, recently escaped from hard time in Waterdeep! My four fellow prisoners and I are now among the most wanted criminals along the Sword Coast.
Why shouldn't I tell you? It's important that you realize I'm not some simple farmer bumbling about a rotted out tree stump! I am Stirge the baby killer!
You are correct my friend. I am one of the only living beings to have escaped Waterdeep's most secure prison. But before you do anything rash, please hear me out.
The game we'll play is the oldest game of all. I will give you a word and you must respond to it with another word that can defeat the original without being its opposite.
Please, leave me be.
No deals. I'm here for your death.
Me not here for talk, but for death. Your death!
Who are you?
Me not know who you is.
Why did you ambush me?
Why attacks me?
I intend to claim the bounty on you.
Me wants kill Wyvern for bounty!
Actually, I don't care to know who you are. Let us fight!
Me not care. Me just want fighting.
Why were you originally imprisoned?
Why you gets in prison in first place?
Why should I listen to anything that you say?
Me wonders why you think me need hears this.
I want your ear, Wyvern.
Me just wants ear.
Enough talk, Wyvern. It's time for you to die.
Stop talking! Me kills you! Now!
How did you escape?
You don't wish to die and you want to make a deal?
You want live? Make deal?
That's nice, but I'm here for the bounty.
Me just wants bounty. Me not care about all this.
So be it. I agree.
Me likes deal. Me says sound good.
Agreed, but only if you help me find the other escapees.
Me does this if you lets me know where other criminal is.
No deal, you disgusting murderer! I'll kill you now!
You sick murderer. Me kill now.
How you is escaping?
What do you propose?
You want make deal?
Go on.
What happened?
You were captured?
Your crimes sicken me! Die!
You bad bad man! Die!
You have kept your end of the bargain. Go into the wilderness and never return.
Okay now. You go now and no come back.
I think I've decided to kill you anyway.
Me not care. Me kill you anyway.
I surrender!
You have made short work of my creatures. 'Twould not be wise to let you do the same to me.
Ha! It seems another fool has taken my bait! Kill them all, my creatures!
If it must be this way, I shall not fall easily! Die!
Please, you must help me!
I have already lost a fellow ranger to the animals in this place. He lies just down the southern path.
Wyvern, formerly a 'guest' of the Bulwark Prison in Waterdeep, at your service.
It was nothing personal. I thought that you might be a bounty hunter looking to kill me or take me back to that hellish dungeon.
I would sooner kill myself then go back to that horrible prison! For ten years I felt not the sun on my face nor heard the call of wild. I am a ranger and for me, it was truly hell.
Now I am free and back where I belong. I want nothing more than to be left alone and never again shall the rank stench of so-called civilization assail my senses.
I was born in a forest to the east. My father was a ranger of some renown and he taught me to love the forest and all of the creatures within it. Life was idyllic, though it did not last.
There is a bounty on myself and the four who escaped with me. Hear me out and perhaps you may profit from it.
I escaped with the aid of other inmates Yesgar, Stirge, Zor, and Delilah. Typically, they were not the type I would associate with, but I was desperate to escape.
I could not stand being in that cell, locked away from nature. I don't regret my actions and did not deserve to be caged.
Indeed! This need not end in battle. Perhaps you'll allow me to make a suggestion? The bounty is for my ear.
I'll give you my ear if you'll allow me to leave. Tell them I'm dead, and let me become a recluse. I'll go into the wild and never return.
Here, this arrow tip be sharp enough... Szzhgah, that stings... There, a single ear. Don't spend it all in one place.
Then I'll get it over with. This arrow tip be sharp enough... Szzhgah, that stings... There, take the ear and claim your bounty.
As for my partners, I barely spoke to most of them. However, I do know that Zor is an idiot and has likely drowned himself in an ale barrel at the Green Griffon Inn. It was to be his first stop.
Now, if you don't mind, I've got a poultice to prepare for where my ear used to be.
I will not be returned to that prison. If I am to die, it will be right here, amidst the trees. Come kill me, if you can!
I do not wish to die. The bounty requires only that you bring back my ear. I can also assist you in finding one of the other escapees.

Men came to the forest. Human mercenaries on leave from their employ with the lord of the human lands west of the forest. They burned part of the forest, slaughtered the animals for sport, and crucified my father on a tree when he came to speak with them.
When my father did not return, my mother went to search for him. I found her dead at the foot of the tree where my father hung. She had been... brutalized before they killed her.
My father still lived and had watched, helpless, as my mother was killed. He died in my arms and I swore vengeance.
I hunted them down. One by one I found them and killed them. I killed their families. I killed their dogs and their horses, stupid beasts that remained loyal to these men despite what they had done.
When the human lord brought his forces against me, I disappeared into the woods and picked the men off with arrows until the survivors were so afraid of the forest, they called it haunted.

I was betrayed by one of my own. A ranger who they hired from the west. He tracked me down and would not listen to reason. He talked of innocents killed and vengeance gone too far. He did not understand.
I was captured and taken to the prison. There was no trial and only through the intervention of the ranger was I not killed outright.
But that was many years ago and the rage has long since faded. My father was avenged and I only wish to travel the wilds and never see another settlement again.
I thank you for my life. Farewell.
You have what you want, just leave me be.
I'll let you go if you can help me find the others.
Then here's the end. Let's fight.
There is honor in what you have done. Killing you would be a shame. You should leave this area though.
Me lets you go if me gets help finding others.
Me makes story end then. Me kills you.
You have honor, so be bad to kill. You leave area now and be safe.
Me confused. Who you be?
Me gots time. Me listen and think on what to do.
Zor? You're one of the criminals with a huge price on his head!
Zor! You have huge price on head. You criminal.
Sounds fair so far. I'll think about it. What's your story?
I understand... and I'll listen.
Okay. Me listens. You talk.
It's not that complicated, Zor. This is to the death.
Me not like think so much. We just fight, yeah?
Sounds like a good life, so far.
So what happened in prison?
What happen in prison?
I think I've heard enough, convict. Time for you to die.
Me hears enough, criminals. You die!
What about the others you mentioned?
What happened then?
What come next?
I've heard enough, criminal. Time for you to die.
You talks too much. Time for you to die.
What about others? You tell me.
I've heard enough of this convict. Time for you to die!
Me hears enough, criminal. You die!
Me think this all good thing.
Stop dragging this out. It's time for you to die, criminal.
Me not want talking. You criminal. You die!
I'm lost. Who are you?
Fine, I can accept that. Just tell me your story.
Me think sound fair. You tell story.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Ha! Why, Stirge told me how to find *you!*
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Ha! Stirge tells me how finding *you!*
No help from you means no deal from me.
Me not gets help, me not makes no deals.
Forget it. Let's just fight.
Me not care about this. We just fight.
Wait! We stop fighting now! Me sees you brave warrior. Me wants talk moment before we fights more.
You strong opponent! Me impressed! Me say name is Zor! Me tell you story, yeah? You spreads my word, maybe, before you kill me?
Me know where Stirge is, 'cause Stirge like to brag lots. We not like Stirge, so me will tell you where he hidden. Stirge go to south road close to Charwood.
You not under-estimate him, though. He small, but smart. Now, for us: we should fight. Me want to see if me can defeat you.
Me see you same as all other bounty hunter. Fine, we fight. Me show you me not die easy! Me die with pride!
Me see noble warrior spirit inside you. Me thank you for not making fight with Zor go beyond. Me know you see strong warrior, too. Me say farewell.
Why you break into my room! You be bounty hunter! Me end you life here!
Me is fierce warrior of minotaur peoples! Me is strongest warrior of all, and proves self in combat after combat. Then, me becomes gladiator for moneys.
Yes me criminal. Me have big price on head. But me respect you, me want chance to tell you story of me life. Then we fight.
Me think it good, too, at first! But me gets tricked! Me fights and wins, every time, and makes people mad.
Me not is realizing me trying make people happy. Me just think me should fight and win. Not wanting lose to weak opponent.
Me told to lose, make other people lots of money. Me not lose, me kill other fighter. Me sent to prison for this.
In prison, me meet new friends, friends who no trick me. Me friends named Stirge and Delilah and Wyvern and Yesgar.
Yesgar great man! Yesgar have orc blood. He plan how to escape big prison. He need me for strength.
Delilah use poison on guards and Wyvern trick guard dogs. Wyvern really good with dogs.
Stirge make maps of prison. Me not like Stirge. He call me lots of names.
After escape we split up. Yesgar say we harder to find that way. Now me see bounty hunter everywhere. Me kills all, but you is tough. Me not killing you. Me want to make deal.
Me tells you me story, and then me makes sense to you, okay? Then you decides what we do. Me be honest with you because me respect you have warrior strength.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Stirge does? Me thought... fine! Me tells you where Stirge is, but you listen first, okay?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Me not believes you. Me knows Stirge never tells where me is. Me not know how you find me, but Stirge not it.
Hmm... me not wanting die like this. Me tell you story, and if you listen, me reconsider telling you thing. Okay? We still fight if you is wanting.
Then we is fight. Me gots respect, but me not die easy. You come, we die glorious - maybe together! Ha! Come fight!
If you kill me, me worth big reward. Me want you to get reward, not some weak bounty hunter.
What kind of wares do you sell here?
Can I see your merchandise?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
What you sell? You sell wares?
Me want to buy stuff.
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
Have you heard anything about werewolves near Port Llast?
I'm looking for work. Do you know of any?
I need some directions, actually.
You knows of werewolves, yeah? In Port Llast?
Me needs job. Needs making money. You help?
Me need directions.
Good. Tell me more.
Me likes. Me wants more knowledge, though.
What are these tomes? What do they do?
Me not know why you is wanting tomes.
Not interested, but I have another question.
Me not care. Me gots other question.
Yes, I have one.
Me gots reagent. Here you goes.
No, I don't have one.
Me not gots reagent.
What is a reagent?
Me not know. What is reagent?
Actually, can I ask a question instead?
Me rather asks question.
<StartAction>Offer fire beetle's belly reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer bodak's tooth reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer ettercap's silk gland reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer rakshasa's eye reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer slaad's tongue reagent.</Start>
I'd rather not offer a reagent.
Me wanting keep reagent. Me not give.
Can I ask about something else?
Me gots different question.
What would I have exciting news about?
Me not know what you say. Exciting what?
Can you remind me about that job?
Me needs reminder what me agreed to.
I have one of the tomes you seek.
Me gots tome. You want, still?
Can you remind me about that tome-recovery job?
Me needs more refreshment 'bout tomes job.
<StartAction>Offer Tome of Fire.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer Tome of Ice.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer Tome of Life.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer Tome of Death.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer Tome of Resonance.</Start>
I have another tome to offer.
Me gots more tome for you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Surely you can provide me with more than that.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me can get more golds, huh?
Should I beat more money out of you?
Me can beat more gold from you, yes?
I'd rather not part with the tomes just yet.
Me thinks me keep tomes for now.
Yes, I think that would help.
Me wants refreshment, yes. Tell again, please.
Where could the Tome of Fire be?
Do you know where the Tome of Ice is?
I need more information about the Tome of Life.
Help me find the Tome of Death.
Do you know where the Tome of Resonance is?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I would need a lab.
Me gets Tome of Fire if me knows where is.
Me want to knows where Ice Tome is.
Where you thinks Life Tome is?
Where me find Tome of Death?
Where me look for Res'nance Tome?
Who is the Arcane Brotherhood?
What be this brother thingy?
Where is his tomb?
Where me find grave?
Where might I find Saer Bodkin?
Saer Bodkin be where?
<StartAction>Offer skeleton's knuckle reagent.</Start>
Welcome to the shop, as I like to say. I am Eltoora Sarptyl, and not a finer collection of wares are you apt to find.
Why, I sell only the finest assortment of magical goods. Truly, you will find no better collection than mine.
Yes, this will do quite well. Come, let us take a look at what we have to offer you then, shall we?
What I sell? Hmm... do you always speak like that? Pardon me, I shouldn't be rude but my curiosity got the better of me.
You may as well spill the question, and I'll see if I can figure out an answer for you.
Well, okay then... we'll toss aside everything else, shall we?
I wish you a good <quarterday>, <sir/madam>. Please come back again.
A good <quarterday>, <sir/madam>. Come again.
Yes, yes. Goodbye. Come again.
Yes, I have heard something. A knight - was it Sir Karathis? He was looking for someone to help him slay a werewolf, I think.
To be honest, that may have happened a few days ago or more; I pay little attention to such things. Is there something else?
Well, well, well. I do indeed have a task for you. How do you feel about recovering some old tomes for me?
Scattered about the region are the Five Tomes of Ancient Imaskar. I want you to find these tomes, and return them here to me.
Well then, let me see what I can do to explain this to you, okay?
Well, I'm sure you can find someone else to help you out there... Unless you're looking to know where I keep a chair or somesuch.
Alas, I don't show my rare and valuable goods to just anyone who is curious. To look at the goods, you must give me a magical reagent. Do you have anything that might interest me?
Which reagent do you have?
I could have sworn I told you about a job already, and that you agreed to do it. Do you want a refresher?
Well, hello. Have you exciting news for me, or is this just a routine visit? Either way, I'm pleased to see you again.
Why, the tomes of course! Have you found any? You do remember agreeing to look for me, don't you? I still remember offering a lot of gold for their return.
That is most excellent news. Please, let me see what you have. Oh, this is so very exciting!
Well, the Tome of Fire! That will be a nice addition to my collection. Thank you very much, and now for your reward.
Ah, the Tome of Ice. Another fine work to add to my collection. I thank you for this.
Oh, this shall be an exciting tome to page through, I would say. This makes me happy indeed. And for you...
Well, what an exquisite book. I've always thought death was such a beautiful, misunderstood thing. This book shall serve as my center piece.
Well, well, the Tome of Resonance. Though I hoped otherwise, I felt certain I would never see it amongst my collection. You have my admiration, and appreciation.
This should keep you quite happy indeed, I would think. Don't you? Now, tell me what else I might do for you.
Truly? Of course, of course. Don't let my appreciation stand in the way of new additions. Let me see what you have.
Well, that's more than fair. If you want anything for that tome, however, just come back to me.
The five tomes that I want you to find are the tomes of Resonance, Life, Death, Ice, and Fire.
The Tome of Fire has been a tricky one for me to locate. My scrying attempts reveal that it is far to the south, but I cannot see where specifically.
It would make sense that the tome was within the Charwood. Though I know not why, that realm resists my scrying. If it were anywhere else, I think I could locate it.
Do you require more information about the five Tomes of Ancient Imaskar?
Near here but to the south, you'll find a tower. Within that tower, you shall find the Tome of Ice.
Of course, the owner of the tower is a powerful wizard in his own right, and you should be cautious in your approach.
This tome was in the possession of Brother Toras, a member of the Arcane Brotherhood. I had planned to buy it from him, but he died before I had the chance.
I checked around when I heard he was dead, but it wasn't amongst his personal possessions. The only place I haven't searched yet is his tomb; I simply haven't had the time.
Like the Tome of Fire, my scrying tells me that the Tome of Death has followed the long, dark road into the Charwood.
If only I could see more, but the region is impervious to my efforts.
My scrying has shown that it was originally taken east into the Neverwinter Woods.
Perhaps if you go to the Neverwinter Woods, a clue or two will reveal itself.
The best way that I can explain their purpose, with brevity, is to compare them to recipe books. These books explain the crafting of magical items.
If you return these books to me, I'll allow you to use them to make your own creations. If this does not interest you, I will of course also offer a suitable reward.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> The tomes are rare indeed. Fine, I will give what I can, but do not ask for more.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> The tomes might be rare, but I cannot afford to give away all that I have for them. Be happy with what I have given you.
That'll teach me to underestimate someone. You have proven most useful, indeed. Well, what else do you have?
There's no need to be threatening me. And while I'm not sure you realize the risk in doing so, if it means that much to you...
Here is some more gold. Do not expect me to be so kind again. Now, do we have further business, or were you leaving?
I've warned you about threatening me before. Truly you are foolish to press your luck, but not foolish enough to be rewarded with further coins.
Count your blessings that I do not have the guard summoned. Now, do we have anything more to discuss?
Well, I'd rather not let you take a look at my goods if it's all the same. My shop, my rules, if you'll excuse me for saying so.
Well then, I suppose you'll have to trek out and find some then, won't you?
A reagent is an ingredient, if you will, that allows one to cast advanced magic. I'm always looking for good stuff, but here's a specific list.

Find me a fire beetle's belly, a bodak's tooth, a rakshasa's eye, a slaad's tongue, a skeleton's knuckle, some quartz crystal, fenberries, fairy dust or the silk glands of an ettercap. I'll be satisfied with any of those things.
Then you shall have use of my own. Why not speak with Saer Bodkin about this. He might even provide you with some ideas of what you might make.
Come now, you can't be serious. You don't know of the Arcane Brotherhood? They are located in Luskan, and they are the true power in that city.
Their ruthless tactics are infamous, and the only thing that has stopped them from major expansion is the constant in-fighting and bickering they do.
Being wealthy and powerful, I would imagine he had his own mausoleum outside the city walls of Luskan.
Just be careful. Brother Toras was a powerful wizard and might have some deadly traps or guardians protecting his tomb from grave robbers.
Why, he's right through the portal behind me. Don't worry about popping in on him, as he enjoys the company.
If you can do this, then I will reward you far beyond the value of the books. Of that, you can be certain.
Tell me about item creation. How does the Tome of Imaskar work?
I need to purchase some reagents.
Eltoora gave me the wardstone to her treasury. Where is it?
It's time for me to leave.
Me need ree-ay-jents...
Me make use of Imaskar book, yuh?
Okay, me done here.
Eltoora give me magic rock for treasure...
Saer Bodkin? Who are you?
Me not know what "Say Bumpkin" is. You tell?
Can I ask you about something?
Me asks question about other thing, yuh?
Secrets, secrets, secrets! Mistress Eltoora says I should help you and so I do, hmm?
Secrets, secrets! Saer Bodkin can help you, hmm?
Ah, a friendly face! So much nicer than Mistress Eltoora's! But that's a secret between us, hmm? She's so nice, too!
It's mathematical! One and one makes two, or something new perhaps! Place your goods into the box, and then see what comes out. Just be careful of what you place within.
Sorry, someone else is using it right now, hmm? Wait in line, wait in line.
For use with the Tome, hmm? I might have other things you'd like as well, yes.
You want to know about Kermit, Mistress Eltoora's potted plant of holding, hmm? If you have the wardstone she should open quite happily for you...
We are here to serve, hmm?
You and magic strikes me as a scary proposition, hmm? But perhaps you have the dragon's blood in you, though, yes.
Here comes trouble, so they say. Luckily I am but the scribe, safe within my bubble, hmm?
No, no, no, you misunderstand! The stone is not your treasure, hmm? It's simply a key. But, to the point...
Nothing can I do for you until you get the books, hmm? Go on, go on, I have no time to talk of them. Eltoora will tell you all, yes?
The goods you want within, that will bring the most without, hmm? Stick with skeleton knuckles, fen berries, quartz crystals, fire beetles' bellies, and ettercap silk glands.
So, tell me then, what can Saer Bodkin do for you? Are you here for reagents, or something else entirely? Ooh, do tell!
It's Saer Bodkin, you understand. It's a name, just like yours - whatever it might be, though ridicule it I will not, hmm?
I'm Eltoora Sarptyl's assistant. I help her out with whatever wizardly duties she needs me for, hmm? In return, I can access all of her magic.
Eh? What are you talking about now? I'm not a one to care about what goes on about the world, if that's what you're implying.
And I'd thank you kindly to take your questions elsewhere, hmm! Yes? Ask me questions, or buy some reagents now, will you? Not being rude, am I?
Who are you?
I'm here to kill you. That's the only way.
I have some silver charms. Will you use one?
Me musts know who you be, yuh?
Me gots to kill you. No offense, huh?
Me gots silver charms. Fix you up, all good!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> These are cures. They'll restore you.
I'm here to kill you or cure you. You pick which I do.
Prepare yourself for death then.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You want get fixed, yuh? Take this.
Me kill or cure you. You picks, yuh?
Me kill you, stop this plague, yuh.
Who you gives ring to?
You gave your ring away? To whom?
How did you ever become a werewolf?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I've been sent to end the werewolf menace. If you give me your ring, I will leave and no one will come searching for you in the future.
I'll go find help for you. Just stay here.
Me gets help, yuh? You stays here!
Uh, wha' happen to you?
Just give me your ring.
What happened to Bran?
Did Ander survive? Where is he now?
Is Geth all right? Do you know where I could find him?
Where is Sir Karathis now?
What happens to Bran, yuh?
Where Ander went? He okay?
Is Geth still alive? Can you help me find him?
Where Sir Karathis be?
Let us speak of something else.
We talk 'bout something else.
Why have you come here? My parents told you to leave, didn't they? Did they also tell you how horrible this is? Can't you just leave me alone?
Now that this ordeal is over, I think I need a vacation. A long one. Farewell and thank you!
Death can be no worse than the fate I am living. Kill me, if you must, but do not be surprised when I fight back!
Why not just kill me outright? Why ask me to do it myself?
My name is Urth, and I've been infected with lycanthropy. That's why I'm hiding here, so no one has to see - this.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Cures? To be honest, I'd rather die with hope than without. Give me your charm.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Look, just leave me alone, will you!?
Though I always thought that I'd rather die fighting, I'm tired of fighting. Fine, give me your charm, and I shall die with hope.
Have you come for my ring? You're too late. Someone else has it. I gave it away already.
I gave it to some adventurer. I was told that people would stop bothering me this way. My death could be faked, and then no one would care about me anymore.
It - It worked, I can feel it. Thank you so much. Here, take my ring and bring it to Neurik so he knows I'm all right!
You'll tell everyone that I'm dead? Maybe then people would leave me alone, stop looking for me or making fun of me. My parents could have a normal life.
Fine, here it is. You should probably give it to Neurik. Tell him that I'm dead. Maybe this can all go away.
Where else would I go? I'm surprised my parents even let me come back...
Sir Karathis lost in battle to the werewolf, and, as a werewolf he hunted us down. He couldn't help it. I don't blame him.
Sir Karathis rounded up myself, Geth, Bran and Ander to help him hunt a werewolf. I was very excited for the adventure, and eager to join.
Bran? I don't know... I know he was poisoned like me, and became a werewolf. But other than that?
Ander may have escaped, he may not have. I never saw him again.
Geth? I didn't see where he went, but if I were to guess, we used to play just outside Luskan, by the Green Griffon Inn.
I don't even care about Karathis. I don't blame him, either. But I have no interest in that matter. I just feel - numb, about it.
Don't hurt me anymore! The wolf spirit is gone!
Grrr - Please! - Grrrrr - Can't control... Myself!
I need to go.
What did you want to talk about?
That's why I'm here: I've seeds that need planting.
I need to go now.
Me have seeds to plant, yuh?
Yuh, me go now.
How about if I give you some extra gold then?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> What if the druids helped tend your farm?
This tree is getting planted even if its roots have to feed on your corpse.
What if me gives you extra gold?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me gets druids to help you care farm?
Me plant tree, even if over your dead body, yuh?
Fair enough, just thought I'd ask.
Sorry, me just askin'...
Here, 300 gold, then. That's six good years.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> How does 200 gold sound?
Sorry, I don't think I have enough gold right now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Uh, 200 gold good?
Here, 300 gold. That like... um... two years worth?
Uh, me no have enough gold right now.
Who are you?
Who you be?
What do you do here?
What you does here?
I was sent here by Archdruid Aawill.
Me gets sent here by Archdruid Aawill.
This isn't your land, though.
What kind of work do you have to do?
Me wonders what you got doing?
Me doesn't thinking this you land.
Where does your property end?
Where you property ended at?
I'm sorry. I didn't know.
Me never knowed that, no.
I'm sorry, but there's some worry that the forest is suffering.
Me sorry. Me just hear others worry about forest.
Listen buddy, I'm planting these seeds to protect the forest.
Me sent protecting forest. Me needs planting seeds!
Now how did that tree get there? That thing's going to wither my crops with its shade...
Howdy, stranger. What can I do for you?
Why them's be forest seeds. I run a farm, not an orchard, <lad/lass>! Why are you wanting for planting them seeds on my land, anyways?
Yeah, well... you get a move on, then, all right?
Well, it depends on what kind of deal you're offering. I might pull in 50 gold a season, but then where am I next season?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> All right, if it means that much to you that you'd dip into your own pocket like that... you can plant your trees here and I won't come closer.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm afraid not, pal. This here is good soil and it would take more than that to make me leave it.
All right, if it means that much to you that you'd dip into your own pocket like that... you can plant your trees here and I won't come closer.
Harrumph. That's what I thought. Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got work to do. Like I said, I can't sit here all <quarterday> talking. Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, so long as I ain't need to be paying them anything. Shoot, they can come over here and do some quick magic, I'm sure we'd both be benefiting.
All right. I guess it won't pay for me to be thinking on this too long. You can plant your seeds here. You just make sure them druids come through, or I go back to chopping.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> And who's saying that I even need the help? Well, doesn't this just beat all? You come here from out of the who knows where trying to plant them seeds of yours.
Whoah, calm down, Nelly... I don't take kindly to threats. I suggest you back off now before you get yourself into trouble.
Aye, that tree ain't so bad after all. It's got some bees nestin' in it and they spread the pollen about quite nicely.
Why, I think I might even get into a little bit of the honey business on the side...
O'Deel's my name, since you're asking. And it's a pleasure to make your meeting, I'm sure. Now, you'll excuse me if I don't set to talking, what with the work I got.
Well, what do you think? This is my farm, and I've got work to do. That forest is getting closer and closer to my fields, and it's got my outer crop at risk.
Look, it seems you're here to start trouble, and I don't want none of it. I avoid them druids, 'cause more often than not, they got a problem with me.
Tell you the truth, I just want to be left alone. I'm a simple man and I ain't got much problem with no one. All right? So if you'll leave me alone...
Why are you coming out here trying to start trouble about this being my land or not? I take care of this land, and I ain't never seen you before.
Well, what do you think? I got farming to do. This land ain't going to get tilled and seeded without me putting that effort in.
Well, I'm not sure that matters to you, does it? Why are you asking so many questions like that?
Yeah, well, now you do. And you'll excuse me if I don't sit here all <quarterday> telling you how I live my life. I've work to do.
Why? For me cutting down some trees? Well, I'll tell you I need to cut them trees down to let me get that sun in here.
I ain't having the time to tend my crops so close to the woods myself, to make up for what the sun ain't doing.
Well, you might protect the forest, but you'll drive me out of business. Well, I'll tell you I need to cut them trees down to let me get that sun in here.
And without the care of extra hours or the sun shining down without the trees blocking it, I ain't making enough money to keep afloat.
I'm sorry if you see me stretching my farm out as bad news to them druids, but this is about putting food on the table for me.
Well, I see mathematicals ain't your strong point, but that's all right. I can see you got a good heart to you.
This money should keep me afloat awhiles if I stay smart with it, so... you got my word that I ain't going to chop at the forest no more.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got work to do... just not around here any more. Like I said, I can't sit here talking all <quarterday>. Goodbye.
Burn, burn, burrrrn! This forest is unclean and only through Kossuth's righteous flames can it be made pure! Burrrrrrrn!
I am Viirda, priest of Kossuth the Firelord. Do not molest me as I must remain vigilant for new growth in this already despoiled Wood...
Yes. My name is <FirstName>. What do you need?
I might be. Why do you ask?
Not right now thanks. Goodbye.
Yes. Me be <FirstName>. How me help you?
Maybe. Why you ask?
No. Me leave now, bye.
I don't like attacking animals, so what am I supposed to do about it?
What can I do to be of assistance?
That doesn't really interest me right now.
Me no like hurt animals. What me do about it?
What you want me for?
Me no interested in that.
I guess I should go check it out then.
Where is the Neverwinter Wood from here?
Are they offering a reward?
I'm really not interested. Thanks anyway.
Me go see what me can do there.
Where be Wood from here?
They gonna pay me?
Me not want to do that. Bye bye.
What were you needing help with again?
Where is the Neverwinter Wood?
Nothing, sorry. Goodbye.
What you need help with?
Where be Neverwinter Wood?
Nothing. Bye bye.
I don't need any supplies, thanks.
Me no need nature supplies.
I would like to see your wares.
Me want see you wares.
Hello there <lad/lass>. My name is Ballard. I am a ranger and I am looking for someone interested in a dangerous mission. Might you be interested?
Welcome back. What can I do for you now?
Well friend, it's not just what I need; there are many lives at stake.
There has been trouble over in the Neverwinter Wood of late. It started with travelers bringing back tales of normally peaceful animals attacking them for no reason.
People's lives are at stake. I hope you change your mind.

There is a grove of druids that are trying to find out what is wrong. The leader is Aawill. He sent three of his best druids into the Wood in search of clues, but nobody has heard from them in a while.

Then farmers and woodcutters began to disappear. The animals have been attacking everyone, even the rangers and druids that are there to help the forest. I fear that without assistance, whole villages near the Wood might be destroyed.

It is possible that the druids have returned in my absence, but Aawill could still use your assistance in preserving the Wood. If you are brave enough, seek Aawill in the grove near the forest's edge.
I hope to hear from you again, when the forest is returned to its natural state. In the meantime, should you need any nature related supplies, I would be happy to show you my wares.
The Wood is to the east of here. Be sure you stop by the grove before you enter the forest proper. Aawill might have some more information for you.
Well, that's not really up to me to say, but I've never known Aawill to be stingy when it came to rewarding other people's assistance.
My friend! You have returned victorious. It gladdens my heart to know that there are heroes like you in the world.
Then Mielikki speed your way <brother/sister>.
Of course.
Greetings, Sir. My name is <FullName>.
Who are you?
Hello, sir. Me is <FullName>.
What your name?
I'll be going.
Me go now.
You look familiar, somehow...
Mmmm... me recognizes you, maybe...
I wonder if I could ask you some questions?
I have some questions for you.
Me want ask something.
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> Elaith Craulnober. I've heard that name before.
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> Elaith Craulnober. Me hears that name befores.
I'm looking for information on the people that started the plague.
Me look for people who starts plague.
Evermeet is closed to you? Why is that?
Why Evermeet be closed? You kicked out?
Do you know of anything odd in the area?
You know 'bout weird stuff 'round here?
Please continue.
I hope this story has a point to it.
Me still listening.
Me get bored.
What is this 'Evermeet' you mention?
You say something 'bout "Evermeet." What that?
So what do you intend to do?
So what you do?
I don't really trust you, Elaith.
Me no trust you.
What kind of reward are we talking here?
What reward if me do it?
Very well, Elaith. I shall help you recover the gems.
Okay... me get gems for you.
I am not interested in this.
Me no care about stupid gems.
Perhaps I could help?
Maybe me helps?
I might help... for the right price.
I coulds help... if price good.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I could get the job done, I assure you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me could gets it done, me knows.
Fine. Do it yourself, then.
Okays. You do it, then.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'd expect some kind of payment up front if you want me to do this.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Okays, but me want coins now, not laters!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Nice story. Unless you want me blabbing it all over town, however, I want some coin up front.
Might you have any equipment I could purchase?
Maybe you haves stuff I buy?
Retired? A real loss to the profession, I'm sure.
Right. You don't look like you're retired.
You retire for true, or you just pretendy retire?
Oh, nevermind then.
Okays, no mind then.
I'll take a look.
Me takes peek.
No, that's okay.
Could I buy some equipment from you?
Me buys stuff from you?
I have been thinking about your offer...
Me be thinking 'bout offer...
Tell me who currently has these gems again.
Say where me finds gems again.
I do have one of the gems right here.
Me has gem right here.
I have the last gem.
Me has last gem.
No, I'll be going.
No, me go now.
Here, Elaith. Take the gem.
Here, you takes it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> These gems were difficult to acquire. I think I deserve more than you're paying me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Gems was hard to gets. Me deserves more than you pays.
I have the feeling you're shafting me. Pay more or no deal!
You cheats me, me knows it! You no gets gem!
<StartCheck>[Threaten]</Start> It'd be a shame if anything happened to your daughter, Elaith.
Fine. Take the gem.
I'm not frightened of you. You get nothing!
Fine. You takes gem.
Me not scared! You gets nothing!
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> Elaith Craulnober. I've heard that name before.
Might you have any equipment I could purchase?
Maybe you haves stuff I buy?
Retired? A real loss to the profession, I'm sure.
Right. You don't look like you're retired.
You retire for true, or you just pretendy retire?
Oh, nevermind then.
Okays, no mind then.
I'll take a look.
Me takes peek.
No, that's okay.
Greetings, my good <lord/lady>. It is rare we see new faces come to drink with us at the Alliance Inn.
Good day to you, then. Perhaps we shall speak again.
Alas, I am no Sir, though you are kind to assume so, <FirstName>. My name is Elaith Craulnober... although a simple Elaith will certainly do.
Your words are a bit forward and brusque - some might even say uncouth. My name is Elaith Craulnober, if you must know.
I was going to invite you to share a drink, but nevermind.
At times like this I do so wish I could return to Evermeet, where grace and courtly manners were the custom, rather than the exception. Alas, that way is closed to me now.
I would be happy to answer any questions from one such as yourself, friend.
You demand answers without so much as a please? Your lack of manners is sure to leave me in a foul mood. I suppose I should not be so picky about my company, however, in a small place such as this.
I see you are rather dim, my friend. Very well, I will try to speak slowly and use small words in our conversation.
Ask me what you will.
I know nothing about the plague - and if you insinuate I am somehow involved I resent the implication. I have only just arrived from Waterdeep, if that makes any difference to you.
I cannot tell you where to look, my slow-witted friend. I have only just come from Waterdeep, so my knowledge of the plague is limited. But perhaps I can be more helpful on your next question.
I was not kicked out of Evermeet! Well, perhaps I was... though I would have found a more diplomatic way to describe the situation.

Obviously, I am one of the elven folk and Evermeet is my ancestral home. I was born there, but left long ago. The way back is closed to me because I have not always been the best of men, you see. Smuggling, thievery - I have my sins, I admit.
I am no longer the reckless youth I once was, however. I have retired from my illegal activities and am now simply weary and seeking peace.

My heart longs to return to Evermeet, to show its beauty to my daughter. She has never even seen the homeland of her own people, you see, and I have promised to take her there one day... though that may prove an impossible task.

I was born in our ancestral home... the last of a proud family. I left it long ago, however, and the way back has been closed to me since because of who I became. I have not always been the best of men in my time, I freely admit it.
I cannot say that I do. I have frequented Port Llast often in the past, but this time I have only just arrived from Waterdeep. If there are things afoot, I have yet to hear of them.
That is certainly an odd way to begin a conversation. I would have expected you to introduce yourself, at the very least. I am known as Elaith Craulnober.
Ah, yes. A smuggler and ruthless adventurer out of Waterdeep? Perhaps you've heard of my little encounter with the Knights of the Shield?
It is of no matter. You heard tales only of the man I once was. I am no longer he, even if you choose not to believe me.
Surely you jest. You are kin and you do not know of the elven homeland? It has been our refuge and the center of elven life since Queen Amlaruil moved the court there.
Evermeet is an island that has become the home and refuge of the elven folk since Queen Amlaruil moved the court there. I am surprised you have not heard of it.

It is a wondrous and beautiful place, if you have never seen it. I, myself, have not gazed upon its forests for a very long time now. As I said, however, Evermeet is closed to the likes of Elaith Craulnober.
Once I might have cut you down for a comment like that. I would ask you kindly not to tempt me.
Do not interrupt me with rudeness. I will, however, keep my tale short to accomodate your attention span.

The one way I may have to return home is through the construction of a ceremonial scepter, gifted to an official in Leuthilspar. It is a bribe, of sorts, but an old and cultural one... and the requirements are very specific.
The scepter must be adorned with five separate gems cut by an elven master craftsman. Difficult to find in Faerun, to say the least.
Two of the gems I have. The final three I have tracked to this area, but sadly their owners are loathe to part with them for any price.
Without them, I cannot complete the scepter and neither I nor my daughter will ever return to Evermeet. A fitting fate for me, perhaps, but cruelly unfair to her.
I intend to get those gems, with or without the owner's permission. I will not give up on my quest now, not when I am so close.
I may just have to hire someone to get them for me, by whatever means necessary. Hmmm... in fact, you seem like someone who might have the skills I need.
I may just have to hire someone to get them for me, by whatever means necessary. Underhanded, perhaps, but I have few options left.
What do you say? Might you be interested in a task that requires stealth and guile? I would reward you well for success.
Hmmm. To get the task done would require someone with skill at stealth and guile. I am not positive you are the <man/woman> for the job.
Perhaps I shall, at that. Good day to you.
I meant no offense, my <lord/lady>. I've sent enough to their deaths, as of late... I'll not be held responsible for another.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps you could, at that. Will you help me recover these gems, then? I can offer an excellent reward should you be successful.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Thank you for the offer. No offense to you, however, but I've sent enough people to their deaths. I'll not be held responsible for another.
If you do know of someone who has the skills I seek, however, do send them my way.
I suppose such mistrust is understandable. I know my hope is a faint one, and I would have given up long ago if not for the promise I made to my daughter.
If you do not do this for my sake, please do it for hers. I have lain the truth before you, there is nothing more I can do or say to prove my intentions. Accept or reject this as you will.
I have no illusions, acquiring these gems is no simple task. If it were, I would have done so myself already. But you seem a capable sort. Perhaps you can succeed where I cannot.

I can offer you this: 200 gold pieces for each of the gems that you return to me. If you bring all three, I will add an additional 400 gold as well as a magic item that I'm sure you'll find a use for.
That is more than the tiny gems would be worth elsewhere if you were to attempt to sell them on your own, I assure you.
You threaten to expose me? I see now you are cunning. Very well, I will give you 100 gold pieces to buy your silence, though not a single coin more!
It is a small enough price to pay, if paid only once. You get nothing more until I see those gems, however.
Eloquent as ever, my pedestrian-witted friend. Such agitation can boil the brain, though in your case it would hardly matter.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Here, take these 100 gold pieces and calm yourself. I have a soft spot for simpletons, and would not have you become so worked up you hurt yourself accidentally.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Say or do what you will, I make no payment until the goods are delivered to me. I have spent far too long as a smuggler to do otherwise.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Nobody else has taken up my offer yet. Until I have someone who has agreed to this mission, I am more desperate then I would like. Very well - you win.
Here - 100 gold pieces. That is all I am willing to give you up front. When you bring me the gems, I will reward you further.
Good. I was beginning to think I would encounter nobody willing and capable of doing this for me.

Let me tell you exactly what you must search for. The three gems are small, the size of a fingernail, but elegantly carved and with many delicate facets. They are light-hued, but will have something vaguely dark in their center.
(sigh) As you wish. Should you change your mind or perhaps know another more willing, do send them my way.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Certainly not. I have already paid an advance for this very task. Refuse or accept, as you wish... I will pay nothing further.

One of the gems is in the possession of Wanev, a local wizard. I suspect the gem is secreted away in his tower, which can be found in the grasslands between Port Llast and Charwood. The tower gates are magically locked and I do not know how they can be opened.
Another gem is held by a fierce warrior woman named Zamithra who passed through several days ago. I believe she said she was bound for Luskan, but she certainly could have been lying.
The third, I have learned, is held by Setara, a witch who dwells within the Neverwinter Wood to the east of here. Contacting her has proven to be quite difficult.
I am in the middle of a drink, but please - stay. I will not have it said Elaith Craulnober has become rude in his later years. What can I do for you?
It is true, I was once an agent for the black market. However, I have long since retired from that profession.
I trust that is all?
I assure you, my thick-skulled friend, I am well and truly retired.
Was that an insult? I'm not even sure, so I'll let it pass. However, to answer your question, I am retired.

But you have to understand, there's retired and then there's 'retired.' Truth is, I may have a few items left over from my heyday that I'm still looking to unload. Nothing much, but maybe you'd like to take a look.
Excellent - I'm sure you'll find my goods of top quality and bottom price.
For you? Certainly. I do not have much, but I assure you it is all of good quality.
Oh? Have you changed your mind? Will you get the gems that I need?
How do you do, my <lord/lady>? Have you had any luck acquiring the gems? Or is there something else you need?
I see. Best of luck to you, then.
I wish I had more information to go on. Hopefully, however, this shall prove enough. I wish you the best of luck.

Ah, yes... the gem that the wizard refused to give up to me. Does the fool still live? No, no... do not answer that. I would truly prefer not to know. Were he intelligent, he would have made the deal I offered.
Here are the 200 gold pieces I promised. Might you have another of the gems on you? Or shall I have to wait?
Ah... the final gem - how glorious! As agreed, I have your 400 gold pieces and the item I promised you right here.
I see. That is the gem that the warrior woman possessed, indeed. She refused to deal with me, but had no problem with you... or you with her.
Ah, good. The witch-woman gave it up, did she? I won't ask what you had to give her in return.
And let me take the gem off your hands. Ahhh, it will be good to return home.
And let me take the gem off your hands. Ahhh, it will be good to return home.
And let me take the gem off your hands. Ahhh, it will be good to return home.
