What are the names of the missing druids?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Maybe you could pay me something in advance?
That's all I need. Farewell.
What be druid's names who be gone?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You give me some gold now, maybe?
That all me need. Bye bye.
Tell me what you need assistance with again.
I would like to help you.
Nothing. Goodbye.
What you need done again?
Me want help you.
Goodbye.
What are the names of the druids?
I think I have found one of your druids.
I have cured the Spirit of the Wood.
The Spirit of the Wood is dead.
What be names of lost druids?
Me found druid.
Me cure Spirit of Wood.
Spirit of Wood be dead.
No. Goodbye.
Is this one of your druids?
This be druid, yuh?
I am happy to have been of service. Thank you for your generosity.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I had to die to save your precious Spirit! I think such a sacrifice should be worth a little more than 500 gold.
You will give me more than 500 gold pieces or maybe I'll set fire to your precious forest!
Restoring the balance of nature is reward enough for me. Give the 500 gold pieces to the poor instead.
Me be glad job done. Thanks for gold.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me died to do job. Me think me life worth more than 500 gp.
You give me more than 500 gold pieces or maybe me burn down whole forest.
Job need done, so me do. Me no need you gold.
I am sorry for nature's loss, but there were no other choices open to me.
Hey, you win some, you lose some. Either way I still expect to get paid.
Me sad that had to kill Spirit, but me had no choice.
What you complain for? Spirit no make animals attack no more. Now you pay me.
I understand. Please accept my apology and my gratitude for what you could give.
Saving the forest is more important than a reward. Take all of the gold and do what you can.
No! We had a deal and you had better stick with it or else!
Me sorry. Me thank you for gold and hope you save forest.
You need save forest. Me let you keep all gold to help.
You pay me 500 gold now, or else.
Is there anything that I can do as a druid to assist the grove?
There be stuff me do as druid here?
Is there anything else that I can do to assist the grove?
There be stuff me do for grove?
Where were the druids last seen?
Where druids be seen last?
Ah, a fellow child of nature. Be welcome here. How may I be of service?
Hello there. All of nature's creatures are welcome to this grove. How can I help you?
I am the Archdruid Aawill and you are <FullName>.
The wind stole your name from your lips and carried it to the trees, who whispered it to me.
Nature doesn't lie to her allies.
Now, how may I help you?

This is a druid grove. Here, those who truly revere nature gather to discuss, to contemplate, to learn, and even to challenge nature. Usually there are more of us here, but several of our members have gone missing.
There are many different philosophies about nature, which we spend time arguing, but right now the topic has mainly centered on the missing druids.
It is a long story, but I sense that you are a <man/woman> of action, so I shall try to be brief.
I am sad to hear that. If you would like to know how you could help restore the natural order, please return and speak to me again.
Until recently, this wood was a relatively peaceful place. The nymphs of the wood protected the creatures and the natural order reigned.
But now something has gone terribly wrong. The creatures have become overly aggressive, attacking anyone they lay eyes on, including those who are considered friends of nature.
We can't even seem to communicate with the animals. It is like their minds have been driven mad. They simply want to destroy.
Yes, nature has her ferocious side, but she has a tender side too. It is that side which seems to have disappeared.
I think that something must be wrong with the Spirit of the Wood.
The Spirit of the Wood is a difficult concept to explain. The forest is not just a group of trees, it is a living being. The Spirit is the protective essence of the Wood.
It has a mind... of sorts... though it really doesn't think like either of us. It cares for the creatures that live here, maintaining the circle of existence that includes life and death.
The Spirit of the Wood can use those who live in the wood to protect its existence. Now it is attacking even those who would be its protectors.

I do not know what is wrong with the Spirit, but it is obvious that it is using the creatures to strike out at anything foreign. I need someone to find out what is wrong, even though the Spirit will surely try to kill that person.
(sigh) Patience is a virtue. Patience is a virtue.
Okay, let me try to explain it like this. Your body is alive and your brain controls your body. The forest is like a body and the Spirit is like the brain.
So, if you want to swat a mosquito, your mind tells your hand what to do. If the Spirit wants to stop a greedy woodcutter, it might tell a bear to go attack him. Understand?
Strangely enough, you're beginning to convince me.
The wood is alive and it's acting in a way it never has before!
Nature is always competitive. We try ourselves in contests against one another, but only druids are allowed to participate in these rites.
As a druid, you can choose to enter a challenge to become a member of the druidic circle. If you are interested, you should go and speak to Jaer. She organizes the challenges.
This is not a responsibility to be taken on lightly. I dare not send someone who is only partially committed to the task.
That is unfortunate, but nature always finds a way to balance herself. I am sure someone of tougher mettle will come along soon.
Then I thank you for your assistance in this task. There are two jobs that need to be done. I have mentioned the first: to discover what is wrong with the Spirit of the Wood.
The second is to find the missing druids. As the druids were on the same mission as you, it is possible that they might be able to provide you with information you need to complete your primary task.
If you can help me save the Spirit, I can pay you 500 gp. For each of the druids you rescue, I will give you 300 gp. Is there anything else I can help you with?
I find your attitude lacking and unappreciative of the importance of this mission. Perhaps if you can gain an appropriate perspective, I could charge you with this trust.
Please return if you do.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose all nature's children have different goals. So long as you remain a loyal servant to he who pays you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You do not have your heart in the right place. I fear I cannot trust you with such an important charge.
Silvanus goes with you my child.
I see that you do indeed have proper instincts for this job. The missing druids include Orlane, Bree and Terari.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose I could give you 100 gold pieces to help you get started. Please take care that you always work toward the best interests of nature.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I can offer you nothing until you cure the Spirit or return with one of the druids. Show your commitment through perseverance.
You have returned. What can I help you with?
Something is wrong with the Spirit of the Wood. Also, some druids are missing. I need help with both problems.
Farewell again.
I see you are back. Have you had any luck?
The druids are Orlane, a halfling; Bree, a human; and Terari, an elf. I hope you find them soon.
Silvanus be with you.
Nature thanks you for all you have done. Go with her blessing and mine.
Steadfast Orlane has returned. It is good to have him back in the circle. Here is your 300 gold, <FirstName>.
I look forward to seeing the completion of your entire mission.
You have done very well, <lad/lass>. With the Spirit of the Wood cured, we can return to our union with nature and her creatures without fear of destruction.
Good luck to you my child. May the blessings of Silvanus go with you.
May the glory of Silvanus shine on your blessed heart <lord/lady>. Nature will surely remember your generous spirit.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you did give your all to the task. I guess I could give you an extra 100 gold.
Here is the 500 gold, as I promised earlier.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> There are more rewards in serving nature than just gold. I have paid you what we agreed upon. Be content with what you are given and nature will reward you with a happier Spirit.
I suppose that nature has both its gentle creatures and its savage beasts. Although I hardly fear your threats, I will give you an extra 100 gold, since this quest has obviously unbalanced you.
Now I have other matters to attend to. I hope you find a way to soothe the beast inside you someday.
Alas, that is a great loss to all of nature. The forest will never be the same again. Was it truly necessary for all to come to this?

Even that is hard to accept. There will be great suffering in the forest without the protection of the Spirit. I can only give you 250 gold, as the rest shall have to go toward helping the forest survive.
With such a callous attitude, I can see I should never have allowed you to enter the forest. I will still pay you, but only 300 gold, as the rest shall go toward helping the forest survive.
You obviously did what you thought you had to. I hope you do better in future endeavors.
I thank you for your concern and generosity. Somehow nature will find a balance and continue on.
Or else what? Will you challenge the might of the entire circle of druids and all the forces of nature we can bring to bear? I think not. Now take your blood money and leave this place.
You are no longer welcome here.
The forest will never be the same.
We were overjoyed to welcome back dear Bree. Here is your 300 gold, <FirstName>.
My dear friend Terari's return was welcomed by the grove. Here is your 300 gold, <FirstName>.
Nature herself is impressed with your abilities. Thank you for rescuing all of the druids. I have great hope for the Spirit of the Wood. Good luck.
If you would like to become a member of the grove you need to speak to Jaer. She sets up the challenges for those who wish to gain acceptance to the circles. Anything else?

The most important task is to save the Spirit of the Wood. Otherwise, if you would like to become a member of the grove you need to speak to Jaer. She sets up the challenges for those who wish to gain acceptance to the circles. Anything else?
They entered the deep woods and that is the last anyone has seen of them. Nothing more is known about their location.
Who says I can't enter?
What terrible death?
Get out of my way or I'll knock your head off!
Who say me no go in wood?
What death be that?
You get out of way or me knock you head off!
Halt there! Ye may not enter these woods, lest ye die a terrible death.
I hear that ye have a contract with the great druid Aawill. Very well then, good luck to ye.
Me name be Dregin and I be guardin' the woods for the great Archdruid Aawill. The creatures of the wood have turned horrible vicious and Aawill has ordered that no one enter without his permission.
I'm just tryin' to save yer bloody life, <man/woman>! Go into the grove and speak to Aawill and if ye still want to throw yer life away, I'm sure he'll let ye pass.
I told ye to get permission from the druid Aawill. I'll not be let'n ye past without it.
Uh, sorry. I didn't mean to stare.
Pretty sensitive for a big lug.
Watch your tone, or I'll show you how unimpressed I am.
Uh, me no mean to stare. Sorry.
Why you upset by me look?
You watch mouth or me teach you manners.
Who are you?
What is this place?
Who is in charge here?
Who be you?
What this place be?
Who be big boss here?
What are you talking about? What kind of circles are you defending?
What you mean you defend circles?
Nevermind. Goodbye.
So can I challenge you?
So me fight you then?
Goodbye.
Is Jaer the one in command here?
Jaer be big boss then?
What kind of trouble is that?
What do you mean protect nature?
What challenges are these?
What you mean protect nature?
What you fight for?
What did you mean by challenges?
What you mean when you say challenges?
What trouble you have?
What are you lookin' at. Ain't ya never seen a half-orc druid before?
Mm. Well be sure that ya don't go and do it again. Now, was there somethin' that you wanted, or are you just a gawker?
You had better watch your smart mouth or I might plant you upside down in the ground and see if you grow into a tree. Har! Now, what can I do for ya?
Har! A <man/woman> with a spine! What an unusual thing. I'm not sure if I want to be your friend or cut your ugly mug off. Har. How can I help ya?
So you're back now. What do ya want this time?
My name is Elgar and I am the first circle defender for the challenges. What else do ya want to know?

I wish you'd ask someone else; I hate explaining stuff. All right. If you are a druid and you want to join this grove, you have to prove your worth in combat. There are four circles of druids in this grove.
Jaer decides when you are ready, then you fight against the fourth level defender. You work your way up through the circles until you reach me. Then you lose. Har!
As I said, Jaer sets these things up. Ya wanna fight, go talk to her.
That's what I always say to my opponents! Goodbye, good night, sweet dreams, and then they fall. Har!
Na, she's just in charge of settin' up the fights.
Aawill is the Archdruid. He's the one to go to if you want to assist the grove with something like the troubles we're having right now. Jaer is second-in-command, in charge of circle challenges.
This is the Neverwinter Wood druid grove. This is where we meet to learn about and protect nature. It's also where we get to challenge ourselves in physical contests. That's my favorite part.
Right. Off with your nosey questions. Go find a big red dragon to chat with. Har!

The creatures in the woods have been acting vicious lately. Like they've gone mad. We could just kill them, but that's not what druids do. So Aawill is trying to save the Spirit of the Wood. You should talk to him if you want more details.
Good to see ya again. That was the best fight I've had in years. Must have been distracted by your ugly face. Har!
What do you mean?
Sure. My name is <FirstName>. May I ask you some questions?
Only if it leads to a city. I can't stand nature.
What you mean?
Okay. Me be <FirstName>. Me ask you questions, maybe?
No. Me no like trees and beasts and stuff.
All right then, guide me by answering some questions.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> What kind of people have guided you in the past?
I don't see why that would be a duty.
You guide by give me answers to questions.
Why that be you duty?
What is happening around here?
What do you do around here?
Who is in charge here?
What going on here?
What you do here?
Who be boss here?
What kind of rumors?
What be rumors?
Thank you. Goodbye.
Nothing. Goodbye.
What do you mean defender?
So can I challenge you?
What that mean defender?
Let me ask you another question.
Me have other question.
Nevermind. Goodbye.
Can me challenge you?
Why are you suddenly so uptight? I was just trying to be polite.
Fine. Maybe you could answer some other questions.
Is that what you meant by guiding me down the right path? Telling me to mind my own business?
Whatever. Goodbye.
Why you get mad? Me just be friendly.
Fine. Then you answer other questions.
That how you guide me? Tell me no ask questions?
What sort of counselor?
What you do to counsel?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I understand, but sometimes it helps to share your pain.
That's okay. Why don't you just answer a different question?
You tell me story.
You answer me other questions.
No. Goodbye.
That's terrible. What did you do?
That happens a lot, especially to foolish people.
That be sad. What you do next?
That happens lots. You be foolish with gold.
What do you mean, the Spirit?
Maybe you could answer some other questions now?
What you mean Spirit?
You answer other questions now?
Thank you for telling me your story. Take care and farewell.
Thank you tell me story. You be well. Bye bye.
Okay. Goodbye.
Hello there. My name is Henna. May I guide you along nature's path today?
I see you have returned. What may I do for you?
Nature has paths that we walk everyday. Some paths are more dangerous than others. Guiding you to the right path is my duty in life, just as others have guided me.
There have been many, including Aawill, the Archdruid and Jaer, Aawill's second-in-command. There have been... others, as well. But that is really none of your concern.
What questions would you like answered?
The biggest problem we face right now is the trouble with the Spirit of the Wood. Anyone travelling near or through the woods is in danger right now. No one is exactly sure what is going on.
I imagine that Aawill, the Archdruid, would know more about it. The most I know is just rumor. You should speak to Aawill if you want the facts.
Be careful. There is always danger and the potential for tragedy on the paths you walk.
Missing druids, evil spirits, angry gods - you name it, people have speculated about it. None of it is worth repeating. You should talk to Aawill.
I am the defender for the third circle of the grove. I also act as a counselor for troubled minds.
If a druid of the fourth circle wishes to advance to the third circle, then they must speak to Jaer to challenge me. If the druid can beat me, then they are awarded a place in the third circle.

That depends on what you want. If you mean overall, then Aawill the Archdruid is in charge. If you refer to the challenges for entrance into the druid circle, however, then you should speak to Jaer. Anything else?

A druid may challenge me, but only if they are a member of the fourth circle and have sufficient experience. You should speak to Jaer if you have further questions about the challenges. Is there anything else I can help you with?
I'm sorry, I shouldn't have snapped like that. You just touched on a sore topic. I just don't like people prying into my past.
Just as I needed guidance in the past, so too do others. I try to assist them when they have difficulties.
I understand. Hearing others' tales can be a burden.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Maybe you're right. You seem trustworthy. I was the spoiled child of a noble family. When I turned twelve I decided that my parents' rules were too strict, so I ran away from home. I knew nothing of the world and all its dangers.

For food, I began to pawn some jewelry that I had brought with me. The first piece brought me more than I had expected, so like a fool I ran out and stayed at an expensive inn, eating and drinking like a queen. The next day I woke up to find everything was gone.
I was living on the street, eating scraps from inns and sleeping in an old shanty with some other homeless people, until Kend found me. Kend was a druid who saw me on the street.

He taught me the ways of nature and how to choose the right path. We spent many years together. He... he died last year and I buried him in the woods. I hope that someone helps save the Spirit soon. I would like to go and visit his grave again.
Yes, I was foolish. But then, most young people are. We make bad choices and we pay the penalty. My path was dificult, but not the worst.
The Spirit of the Wood is causing creatures to attack anyone in or near the forest. You should talk to Aawill if you are interested in helping.
You are very welcome. Come back and visit anytime.
When other people help you out, it becomes your duty to help others. At least that is what others have taught me, and I believe it.
Then you walk a very sad and empty path.
You did very well against me. You have much to be proud of.
He felt sorry for such a young, pathetic looking creature, so he convinced me to follow him and he took me under his wing as his protege. As I got older, I fell in love with him, and he for me.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sorry, but I don't know you well enough to talk about that.
Yes! I challenge fate daily to prove myself worthy.
Uh... sure. I guess you like to fight?
Actually, I think I would rather live in a nice, peaceful age.
Yes! Me love to fight!
Um... okay, if you say. You like fights?
No. Me like peace. Me no like fights.
No. There is a time for fighting and a time for talking, but a wise person knows the difference.
There is very little that one cannot accomplish using the mind instead of the body.
It's small-minded people like you who cause war and destruction in the world.
You keep getting in my face and I'll show you how the strong survive!
No. There be time for fight and time for talk. Me like both.
Me like to be sneaky instead. Get stuff done better that way.
You watch mouth or me knock you on that skinny butt!
You folks cause war and death. Me not like you.
What's been going on around here?
Nothing. Goodbye.
What going on here?
What do you do here?
What your job be?
Can I challenge one of the druids?
All right. Goodbye.
Yes.
No.
I am ready for the challenge.
Yes.
No. I have some questions first.
No. Me want ask question first.
Could you explain the rules again?
Could you tell me more about the person I am fighting?
I'm not ready for a fight yet.
What be rules again?
Me want know more 'bout person me fighting.
Me not ready for fight yet.
Nevermind. I am ready to fight now.
Okay. Me ready for fight.
I will go talk to him then. Goodbye.
Me go talk to him. Bye bye.
Me want fight druid.
Tell me why you are here again.
I be ready for challenge.
Why you be here again?
Yes.
Not yet.
Yes.
Not yet.
Yes.
No.
Yes.
No.
There is nothing like living in dangerous times to test one's strength of heart! Do you agree, stranger?
I see that you are back. Have you defied death and proven your mettle lately?
Excellent! I will buy you a drink later, when I am not on duty. Of course, in the defense of nature, I am always on duty. Ha!
Wonderful! Good to meet a fellow druid with some spine in <him/her>! Nature requires followers that know how to be strong and defend her.
It is the responsibility of one who follows nature. The strong survive and the only way to become stronger is to pit yourself against worthy adversaries.
Bah! And what price comes with peace? Weakness! Life gets easy, people get fat and lazy, then someone with real strength comes along and takes everything. That's how nature works.
Do you really think that everything can be solved by sitting around and hoping problems will just go away?
Challenging the mind is a part of growth. But do not forget: strong of body, strong of mind, they work together to form the perfect whole.
And on that note, I think this conversation is over. Come back when you decide to join the rest of us in reality. Goodbye.
Now what is it that I can do for you today?
Excellent! You prove my point through your actions. I was worried that you might be one of those foolish and weak pacifists!

Right now, the latest fight facing us is with the Spirit of the Wood. It is driving the animals to attack everyone and everything in an insane fashion. There is no pleasure in slaughtering maddened animals.
I suggest you go and talk to Aawill about it, if you want to help. He's in charge of the investigation. I have enough to do around here.
I am in charge of the druid circle challenges. When a druid wants to become a member of our grove, he or she must challenge one of our members to gain entry to the first circle.
Go and test yourself against a worthy opponent. It will stiffen your spine and make you stronger.
While I respect your desire, only a druid may challenge and become a member. If you were to learn the ways of the druid and return, then you could prove yourself.
An interested competitor! Perhaps today we will witness a duel worthy of nature's attention.

The rules are simple; you will be teleported to the challenge pit. Once there you will see your adversary; who it is will depend on which circle you are fighting. There is a door in the pit; once you open the door, the fight is over.

If your opponent has fallen and the door is opened, then you win. If, however, you open the door before your opponent is finished, then you lose. This is not to the death. Whoever falls will be teleported back here and healed.
That is unfortunate. Do not cower in fear of a little bloodletting. Return when you are ready.
Those are the only rules. Are you ready for a challenge?
You have honed your abilities to a razor sharp edge. I am proud to call you a <brother/sister> in nature. You are now ready to combat your final opponent.

Your opponent for the fourth, and weakest circle of the grove is Welcar. Welcar is a druid relatively new to the grove. As he was successful in his first challenge, he must now defend his rank. Are you truly ready?
Then, let the battle begin!
I understand if you are nervous, but do not tarry long. It is best to fight while the blood runs hot, than after it has had time to cool!
Sorry. If you want to know more about Welcar, then go talk to him. You know all you need to, in order to fight him.
Do not be long, lest the cold grip of fear get a hold on you.
I see the fear of pain and defeat has not driven you away. You are doing well. Make ready.
I am glad you have become a member of the fourth circle. It bodes well for the grove to have fresh, adventurous, new members.
Then, once again you shall face Welcar in the pit. I do hope that the battle proves to be more interesting this time. Are you ready?

The champion of the first circle of the grove is Elgar. Elgar is a half-orc druid. A fierce and cunning warrior, Elgar is dedicated to perfecting himself through nature's testing. I hope you are ready to face a most worthy opponent.
Even the most ferocious warrior should be fully prepared before doing battle. I await your return.
Then let your final challenge begin!
Janken is the druid you must face for the second circle challenge. He is wise in the ways of nature and should prove as crafty as the fox he most admires. Are you ready?
Then let us see what you can do this time.
You will now face Henna, champion of the third circle. She is a human druid of impressive ability. I think you shall find her a challenging opponent. Are you ready?
Then be on your guard. It begins!

Well fought! I give you this ring, to prove to all that you are a member of the fourth circle of druids. Go now and gain more experience. When you are ready, return and you may challenge for the next circle.
I am sorry, but you have not gained enough experience to challenge for the next circle. Return when you are more prepared to face the difficulty of this next challenge.

Wonderful job! I give you this ring, to prove to all that you are a member of the third circle of druids. Go now and gain more experience. When you are ready, return and you may challenge for the next circle.

Excellent fight! I give you this ring, to prove to all that you are a member of the second circle of druids. Go now and gain more experience. When you are ready, return and you may challenge for the next circle.
An amazing battle! I give you this ring, to prove to all that you are a member of the first circle of druids. You have proven yourself to be a master of combat.
I am sorry, but you failed that challenge. Go out and strengthen yourself, then return and do battle again.
Go forth and make the grove proud to call you its champion.
Good luck.
Best of luck.
I look forward to your final challenge.
You are a worthy challenger, but a fight is already in progress. Return another time.
You have already faced our greatest challenge in the druid circle; now it is time to aid the ailing Spirit of the Wood. Speak with Aawill, my valiant friend.
Tell me about yourself.
What is this place?
Me want know about you.
What this place be?
Nevermind. Goodbye.
How does that work?
Aren't you a little old to be fighting for a living?
How that work?
You bit old for fight, no?
So how does one get involved in this combat?
Aren't you worried about getting killed in these fights?
How me get in fight?
You not worry 'bout dying in fight?
What is wrong with the animals?
Who is in charge here?
What wrong with animals?
Who be boss here?
Nothing else, thank you.
That all, thanks.
What is your role here?
Just couldn't fit in here?
What you do here?
You no fit in with others either?
Who is in charge here?
Who be boss here?
Can I challenge you?
Me fight you, maybe?
Hello there good <sir/madam>. How can old Janken be of help to you?

I doubt you would be very interested in me. Not too much to tell, but I guess I could share a bit. I'm a druid and have been a member of this grove for about fourteen years now. I used to be the second-in-command around here.
But I got tired of the responsibility, so I decided to focus on my fighting skills instead. I am now the defender of the second circle of the grove.

You know, I always thought I would retire and relax in some peaceful little cottage in the woods by this point in life, but the lure of one-on-one combat holds me here. I guess it just makes me feel more alive.

Jaer, the very serious young woman over there, meets with druids who wish to either join or improve their standing in the circle of druids. She organizes challenge fights between the druid seeking improvement and the defender of the appropriate circle.

The fights aren't to the death and the loser is always healed. Even if I did die, and they couldn't raise me, I can't think of a better way to go. In a wolf pack, the dominant wolf eventually gets old and is beaten by a younger wolf. That's just life.

I like that I don't have to worry about the details anymore; I just have to fight. When I was younger, that used to mean full frontal assault. Now I have more wisdom and I fight like a wolf; snap in and out, never leaving myself open.
Not that the animals in this wood are fighting with intelligence, but that's another subject entirely. Do you have questions you would like to ask about anything else?
Take care friend. May nature guide your path through life.

Aawill is the Archdruid. He has been here even longer than I have, though I still remember when he was much farther down in the chain of command. He has definitely earned his place of respect. He is looking into the attacks by the animals of the woods right now.
Is there anything else I can help you with?

The animals have attacked people who step foot anywhere near the Wood. I believe there is something wrong with the Spirit. Some druids have been sent to investigate the matter, but they haven't returned yet. You should speak to Aawill if you want to help.
Aawill is the Archdruid of this grove. He makes all the major decisions and usually has more accurate information than the rest of us. Is there anything else I can help you with?
This is the Neverwinter Wood grove. We are druids who have come together to study and protect nature. Of course my role here is a little different than that.
Well, take care then. Goodbye.
No, that's not exactly what I meant. Most people come here seeking to work with nature, but some find a different role to play. That's what happened to me.
I love nature, and I was good enough to become the second-in-command.
I see you have returned. What can I do for you?
Maybe it is time to build that cabin in the woods and retire. I'm getting a little old for punishment like that.
Druids may challenge for admittance to the grove. Talk to Jaer if you want more details about it. Anything else?
I am <FirstName>. You seem very friendly.
My name is <FullName>. It is a pleasure to meet you.
None of your business. How about you answer some questions?
Me be <FirstName>. You be friendly.
Me name be <FullName>. It be nice to meet you.
You no ask questions. Me ask questions.
What challenge was this?
Who cares. I just want you to answer some questions.
Congratulations. How would you like to answer some questions?
What be this challenge?
Me not care. You answer me questions now.
Good job! Now you answer me questions.
Okay, and what did she say?
So you tested and became the defender?
So Jaer test you and you pass?
You get to point soon?
So then what happened?
This story has a happy ending, or at least an ending of some sort, yes?
Then what happen you?
This story getting long. Hurry up.
Can anyone get involved in these challenges?
I would like to ask you some questions.
Tell me more about Jaer.
Okay, well, good luck in the future.
Can me get in on fights?
Me want ask you some questions.
You talk more 'bout Jaer.
Good job. Take care. Bye.
What is going on around here?
Who is in charge here?
What's your job here?
What happen here?
Who be boss here?
What you do here?
Nevermind. Goodbye.
Who is Aawill?
Who be Aawill?
Goodbye.
What does that mean?
What that mean?
So how did you get this promotion?
I want to ask some other questions.
How you get to be defender?
Me ask other questions now.
Okay. Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> No really, I like to hear people's stories.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me want to hear you story.
Hello there stranger. Welcome to the grove. My name is Welcar, and who might you be?
I see you are back. Is there anything I can help you with?
I am shamed. I must learn more so that I can return and prove myself worthy of being a member of the grove. I hope Jaer will not look poorly on me.
I'm just very excited. You wouldn't know this, but recently I won a very important challenge.
It is a pleasure to meet you too. Especially since this week has been going so well. Just recently I won a very important challenge.
You know, not even your grumpy demeanor can throw off my mood. What questions do you have?
Okay. What questions do you have?

About a year ago I came to this grove hoping that I could join the druids here. I talked to Aawill, he's the Archdruid here, who told me talk to Jaer. Jaer is the druid in charge of testing new recruits.

Jaer told me that the test was to challenge another druid to combat in the pit. I thought I was ready, naturally, so I asked her to set it up. She told me that she didn't think I was ready, but I wanted to impress her.

I was teleported into the pit and we started to fight, and this other druid cast a spell that made my mind go hazy and the next thing I knew, I was laying on the ground back up here. I was humiliated, but Jaer told me to get back up and improve myself.

I trained for eleven months, watching others fight in the pit. I would question Jaer about different styles that I saw. She is very knowledgeable. I learned a lot and finally I was ready. I challenged again, and this time I won.
Now I am the defender of the fourth circle. Jaer said that I learned combat techniques very quickly and that the best way for me to learn more was to become the defender. I think Jaer is so wise.
Thank you. Come back if you want to hear more.

Only druids can challenge. That's sort of the point. You could always spend a few months here and learn to become a druid though. Of course, not everybody is cut out to be a druid. That's what Jaer says and she is almost always right.

She is beautiful and bright. She has this commanding presence that just makes you want to jump up and make something of yourself. I think she is the best. If you work hard to improve yourself, she will always encourage you.
That's really all I know about her. She commands the respect of the other druids around here, and she is second-in-command to Aawill. It is her job to organize the challenges.
You're the one who asked to hear my story. As Jaer always says, "Never let impatience force you into a mistake." Doesn't she say the cleverest things? Well, I will try to speed this up.
Just wait for the story. "Don't let a lack of patience lead to your downfall," that's what Jaer always says. She has the driest wit!

The biggest news right now is the way the creatures in the Wood have started to attack everyone. I don't even leave the grove anymore. Some say that the Spirit of the Wood has gone mad and is driving the other creatures mad too.
I'm not really sure what's happening, since I've really been stuck here in the grove for the past month. You should talk to Aawill about that, if you want more information.

Aawill is the Archdruid. He is in charge of all the other druids and makes sure that everyone is working together for the benefit of the Wood. If you are interested in helping out with some of the problems around here, I would suggest you speak to him.
Okay, good luck!
I am the defender for the fourth circle of druids for this grove.

If a druid comes to the grove and wants to join, then he or she must talk Jaer into setting up a challenge with the defender of the fourth circle. If the challenger wins, he or she is allowed to join the fourth circle. Jaer has just recently promoted me to defender.
I just became the defender for the fourth circle of this grove.
It's a long story. I wouldn't want to bore you with it.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, I guess I could. Okay, here goes.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I just don't feel like talking about it. I will try to answer other questions though.
Danger: Do not continue.
Signed: The Neverwinter Wood Druidic Circle.
West: Port Llast.
What is causing the rage?
Why did you attack me?
What cause rage?
Why you attack me?
What could affect your mind in such a strong manner?
It seems to be affecting the whole forest.
What control you mind?
Whole forest go crazy!
Do you know what I might do to stop it?
Stay calm and keep control. I don't want to have to hurt you anymore.
I think I had better kill you before you try to kill me.
What me do to stop it?
You be calm so me no have to hurt you no more.
Me no trust you. Me must kill you now.
I guess you had better flee now. Goodbye.
You run away now. Goodbye.
Who wouldn't be affected?
Who no be affected?
Tell me about the druids.
Why would the nymphs not be affected?
Tell me more about the witch.
What druids you mean?
Why nymphs be not crazy?
Which witch?
What do you mean 'because of her face?'
I think your madness is getting worse.
What you meaning her face?
You getting more crazy?
I'm not going to hurt you, now stop yelling at me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You can trust me dear. Why don't you tell me what you know?
Me not hurt you, but you stop yelling.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me no hurt you. Me you friend. You tell me what you know.
You tell me, or I'll chop your tree into kindling!
You tell me, or me chop tree and make big fire!
Get away from my tree! You must die!
No, please let me live! I give up.
The rage... it burns me up... makes me want to kill you. I am trying to control it, but please be quick. What do you want?
I don't know. The rage just fills my mind. It makes everyone seem like an enemy. I don't know you or who you are except that something makes me hate you.
Must you keep talking to me? I must flee soon, or else I will be forced to attack you. The only being I know of who has that kind of power is the Spirit of the Wood.
But it has never caused harm before. I don't know why it would start now. No! <He/She> has spared me. I must not do such things. Sorry <master/mistress>.
Not without a fight, tree-killer!
I don't know. I can't think. The Spirit hasn't been here in a while. It doesn't travel by here now. I don't know why. Maybe if you could find someone whose mind isn't affected by the Spirit's power.
Stay calm! There are demonic talons pressing into my mind and burning it away into nothing, and you want me to stay calm! I am doing my best.
No. I will not flee! I will strike you down and kill... oh no. Yes. I will flee. You must get away from my tree. If you remain close I will lose control and attack you again.
Goodbye and good luck.

How should I know? I never go far from my tree! You are the ones free to roam around! You should know these things. You're so stupid I should... uh, nevermind. Maybe the druids could help, or the nymphs, or even the witch.

There were some druids wandering around here a while back. I don't know where they went because I was hiding so I wouldn't have to attack them. They were dangerous. They wanted to hurt my tree! No, no. That is the hate speaking.
I didn't say they wouldn't, did I? I just said they might not. How should I know? Um, sorry. I don't mean to keep yelling at you like that.
Setara is the Witch of the Wood. She comes here sometimes. She is bad and wants to eat me! No wait, she is good and she helps me. Oh, I wish I could think clearly. This is so hard.
You must be careful when you deal with Setara though. She has a hard time dealing with people. It's because of her face of course.
No, that's not it. This time I am thinking straight.

She used to be beautiful, but now she is ugly. I don't know what happened, since she doesn't like to talk about it. I just know that she thinks that people are always judging her by her looks. She won't talk to you because you're evil!
You want to kill us all and burn our trees, so she won't talk to you and I'm not going to tell you how to get her to talk to you! Get away from me!
Okay, okay, I'm sorry. Please don't hurt my tree. I'll tell you what you could do.
Oh <master/mistress>, I'm sorry. I just can't control this much longer. I will tell you what you might do, but then you must go.

The witch Setara would give anything to have her looks restored. One day one of the nymphs told me that she had something that made people think they were beautiful. I don't know anymore than that, but you might be able to trick Setara with that.
Now please, let me go and you should leave, before I am overcome.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh you are right. I'm so sorry I yelled at you, it's just so powerful. I will tell you what you could do, but then you must flee.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No! You are just going to kill me and my tree. Stay away from me you horrible <man/woman>.
I am not your slave, villianous creature. Prepare yourself for death.
If you were trying to dominate me with your powers, you have failed. If you want to die, just try to pull that again.
You try to dominate me mind, but you no do. You no try again, or me kill you.
Me no you slave! Me kill you now.
I've been attacked several times in your home. Give me one good reason why I shouldn't kill you now?
I don't really care about your powers. Now that we know they are gone, why don't you tell me what is going on here.
Me attacked by you and your slaves. Why me not kill you now, huh?
Me not really care 'bout powers. You be weak, I be strong, so you tell me what going on here.
You attacked me! I didn't start this.
Your slaves attacked me and then you did the same thing. How is this my fault?
Me no start attack, you start attack.
You slaves attack me, then you attack me. How this be my fault?
You are the one who started this, but now I will finish it!
You start this fight, but me finish it now!
Of course not! I came here looking for a way to help the Spirit of the Wood.
I came here to talk and was attacked before I had the chance. Why would you think I came here to kill you?
No. Me come to find help for Spirit of Wood.
Me never had chance to talk. Everyone just attack me when I get here. Why you think me be bad?
I guess I can forgive you, but I expect you to help me in any way you can now.
That's a pretty horrible mistake. I can't forgive you, but I won't hurt you unless you try something again.
There can be no forgiveness for what you have done, there can be only death.
Me guess me forgive you, but now you must help me however you can.
That be too bad mistake to forgive, but me no hurt you 'less you try bad stuff again.
Me will no forgive you. You pay with life!
How long have you been having trouble?
You still had enough power to control your slaves.
What could have caused that?
What cause such bad pain?
How long you have trouble?
You still got slaves, so got some power.
If it is so bad, then why don't you leave?
You have suffered greatly. I suppose anyone would have trouble retaining their sanity.
You must be weak, if you give in so easily and enslave other's minds.
If it be so bad, why you no leave?
You been through lots. Me go crazy too if fear so strong in mind.
You be weak! Me no give in and hurt others just because scared.
I'm sorry. I guess I just have a hard time accepting when others have attacked me. Go on.
Just keep going and try to limit the whining.
I'm sick of your whining, that'll be enough. Goodbye.
Me sorry. Me just have hard time with people who attack me. Go on.
You keep talking, but not so much whining.
Me no can stand you whining. Goodbye.
If I'm going to help you, I need to get to the Spirit of the Wood. Do you know how I could do that?
Me want help you, so me need to reach Spirit of Wood. You know how I do that?
To do my job, I need to get to the Spirit of the Wood. Can you help me?
Me have job to do and me need to get to Spirit of Wood. You help me maybe?
What does that mean, both life and death?
There must be a way! Where is this portal?
What you mean life and death both?
There must be way! Where be this portal?
Are you sure that the Spirit is the only creature to ever enter the pool?
There has got to be a way for me to get there.
You be sure that Spirit only one ever go through portal?
There must be way for me to get to Spirit.
You were going to say something else. You must tell me, please.
Tell me what you were going to say, or you'll be sorry you didn't.
You have other idea. Please tell me what it be.
Tell me what you gonna say, or me make you wish you did.
It's okay. I'm going to find the Spirit and help you escape this fear.
Don't start whining again. Get some backbone.
I don't think I can listen to you anymore. Goodbye.
Is there anything else you can tell me that might help?
It be okay. Me find Spirit and stop the fear.
You be whining again. Get a grip.
There be anything else you tell me that help?
Me tired of listen to you. Me go now.
I met the druid you had locked up in the other room. Do you know about the other missing druids?
What do you know about the witch, Setara?
Do you have the mirror that Setara is seeking?
Could you tell me your story again?
That's all I can think of for now. Farewell.
Me find locked up druid. You maybe see other druids near here?
What you tell me 'bout witch Setara?
You have mirror Setara be seeking, maybe?
You tell me you story again?
That be it. Me go now. Bye bye.
What are you talking about? I'm not a slave.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Yes mistress. What is your command?
What you mean? Me no slave.
Menial labor? I don't think so!
Cleaning out your chamber pots? That's disgusting, forget it.
I'm not wearing that! It's pink!!!
No, I will not allow you to kill me! Nature's creatures must be protected.

Foolish <man/woman>! I don't know why you thought you could just steal into my house, kill my slaves and destroy another of nature's protectors, but now you have fallen to my charms. Now, bow to your mistress!
No! How is this possible? What has happened to my powers?
No, please! Please don't hurt me. What have I done to provoke this attack on my home?
Then I call upon nature's power to defend myself.
You... you mean you didn't come here to destroy me?
Oh, this is terrible. I'm so sorry, but I was certain that you... oh, I don't know why I thought that now. There is nothing I can do to make up for this. I was wrong; how is that possible?
Oh thank you <master/mistress>! You are very kind. I will do whatever I can to help you. I just wish I still had my powers, I don't know why they have become so weakened.
I will do as you command. I only wish I had some way to make it up to you. Without my powers, there is very little I can do.

A couple of weeks ago I was down by the river, watching the fish jump, when I felt the presence of danger. I looked around, then scrambled up the bank and into a grove of trees. I couldn't see anything, yet the fear kept growing.

Suddenly there was a scream in my mind that felt like someone had stabbed a dagger into my brain. I was overcome by the power of it and I fell to the ground unconscious. When I woke up, the fear was still there, and the sense that the whole forest was in pain.

It was the Spirit of the Wood. I have been sensing its pain and fear ever since that day. It is constantly screaming for help. It is all I can do to keep my sanity; indeed I guess you have experienced just how I am losing that battle.
As time passed I began to keep myself closer to home, until recently I have not even been able to leave my room, so great is the fear.
It is not so simple as that. This tree is my home, I have been here for centuries. I feel as though every person who comes along is a danger to both my home and myself.
That is very comforting to hear you say. I... I feel as though you give me strength. The fear is not as consuming when we speak. Uh... well, I guess there is more I should tell you.
You have never had a presence in your mind that could affect your emotions and try to command you to do what it wants. You despise me so much, maybe I should...

The first time a person came near my tree, I took him with my power and kept him to guard my home. The next few were easy too, but they started to get harder and harder. Now I have no power left, as you can see. I don't know what to do now.
I... I really am sorry for what I have done. If you ever need anything, please return.
I don't think that's possible. The Spirit is a creature of both life and death, and only he can enter the portal to the other realm.
The Spirit lives on another realm, somewhere between the world of the living and the world of the dead. It is the only creature on this plane who can enter the portal.
The portal is in a pool, below a waterfall, but finding it won't help you. It wouldn't help anyone.
Well... several have tried... but no... that's not a good solution. Forget it. The Spirit is the only one who can do so successfully.

There was a druid, a long time ago, who claimed he had figured out how to enter the Spirit's realm. He said he had been studying it for years and had finally pieced it together. He didn't tell me how he was going to enter, but I was curious, so I followed him.
You don't have to threaten me, I told you I would do as you command.

He went to the pool and built an altar, but then he did the strangest thing! He took out a dagger and plunged it into his own chest. His body slipped below the surface of the water, but when I went over to the pool, it was gone.

Maybe he made it to the realm, but if he was dead when he got there, I'm not sure it was worth it. Others have tried it through the years, but their bodies just lay there decomposing. Well... most of the others.
I can't think of anything else that would help, but I will answer any questions you have.
You have a strength within you that burns away the mask of terror that has shrouded my life these past days. I hope... it sounds presumptuous I'm sure, but I really hope that I may call you a friend.
You're not well loved are you?
It is just as well. I would like to be alone now. I hope you can help save the Spirit.
I'm truly sorry if there are other druids missing, but I don't know anything about them. The elf was the last person I took with my power, before I tried it on you.

I couldn't even keep him dominated, but had to renew my domination anytime I went into the room I kept him in. I feel very guilty about locking him up, but I was afraid that once he realized I had dominated him, he would want to kill me.

Oh, she is a terribly ugly old crone. You don't want to have anything to do with her. I can't even bear to look on her, so I refuse to allow her anywhere near my tree. I don't even like to talk about her, it disturbs me that much.
Is there anything else I can do?

I have a magic mirror, but it just shows the person what they wish they looked like, not what they actually look like. It certainly wouldn't make anyone young again. I suppose it would be a sort of wish fulfillment for someone as ugly as that old crone though.
If it will help you in your quest to save the Spirit, then you can certainly have it. Is there anything else you need?

My powers have been weakening and I have been becoming more and more fearful ever since the Spirit started to take control of my mind. I don't know what caused the problem, but if you can reach the Spirit, you may find some answers.

The Spirit can only be reached through the portal, which is hidden beneath the waterfall, here in the woods. The only person who might have made it through the portal is a druid who stood in the pool and killed himself.
I have no real evidence that he made it though. I think such an act would be very foolish, since you can't do too much if you are dead.
Thank you for all your kindness my friend. I do hope you will return again someday. If you manage to cure the Spirit, please return and maybe we can continue our friendship.
Good luck in your quest. I am truly sorry for the harm I brought you and for the death of my slaves, for which I am wholly to blame.
I see you have returned. Just seeing your face again makes my soul ache from the death I brought about in my paranoia. Is there something else I can do for you?
My friend! It is so very good to see you. My soul still aches from the death my paranoia caused, but seeing your face helps me through these troubled times. Is there something I can do for you?
Nature's hero returns triumphant! I am sure that your confidence and courage shall be an inspiration to all who serve nature's purpose.
Killer of the Spirit! I cannot believe that you would return to the Wood after the damage you have done to it. I will not speak to you anymore!
Don't talk back to me slave! Now, what menial task should I put you to work at?

First, you can go and clean up any mess you made while getting in here. After that, you can go and collect all of the chamber pots and clean them out. Before you go, I want you to put on this cute little outfit.
What? How dare you talk back to me! You're my unthinking sla... you... you tricked me!
Here lies Kend, beloved of Henna, one with the Spirit.
Hi dee, fiddle dee dum, me ate some bark and knifed your mum.
Me not know why sky be pink, could be ye just made a stink.
Where be me hat? Me shall skin ye just like that.
If ye see a ghost, all pale and frightened, it's because me noose 'round his neck be tightened.
Sniff the air. Do ye smell the pain? Me thinks me roasted friends again.
The bells! The bells! They ring and ring, but they can't be heard when gargoyles sing.
Uh, I'm <FirstName>. Who are you?
I can't understand you. What are you talking about?
Me be <FirstName>. Who be you?
Me no understand. What you mean to say?
I am going to try to ask some questions. Do you think you could answer some?
You've gone insane!
I'm not going to listen to this anymore. Goodbye.
How about I cut out your tongue if you don't quit rhyming?
Me want ask questions. You try to answer them, okay?
You crazy!
Me cut out tongue if you keep rhymes!
Me not listen to you no more. Bye bye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That almost made sense. Do you mean you're crazy, because you are on the Spirit's plane?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That almost make sense. You mean you be crazy, 'cause you be on Spirit plane?
I think I understand. Now I want to try to ask you some other questions.
Me think me get it. Now me try other questions.
What has driven you crazy?
What are you doing here?
Is it possible for you to stop rhyming?
What do you know about the Spirit of the Wood?
Why you be mad?
What you be doing here?
You stop rhyming, maybe?
What you know 'bout Spirit of Wood?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You mean somebody left you here and you can't get out?
That makes no sense to me, let's try a different question.
I think you would make more sense with your head cut off. Time to die!
That make no sense. Me try other question.
You make more sense without head. You die now!
So you're the one who hurt the Spirit of the Wood. Do you know how to cure it?
So you poisoned a tree and that made the Spirit sick? Why would anyone want the Spirit hurt?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You mean you get left here and you no can get out?
You hurt Spirit? You know how it be saved?
You poison tree and it make Spirit sick? Why someone want hurt Spirit?
Who is this Maugrim?
Who be this Maugrim?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You are scared of this Maugrim. Don't worry, I'm a much tougher lion than he is.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You be scared of Maugrim? You no worry, me much tougher lion than he.
So you mean other cultists are causing trouble?
You tell me if other cultists cause trouble like you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Don't worry, I won't tell anybody your secret. You can trust me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You tell me secret. Me promise me no tell others.
Why would someone want to hurt the Spirit?
Why them want hurt Spirit?
Do you mean there are other cultists causing trouble?
Other cultists cause trouble like you?
Ooddle-olly, what's this <man/woman>, who shares me frying pan?
Oh ho, a pickle to try your mind, of answers there are some to find.
But the fox he plays without a tail, so try as you might, I bet you fail.
Who are I? Who be me? That's not the thing I told the tree.
I fly through the air or live in a shoe, take your time and think it through.
It's not my plane, I say with disdain.
I must be hazy, my thoughts are lazy!
Me hat be gone, who would know? Ye hid it on me, now it's time ye go!
Befuddle me this, befuddle me that, now where'd ye put me blasted hat?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Too long, too long, could not hold on. Got me mind, now in a bind.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Look at the birdie, high in the sky... Oh no, it be just a fleck in me eye.
I tell ye once and then no more, me name be locked behind a door. The door can open if ye try, but if ye lose then say goodbye.
When out of luck, then me get stuck. They did say hi, but no goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Like mice through holes, out they go, but closed the holes to me, said no.

The job me did, though not know why, was to the tree to say goodbye. The Spirit sick, but it no die, though I did me best to try. Me chopped it good, then poisoned well, but now me be stuck here in hell.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Oh dear, a cloud has wandered by, it lost its way, me wonder why?
A stone to get with magic rune, that Spirit hid like a sacred tomb. Me did not see what rune be like, it goes to mage, that's quite a hike!
What thing it does me do not know, me did it because Maugrim tells me so.
If the mouse squeaks, the lion pounces, and swallows down those little ounces.
Bye bye, now ye die!
Bye bye, now ye die!

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> This Maugrim be a mage who hides in tower, be wary of his awful power. It soars up high as it can, in evil city of Luskan. Like a queen bee in her hive, others he send to keep his works alive.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> The wounded duck might flop and flail, but soon be eaten, same with quail. Others come and join the feast, that's the part ye'll like the least.
A vial with the cure does be, but you won't find it out from me.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Up in the northeast, across the river Lox, is where you can find a pile of rocks. Within the pile, does lie the vial.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Without me cure you out of luck, and me no give a flying... duck.

Of other cultists me know three, but me not know who they be. One does walk in caves like fort, north of the city of last port. Two does hide, unless he ran, within the city of Luskan. The last would be number three, lost in Charwood, mad like me.
And now it does be time to go, I'll just get me hat, but wait, oh no!
The song me sing is in me head, better to sing than soon be dead.
Can you speak?
What are you?
You talk, maybe?
What you be?
What happened to you again?
I have found the cure for you.
Why you sick again?
I got cure to save you.
Yes, I will cure you.
You must know where some treasure lies in the forest. Why don't you tell me where first?
No. I think it would be better to kill you.
Ya, me cure you.
You know where gold be hid? Show me first.
No. Me decide to kill you.
All right, I guess I'll cure you.
No gold, no cure. I guess you can just suffer and die.
Okay, me cure you.
No gold, no cure. That the way it is. You just die I guess.
Now can you show me what happened here?
Now you show me why you attacked.
So that's how they managed to poison you. But why did they want to?
That's not the part I care about. What were they after?
So you be poisoned in sneaky way. Why them do that?
You already cured. Me want know why poisoned.
What was on that stone?
What be on stone?
A sense of rage and helplessness emanates from the Spirit of the Wood.
Feelings of fear and hopelessness impress themselves on your mind.
The Spirit of the Wood looks at you in confusion.
Blurry images race through your mind. Very little is recognizable, except some images of small animals and other woodland creatures. Then the images become clearer.

A stream of pictures flicks through your mind: woodland creatures of all shapes and sizes, trees and bushes, insects and rocks. The images are jumbled together and include everything imaginable that could be found in a forest.

The images slow down and you see one creature. While the details are blurry, it is obviously a dwarf. An image of the Spirit appears and the dwarf does something to a tree, but you can't quite understand what he does.
Suddenly the dwarf is gone and the image of the Spirit begins to fade. The woodland creatures appear again, but this time you see them as if through a red glass.

The creatures begin to attack each other and other shapes that might be humanoid. You sense the fear and frustration of the Spirit as the images jumble together into incomprehensible darkness. The Spirit stands staring off into nothing, looking weaker than ever.
Fear and despair are the Spirit's only response to your return.
You see a blurry image of yourself touching the Spirit, followed by the Spirit getting larger.
You walk forward and give the antidote to the Spirit. It shudders, then the Spirit seems to swell in size. Emotions of joy and love threaten to overwhelm your senses.
Feelings of confusion and despair radiate from the Spirit.
A wash of emotional despair covers your thoughts, then anger and hatred. The Spirit attacks.
The images in your mind gain clarity and focus as the Spirit recovers from the poison. An image of a fox curled around a sleeping rabbit fills your mind, along with an intensely protective feeling.

You see a group of men come into the forest. A familiar, evil-eyed dwarf is with the group. They go to the pool and the dwarf steps into it. One of the men walks over and thrusts a dagger through the back of the dwarf's throat.

The image dissolves and suddenly you can see that the dwarf is in the Spirit's realm. A few minutes later he is joined by several of the other men. One of the other men mouths a word, and the name "Relmar" forms in your mind.

The group walks toward the Spirit's tree, spreading out until they form a circle. Three of the men rush at the Spirit, while Relmar sneaks up on the tree. Relmar takes his axe and coats the edge with a green liquid. He hacks at the tree a couple of times.
The image returns with the two men who were not in the fight running over to the tree. They start to dig between its roots until they uncover a smooth, flat stone.
One of the men in the image laughs and then casts a spell. The two step through a portal that appears and they are gone. Relmar goes to run through the portal, but it disappears.
The last of the men fighting the weakened Spirit are slain and Relmar flees away from the tree to disappear.
All images disappear from your mind, to be replaced by a glowing sigil. The glyph pulses with power and you get the sense of incredibly strong magic.

As you look at the rune, the feeling changes from power to time. You feel ages slipping away, from your present to the past: long before your time... before the demihuman races... even before the humans had power.

The sense of time disappears and you are left with an image of the Spirit placing the stone in the roots of the tree. The images recede entirely from your mind and your body feels distorted for a short moment.
The Spirit smiles at you. The last thing you sense is a pleasant emotion of farewell.
What are you talking about? And why did you attack me?
Who are you?
What you be talking 'bout? Why you attack me?
Who you be?
Yes, this is the Wood. Why did you just attack me?
I am asking the questions here. You should have known better than to attack me.
Yes, this be the Wood. Why you attack me?
You no ask questions. You be dumb to attack me.
Don't you remember anything about your captivity?
All right, you should get out of here now.
You no remember being held?
Okay. You better go now.
I think you are trying to trick me. Die foolish man!
You be sneaky. You try to trick me, but now me kill you!
Let me ask you some questions about what you knew before you were captured.
Me want know what you learn before you forgot stuff. You answer me questions.
What did you discover about what is happening to the animals in the Wood?
There are some druids missing. Do you know what happened to them?
I heard about a witch named Setara. What do you know about her?
What you find 'bout animals attacking?
There be druids missing. You know 'bout that?
Setara be the witch of the Wood. You know 'bout her?
Protect the mistress! Kill the intruder!
No, please no more! I surrender!
I don't know what is going on. Where am I? Where are my clothes?
I... I don't remember attacking you. I don't even know who you are or where this is. The last thing I remember is walking through the Wood trying to figure out what went wrong with all the animals.
I had avoided several bears and a few boars, but I was getting very tired. I stumbled into an open glade and... I saw... I think it was a woman. A beautiful woman, yes, that's it.
That's the last I remember. Next thing I know, you were attacking me, although you say I was the one who attacked. This is all very confusing.
I am a ranger here in... um... is this Neverwinter Wood? I don't recognize this place.
Hm... no, I don't remember a thing, sorry.
I will try, although I can't promise anything. I hadn't learned very much.
Thank you. Good luck to you <sir/madam>.
You will pay for this treachery!
There is nothing much to tell. I couldn't speak to them or calm them. They are just extremely hostile. I never had the opportunity to find out more.
I haven't the slightest idea. Perhaps you should search this place, but be careful, since they might attack you too, if they're like I was.

I have heard a little bit about her. She likes to help the forest creatures, but she doesn't have much contact with people. There is some story about how she used to be beautiful, but suddenly turned ugly. That's all I know about her.
The mistress must be protected. Slay the intruder!
No, I'm not. I have control of my own mind. Who are you?
I am not so foolish as to be captured by a nymph. You may leave now, thanks to me.
You just wait here. I'll be back.
I not be fooled by nymph. Me smart. Who you?
Me not get caught by little nymph like you. You go away now.
You no move. Me be back.
THIS LINE NEVER APPEARS IN CONVERSATION (though there are links to what's below).
THIS LINE NEVER APPEARS IN CONVERSATION (though there are links to what's below).
My name is <FirstName>. Aawill sent me to find you.
THIS LINE NEVER APPEARS IN CONVERSATION (though there are links to what's below).
Me name be <FirstName>. Me work for Aawill. Now me find you.
THIS LINE NEVER APPEARS IN CONVERSATION (though there are links to what's below).
How far did you get?
How did you end up in here?
How much you learn?
How you get caught?
Why didn't you want to enter her house?
You were suspicious already, weren't you?
Why you no want enter house?
You already think she be bad?
I'm trying to help with that. What have you learned about the Spirit of the Wood?
The other druids never returned either. I don't suppose you know where they might be?
Are you able to get out of here on your own now?
Me trying to help. What you learn 'bout Spirit of Wood?
Other druids no come back. You know where they be going?
Me go now. You get out okay?
Tell me more about this pool.
Why hasn't the Spirit come?
Tell me 'bout pool.
Why Spirit not come now?
Why didn't you go into it?
What do you mean another realm?
You no go into pool?
What you mean other realm?
Do you have any suggestions of what I should do?
Now what me do?
Why don't you tell me your story?
You tell me what happen to you.
He sent me to rescue some druids. Are you one of them?
I have met someone named Aawill. How do you know him?
Him tell me rescue druids. You be druid?
Me know him. How you know him?
I am <FullName>, and Aawill sent me to rescue you.
I be <FullName> and I come to find you. Me sent by Aawill.
I guess she knew how to manipulate you.
I guess I could see how that could happen.
Being locked up is the least of what you deserved for such disgusting behavior.
Women always know how get men.
Me know how that can happen.
That bad behavior get you what you deserve.
Oh dear, I see the nymph has bewitched another one. Wait, you don't have the look of one beguiled by her sorcery.
Thank you for your assistance. I would be grateful if you wouldn't spread the details of what happened to me around.
My name is Terari. I am a druid of the Neverwinter Wood grove. And who are you good <sir/madam>?
Wait, before you go, did Aawill send you?
I will try to wait patiently, though I do not wish to be locked in here again, so please make haste.
Then I owe both Aawill and you a debt of honor. I only wish I had gotten further on my mission to save the Spirit of the Wood.
It is rather embarrassing actually. I thought the nymphs might be a good source of information, since they have stronger minds than your average woodland animal.

I didn't get very far. I thought that although the animals were not communicating, the nymphs might be a good source of information. They may be flighty, but I thought that they would have strong enough minds to resist the Spirit's madness.

I came to this house first, since I had... um... known this particular nymph in the past. She seemed very pleased to see me, eager even. I was hoping to get some information from her, without... well... going into her house.
That is far more insightful than I would have given you credit for.
She did seem a bit more eager than normal to get me into her house.
Somewhere in the back of my mind, a part of me was wondering why she never actually used my name, even though we have known each other for quite a while. It seemed... odd.

Unfortunately, I was not thinking clearly. I guess I was just certain that I could handle anything she tried. When we got into her house she suggested that I get undressed, and while I was doing that she cast a spell on me.
I do not know why, but there is madness in the Spirit and it is infecting the Wood. It even affected the nymphs, so the madness must have a powerful hold.

I do know that in order to get to the Spirit you will have to find a way to enter the pool that it used to come through to get into and out of the Wood. Before she cast the spell, the nymph did mention that the Spirit hasn't been here in quite a while.
The pool is some kind of entrance to another realm where the Spirit usually lives. I haven't the slightest idea what the other realm looks like though.
She didn't say why, she just said that the Spirit hasn't come out of the pool in a while. Nymphs don't have a very good grasp of time.
I can make it on my own. I will meet up with you at the druid grove.
No living creature can get through the portal and into the other realm. That is what some of the oldest stories of my people say.
The stories say that the portal exists between the realms of life and death. The Spirit exists as some sort of half-life, so she can go back and forth through the portal, but we can't.
You should try to find the others and see if they know any more. There is also a witch named Setara in the Wood, who might know something. I was going to talk to her after the nymphs.
It's another plane of existence. The pool acts as a portal to this other place.
I am unsure of what the others had planned, although Orlane was headed in a southeasterly direction. As for Bree, it's hard to divine her intentions, since her vanity masks them well.
I wish I could help you more. Hopefully they will have discovered more about the Spirit than I have.
As patient as the trees I wait upon your pleasure. Still, I should like to be going soon.
Wise Aawill. Always making sure all is taken care of.
He is the head of our druidic circle.
Thank you again and good luck.
Beyond that, I have no idea how to cure the Spirit, but it needs to be done soon, before some rash adventurer decides to kill off every living thing in the forest.

Next thing I knew, I was locked in here, unable to escape. The nymph hasn't harmed me, she just won't let me go. Before she enters the room she casts some kind of spell and I wake up later with no memories of what happened.
Now that you have freed me, I must return to the grove to discuss the Spirit of the Wood with the other druids. Maybe the others have learned more than I have.
You can judge my behavior when you have proven your own to be perfect.
I shall escape from here and meet you back at the grove.
I am glad I was able to find you down here. Who are you?
It's too dangerous in here for me to worry about you. You had better get out on your own.
You just wait here. I'll be back.
Me happy me find you in big messy webs. Who you be?
Me not want protect you. You get out alone.
You no move. You wait, me be back.
No, but I'm working on it. What can you tell me about the situation?
No. Some of the other druids have gone missing too. Do you know where they might be?
I have met Aawill. My name is <FirstName> and I was sent to rescue you.
No, but me do it soon. You know stuff 'bout it?
Me know Aawill. Him send me find you. Now you be found.
No. Some other druids gone too. You know 'bout them?
You were attacked by a deer? I've never heard of such a thing.
Ha! You got your butt kicked by a deer?
Deer attack you? That odd.
Ha! You get butt kicked by deer?
The spiders attacked you on the surface?
Surprised twice? You were really alert for danger, weren't you?
Spiders come out of cave to get you?
You not very bright if surprised twice.
Tell me what you've learned about the Spirit of the Wood.
Do you know what happened to the other druids who were searching for answers?
I hope you are feeling better now. You should get going.
What you learn 'bout Spirit of Wood?
Where other druids go?
You go now. You be safe.
Tell me more about this pool.
You mean there's a cave under the pool?
Tell me 'bout pool.
It live in the pool?
Why didn't you go into it?
What do you mean another realm?
You no go into pool?
What you mean other realm?
So now what am I supposed to do?
So how did you get down here?
Now what me do?
How you get down here?
Why don't you tell me your story?
You tell me what happen to you.
So how did you get captured?
So you're one of the druids I was looking for. Glad I found you.
You be druid me look for. Me glad me find you.
What were you doing down here?
How you get caught?
What you do in caves here?
Oh, thank you for unraveling me from that cocoon! I thought I was dead for sure.
If I can just get back to Aawill I will feel better.
I love nature, but not spiders. Not anymore. Thanks again for the rescue.
My name is Orlane. I am a druid who was sent by my leader Aawill to find out what is wrong with the Spirit of the Wood.
I will in a moment, but for now I just need to clear my head of the spider's poison. Could you please sit with me until I'm up to leaving? It shouldn't take too long.
Please don't be long. I can't stand the touch of these spider webs.
I was sent into the Wood to find out why the creatures were attacking everyone. I tried talking to a deer in one clearing, but the poor thing's mind was so confused that it attacked me.
Limited mind, limited sense of humor. That's your story is it?
It's not funny. I would have been ready for an attack if it had been a wolf or a bear, but nobody expects to be attacked by a deer.
It came right at me and I tried to dodge, but it caught me in the side with a hoof. It reared up to strike me again, but then it suddenly turned and ran off.

I got up to try and follow, but then I heard a soft chittering sound behind me. I turned around, but before I even saw what was happening, something soft with long hairy legs and mandibles leapt on top of me.
Coming from you, that really, really hurts.
I was a little distracted at the moment. You get kicked by a deer and see how you feel.
I didn't even know what it was at first. I felt the thing bite me and suddenly the entire world started to spin. Next thing I knew I was in here, all wrapped up.

I was just waiting to feel another bite when you came along and set me free. Again, thank you so very much. Now I need to find my companion druids and see if we can figure out what to do about the Spirit of the Wood.
Well, it is obvious that something is severely wrong with the Spirit of the Wood. It seems to have gone crazy.
Usually the Spirit enters and exits the Wood through a pool in the north part of the forest, but from what I could gather, the Spirit hasn't been seen for a while.
The pool is some kind of entrance to another realm where the Spirit usually lives. I haven't the slightest idea what the other realm looks like though.
No, it's a kind of portal.
I should be fine now. Again, I can't thank you enough for your assistance. Good luck.
I don't know much about the pool, except a few legends. I do know that no living creature can get through the portal and into the other realm.
According to an old druid I once met, the portal exists between the realms of life and death. The Spirit exists as some sort of half-life, so it can go through the portal at will, but we can't.
I don't know. Maybe if you find the other druids that were searching, they could help you. Otherwise you might want to talk to a nymph. Maybe they haven't gone crazy like the animals.
It's another plane of existence. The pool acts as a portal to this other place.
I haven't a clue. We separated, so that we could discover as much as we could, then we were supposed to meet up back in the grove.
As you know, I never made it. I guess the others didn't either. I wonder if they found out more than I did?
You came back. Can I leave yet?
Thank the balance for Aawill. He is a strong leader.
I am glad you found me too. That must mean that Aawill sent you.
Good luck and be careful out there.
No I'm not. I'm <FirstName>. And who are you?
You noticed? Why don't you run along now, before the witch comes back.
You just wait here. I'll be back.
You be pretty. What you name?
Me not hag. You go now, before witch come back.
You no move. Me be back.
What did you discover about the Spirit?
Other druids have disappeared too. Do you know where they are?
Why don't you tell me what happened to you?
You know what wrong with Spirit?
Me want know how you got caught.
Other druids gone too. You know where them be?
Why would you seek the witch?
That certainly turned out to be a brilliant decision.
Why you think of witch?
That be stupid idea.
Did she recognize you or something?
Why would she stare at your face?
She know you face from before?
Why she stare at you face?
Tell me what you've learned about the Spirit of the Wood.
Do you know what happened to the other druids?
Do you need help escaping, or can you make it on your own?
What you learn 'bout Spirit of Wood?
Where other druids go?
Me go now. You get out okay?
Tell me more about this pool.
How do you think the Spirit would have reacted to you?
Tell me 'bout pool.
What Spirit do if you talk?
