Why didn't you go into it?
What do you mean another realm?
You no go into pool?
What you mean other realm?
Do you have any suggestions of what I should do?
So how did you get down here?
Now what me do?
How you get down here?
Why don't you tell me your story?
You tell me what happen to you.
He sent me to rescue some druids. Are you one of them?
I have met someone named Aawill. How do you know him?
Him tell me rescue druids. You be druid?
Me know him. How you know him?
What are you doing here in the witch's house?
What you do in this place with witch?
Leave my face alone you horrible... oh, wait, you're not that ghastly hag.
I'm still beautiful, thanks to you. You have my eternal gratitude.
My name is Bree. Besides being the most beautiful druid in the Neverwinter Wood, I am also one of the druids who was investigating the problems with the Wood's Spirit.
Wait, before you go, did Aawill send you?
Oh, please don't be long. I must get away from here soon.

I was wandering through the forest, dodging encounters with the normal inhabitants. There was no point in even trying to speak with the animals; they were almost rabid with fear and anger. Then I thought of the witch.
You should be careful who you call stupid.
How could I possibly have anticipated her reaction to seeing how incredibly beautiful I am?

The animals have always held the witch in high esteem. She protects and helps them quite often. I figured that the Spirit probably wouldn't have any control over her mind, so perhaps she would be a source of information.

I found the witch in a clearing near here. She was harvesting some herbs at the time, so I came out quietly and waited for her to notice me. She worked for a while, then turned and smiled at me. Her eyes remained fixed on my face for a long time.
Are you blind? My radiant beauty stunned her, the poor thing.

She just seemed to admire my looks. No surprise really, since she certainly has none. She convinced me to enter her house, and we sat down to have tea. We talked a little, but then I started to get dizzy and I realized there was something in my tea.

Next thing I knew I was locked in this room. The witch came in and muttered something about stealing my face. I don't know what she meant by that, although if I had her face I'd want a different one too.
It's gone insane! The whole forest is caught up in its insanity, and if someone doesn't stop it soon I fear the creatures will start tearing each other apart.

The Spirit is normally peaceful and comes into the Wood through its pool to tend to the creatures. Since the violence began, the Spirit hasn't come through at all. If it had, I would have tried to talk to it.
The pool is some kind of entrance to another realm where the Spirit usually lives. I haven't the slightest idea what the other realm looks like though.
I don't know what it would have done. It might have attacked me, but I would have tried anyways. It is the source of the problem.
I can make it on my own. I will meet up with you at the druid grove.
I don't know much about the pool, mostly just stories. I do know that no living creature can get through the portal and into the other realm.

I think Orlane told me something about how the portal exists between the realms of life and death. The Spirit exists as some sort of half-life, so it can go back and forth through the portal, but we can't.

Somehow you need to find a way through the portal, then you need to either cure the Spirit or, and I hate to say this, you need to kill it. Most druids wouldn't even suggest something like that, but you do what you have to.
It's another plane of existence. The pool acts as a portal to this other place.
I don't know where the little one went, Orlane's his name, but I know that the pretty elf, Terari, was going to try his charms on the nymphs. You could go ask him.
They might know where he went. Of course they might have gone as crazy as the rest of the forest, so you might want to be careful what you say.
I'm so glad you're back. I was starting to worry. Can I leave yet?
Wonderful Aawill! Thank goodness for his wisdom.
He is the head of our druidic circle.
Carry the image of my beautiful face in your mind, for good luck. Farewell.
Don't ask me how you can do any of those things, because I don't know. I know I am both highly beautiful and intelligent, but I simply don't have the answers.
All I want to do is get back to the grove and take a bath.
Now that you have freed me, I will return to the grove and consult with the other druids about the Spirit of the Wood.
The forest is destroying itself all around you and I am trying to find a way to save it.
There are some missing druids that I am seeking and I hoped you might have seen one.
Get out of my way you ugly hag, before I chop off your withered head!
Me try to help forest, so it not kill people no more.
Me just stop in for visit.
You get out of way or me chop you ugly face off.
I was just looking around.
Me need find missing druids to help. You see druid anywhere?
I heard that you were a friend to forest creatures and thought you might know something that could assist me.
I'm just desperate to find some information or anything that could help.
Me thought you friend of animals. Me thought you help, maybe?
Me need help bad. Me take any me can get.
I've heard enough. I'll leave now.
Me heard 'nuff. Me go.
I didn't come to gawk. What happened to you?
You would certainly fit into the freak show at a circus, but I'm here to find something specific, not to stare.
I guess I'll put you out of your misery then hag!
Me not here to stare. What make you ugly?
You would win prize for ugliest person, but me look for something, not here for show.
You too ugly to live, so me kill you.
What can I do to help you?
What are you willing to give me if I help you?
I don't trust you. I think I'll kill you instead.
What me do to help?
What you give me if me help you?
Me no trust you, so me kill you.
All right, what do you want me to do?
That's not enough. I want gold.
What you want me to do?
Not 'nuff. Me want gold.
Okay, I will get this mirror for you.
What will you give me to get this mirror for you?
Okay, me get you mirror.
What you give me if me get you mirror?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If you really want my help, you should show some trust by telling me what happened to you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You want help, you tell me what happen to you first.
Nothing. Nevermind.
Where did you say the nymph lives again?
I have the mirror right here.
Where you say nymph live?
Me have you mirror here.
Goodbye.
I want the gem and the information though.
Me want gem and information too.
Uh... you're right. You are definitely striking to look at.
But you don't look any different.
Uh... you right. Me no think you would look so... lovely.
But you no look no different.
How do I know that you really have any information about them?
I guess I need any information I can get. What do you need help with?
How me know you know stuff 'bout druids?
Me need help to find them. What me help you with?
Why is the druid locked up in your house?
Why druid be locked in you house?
What in Sune's name are you doing in my house?
I see you are back. What do you want?
You have returned. Does that mean you have found the mirror?
Ugly! I was one of the most beautiful women in the land. Now leave my house before I turn you into a toad!

Do you think that gives you the right to barge into my home? You come in here, slaughter my servants, help yourself to my possessions and you think that noble intentions suffice to explain your actions?
Oh, really. Very interesting. Well... what is information on that worth to you? Would you be willing to do me a small service?

Don't treat me like a fool! I may have lost my stunning beauty, but I haven't lost my mind. Nobody goes wandering around through the Wood, where everything has gone insane, just to look around. What are you searching for?
Good. Begone from my home and don't come back to play 'stare at the freak' again.
If I knew anything that could really help the animals, I would certainly have done something about it. I have been doing some research, but I haven't gotten very far.
What I don't do is help people. You come to stare and humiliate me, just because I have fallen so far from a glamorous beauty to a despised fright.
It's none of your business and I don't like to talk about it. If you are interested, there is something you could do to help me though.

I have a small gem that might interest you. It has elven writing scribed on its facets and seems to have some value to an elf in Port Llast. He's been writing me, trying to convince me to give it up, but I couldn't be bothered.

I'm sure you could sell it to him for a fair price. I also have knowledge of the whereabouts of a druid who has been missing. She might have information on the Spirit of the Wood. If you do what I ask I will give you both things.

The only thing that holds true value for me is my beauty. There is a nymph who lives in this forest who has a mirror that can return my beauty. I overheard two dryads talking about it, just before all this trouble started.

The nymph lives to the northeast of here. I would get it myself, but I can't go anywhere near her. The unearthly beauty of her face physically hurts me, and she shuns me because I am ugly. Please, please get me the mirror!

I have a small gem that might interest you. It has elven writing scribed on its facets and seems to have some value to an elf in Port Llast. He's been writing me, trying to convince me to give it up, but I couldn't be bothered.

I'm sure the elf will give you a fair price for the gem. I also have knowledge of the whereabouts of a druid who has been missing. She might have information on the Spirit of the Wood. If you do what I ask I will give you both things.

Oh thank you! You dear <man/woman>. I look forward to the return of the dazzling beauty I once possessed. Should you be successful, I will gladly give you a precious gem and tell you what I know of the druids... if, indeed, that is the kind of reward you still desire, then. Ha ha!
Good luck, and don't be long please.
Then you shall die a painful, deforming death!
I know my beauty keeps drawing you back, but please leave my house now.
I tire of people returning to stare at the freak. You are hardly a pleasure to look at, so tell me what you want and be quick about it.

You will get gold from selling the gem to the elf in Port Llast, and you could probably convince Aawill to give you gold for rescuing the druid. You will also, hopefully, get information to help you with the Spirit of the Wood, which Aawill will likely pay you for.
I would say that should be more than sufficient, even for someone as greedy as yourself. Now, do we have a deal?

How dare you! I would like to see what you look like when age has left her dusty tracks on your face. I was not always this monstrous hag you see before you. But I would rather not speak of that right now. Tell me what you seek.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I don't know why you should care, but if it will convince you to help me then I guess I can tell you. When I turned thirty I found that I had my first noticeable wrinkle. The thought of my beauty fading terrified me.

I decided that I would try to make a potion of longevity to help me keep young. I... I won't tell you all of the details. Somehow I messed up the potion and when I drank it, instead of becoming 15 years younger, I aged 100 years.
I have sustained my life in ways I cannot discuss, but I have found a solution to my problem, if you will only help me.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No. It is none of your business. You will help me or leave now.
Then be gone and bother me no more.
She lives somewhere to the northwest of here. If you find an arrogant, young tart in skimpy clothing, that's her.
Please bring the mirror back soon.
Yes, get out of my home. I don't need you staring at me constantly!
Oh, yes, yes, YES! I am so glad I trusted you with the task. Now if you will just give it to me, then I can be cured. You will be blessed to look upon my true, dazzling beauty.
Of course. Here is the gem; you should be able to get something for it from that elf, Elaith, in Port Llast. He seemed quite desperate for it.
Look at me! It worked. I'm beautiful again! I'll bet that you never expected me to be so incredibly stunning now did you?

Oh, it's true, it's true! And you are quite perceptive, so I'll help you even more. I found an old book that talks about entering the realm of the Spirit of the Wood. It is in my library to the southeast of here.
Good luck adventurers!
Yes I do! You must be blind! No, wait, you are just jealous of me because I am so much better looking than you now. Yes, that's it. Go away now, simpleton.
I can't tell you anything now, but if you truly want to save the female druid, then you will listen to what I say.
That is something best left unspoken; besides, I am young and beautiful now, so I promise it will never happen again. Now, don't you think I am simply gorgeous now?
Road to Port Llast.
To Neverwinter Wood.
North: Green Griffon Inn and Luskan. Southwest: Port Llast. East: Neverwinter Wood.
East: Neverwinter Wood.
West: Port Llast.
Goodbye.
Where does this bridge lead?
Where bridge go?
Die troll!
Who is Mister Wanev?
Who be Mister Wanev?
Why are you guarding this bridge?
Why you guard bridge?
Why are you guarding this bridge?
Why you guard bridge?
Where does this bridge lead?
Where dis bridge lead?
I'll go.
Me go now.
I would like to cross the bridge.
Me want cross bridge.
Why don't you let me across before I kill you?
If me no cross, you die!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Listen, I've been invited by Wanev. If you don't let me cross you'll be punished.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me be invited by Wanev-guy. You no let me cross, he hurt you.
Would 100 gold pieces change your mind?
Maybe 100 gold make you let me cross?
You got wardstone? You cross bridge if want to. Me Lerk. Good bridge troll.
Have nice <day/night>.
Lerk good bridge troll! Lerk grind your bones!
Bridge lead to Mister Wanev's property. Nice place. Good view.
Mister Wanev don't like nosy people. I eat unwelcome visitors. Good bridge troll!
Mister Wanev good boss. He puny but has powerful magics.
You halt! No pass on bridge! You try, Lerk eat you!
This bridge lead to Mister Wanev's property. Me Lerk. Best bridge troll in world. Lerk keep annoying visitor from property. Lerk eat them if they try to cross bridge.
Bye.
You not listen good? Only Wanev friend cross bridge. Me not see you before so no way you cross. You try, I eat!
Hah! Lerk not scared of you! Let us fight!
You guest of Mister Wanev? Hmm... You sure? Well, I not want to get in trouble. You pass and no tell Wanev Lerk get in you way.
Hah! Mister Wanev tell me when to expect guest. He no tell. You no pass.
You cross bridge if you want to. Lerk no bother you.
Lerk no need gold. Storekeep not like Lerk much.
I will meet your challenge. Speak it.
Me answer challenge. You say it now.
I apologize for disturbing you. I will leave.
Me sorry to wake you. Me go bye now.
I do not jump through hoops! Defend yourself!
Me not play for you! You die... uh... again!
Okay, a clan... uh... Big Duck Clan?
The mighty Clan I Don't Have a Clue?
Um... a clan? It maybe... Clan... Famous Guys... in Hats?
Mirialis Clan.
I'll take a shot. Clan Long Since Gone?
I do not know. How would I find out?
Me don't know. How me find out?
That's it? A stupid riddle?
What? You just gots a stupid riddle?
<StartAction>Show Maegel the book you found on the corpse.</Start>
What? OH! Yes, of course it did. Real far.
No, not... uh... YES, far. Real far. Whoo, me tired.
I'm sorry. Maybe you have another riddle?
Uh, me sorry. Maybe you gots another riddle?
I am sorry for you, but I did answer correctly.
That the way it goes, me guess. So, gimme stuff.
If it's any consolation, I am on an important quest.
Uh, me on important quest already. Feel better?
Don't blame me. I was just hunting bears.
Me just hunting bears. What you want?
Who has summoned me? Who claims the title of Champion? Who is my inheritor?
A contendor approaches. My cause... my people... vanished long ago, but my spirit is vain, and I will have the respect I am due.
Answer my question and prove you are my proper inheritor. Fail, and burn for dishonoring my legacy with your ignorance.
So be it. Show your knowledge of my legacy. The clan of my siblings, now dust, just as I... What was it called?
You would be pointless by choice?! Not good enough!
You tilt without reason. I am a shade of what I was, and cannot be made less than I am. You will have nothing.
It's... it's not stupid, it's a good one. See, it ensures that you quested to know what I have done, and are therefore worthy of what is mine.
Quest for the legacy I left. Know the glory of my lost kingdom and you shall have what is mine. Now burn, and learn of your failure.
That is... correct. You did not hesitate. How did you come by this difficult information? My legacy must have reached far.
You are just guessing! Respect me and quest for what I want! Search and be rewarded! Taunt me again and I shall not be so lenient!
You are doing that on purpose! Do not mock my fate! Quest for my answer and be rewarded! Taunt me again and suffer further!
Your manner is strange, but the answer satisfies. Take my great possessions and fulfill the prophecies laid down at my death.
I was not forgotten. At last, I can rest.
A corpse's book? This isn't right. He must have quested. You just had the answer served on a platter, swiped from his backpack.
What? No, no I don't. See, I'm dead so I don't get out much. Idiot. "Another riddle," <he/she> says. Thanks a lot.
Do you know how long I've been here? Hah? I've watched water drips melt rock. A snail is a year's worth of excitement!
Yes, but... that's not the way it was supposed to be... You're supposed to be on a great quest to fulfill my legacy.
Should'a walked toward the light when I had the chance. I don't believe this.
What?! What do you want? Look, I'm done, all right? My stuff is in the casket. It's yours. Go nuts. I'm out of here.
Oh yes, I am ever so pleased to be a diversion from something important. Don't patronize me. I was great once.
Hunting... bears? You were killing simple animals and just stumbled on my centuries old tomb? Well, I certainly feel important now. Yes <sir/madam>.
Yes.
No.
Yes.
You notice what looks to be an underwater passage. If you could hold your breath long enough, perhaps it would be possible to swim to the other side. Do you wish to try?
You dive into the pool but run out of breath before reaching the passage.
You successfully make it to the other side.
It should be much easier to make it back. Do you wish to try?
You successfully make it to the other side.
This wall fell to fractures and temperature changes years ago, but ages too late for the corpse trapped behind it.
Intruder! Sound the alarm!
I sense the wardstone. You may pass.
When you pull the lever, you hear an electrical hum.
Apologies won't save you now, mage! Die!
Perhaps you had better answer my questions before I finish what you started.
I give you rash, bad guy! Die! Die!
I no got rash. You answer me questions now!
I have been sent here to take a magical gem from you.
Me come for magic gem.
I have no further questions.
Me have no more questions.
You are of no use to me. Die!
You useless! Die!
I have been hired to get the gem and I intend to get it. Hand it over now!
Elaith Serpent guy hire me so me gonna get the gem. Give it now!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That is not acceptable. Tell me what happened to the gem.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me say no. You tell me what happen to gem.
I do not care to listen to your excuses. Tell me where the gem is or suffer the consequences.
No excuses! You tell where gem or me hurt you good!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You say that YOU are unable to retrieve the gem but I believe that I have just proven myself to be stronger than you.
Come on, you must have more than that. Hand it over!
C'mon! You have more treasures! Gimme!
That is not enough! Give me more or I'll feed you a foot of sharpened steel!
Me want more or me stab you good!
Who are you?
I want your valuables. Anything and everything of value.
Who you be?
You give me gold and treasures.
Who are you, exactly?
That isn't how it works. You answer my questions or I kill you.
I dunno. Who you be?
Nuh-uh. You answer me or you die.
Go on.
Enough of this. I have another question.
Story too long. Me have other question.
And the gem?
I care not. Let me ask you something else.
Me no care. Other question.
Where is this area and how do I get there?
Where be area and how me get there?
Give me the key to the door and I shall get the gem myself.
Gimme key and me get gem.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anything in the area that could help me get through without becoming demon fodder?
I will attempt to close the portal as I search for the gem.
Yeah, me try close portal for you.
If the reward is good.
What be reward?
I'm not interested. I just want the gem.
Me no care. Just want gem.
How about a little bit of the reward in advance?
You give some reward now?
I haven't closed the portal yet.
Me no close portal yet.
What was I supposed to do again?
What you want me do again?
The portal has been closed.
Me close portal real good.
Goodbye.
Could you tell me the story about the portal again?
Me want to hear portal story again.
You mentioned that you had lost the gem?
You say you lose gem?
We are both of the same race. Surely you could take that into consideration and offer a bit more.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I've just saved your home from a demon infestation. I want a bigger reward.
Why don't you throw a little extra in so I won't have to hurt you again?
Indeed. Farewell!
Me <race> kind. You <race> kind. Be nice to me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me save you big demon trouble. You give more money?
How 'bout you give more money and me not kill you real bad?
Bye bye.
Sure. That would be handy.
Yuh, it move me so me no walk.
I'll find my own way out.
Me okay. Bye bye.
How in the name of the gods did you get in here?! Prepare to be destroyed, utterly!
Perhaps I was too rash in attacking you. Please, accept my apology.
Then I shall blast you into dust!
What questions do you have?
Please! Attack no more! I am defeated!
I appreciate not being killed. Take this wardstone and my servants shall leave you be.
So the Serpent still seeks an easy way home. Well, he shall have to become used to disappointment. He cannot have the gem.
You don't understand! I have lost the gem and am quite unable to retrieve it, despite my powers. You would be wise to forget about this job and leave now.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, if you wish to get yourself killed, why should I care?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> In good conscience, I cannot! For your own good, <sir/madam>, do not press the issue!
(sigh) I've been defeated by a common houseburglar? Fine, take my gold you barbaric leech!
Will you not even leave me enough to feed myself?! Take it and begone!
There is no more gold. I shall be henceforth known as 'Wanev the Idiot Pauper' by those bastards in the Gibbering Twelve! My reputation is ruined!
Stop, please! If you are so vey desperate take this and begone!
I am Wanev, a man well-versed in the magical arts and of no small renown. I am somewhat displeased at being defeated by you. My idiot friends will have many a jest at my expense.
I should like to counter that with a question of my own. Why are you in my home?
I had heard that Elaith intended to take this gem and prior to receiving that information I had taken little interest in the bauble. I wondered why he intended to steal it.
To be honest, I am not a patient man. I had better things to do than search through my library trying to match the description of the gem to one of the artifacts in the books.
So, I thought it wise to summon an imp or some sort of lesser demon and make him do the legwork. There was, uh, a bit of a setback.
I was somewhat less than careful with the preparations and the little fiend escaped the summoning circle. Let this be a lesson about casting when drunk.
The wretch expanded the portal and began to bring forth his demonic minions. I sealed off the area as fast as I could and sobered up.
In my haste, I left the gem in a storage chest and subsequent forays into my summoning chamber have met with ill luck. I shall truly miss Pooky. He was a loving familiar.
So you see, the area is quite full of demonic adversaries and the gem lies within, most likely stolen by that spiteful imp!
The door behind me shall teleport you there though I keep it well locked for safety's sake.
Take the key and know this: if you should be able to close the demon portal, I would be most grateful. The gem is yours regardless. What say you?
I'm sure I can dig up some magical equipment of no small worth while you try to set things right.
You need only kill the imp that I originally summoned and place his cursed little heart in the summoning brazier. That should take care of the portal. His name is Gulgash.
Please return to me when you have closed the portal for I shall try to find a suitable reward in the meantime.
Very well. If you change your mind, I would be grateful.
I'd love to but I have nothing with me. I'm sure I can find something by the time you've completed the task.
Hello, again. Have you managed to kill the imp and close the portal?
Greetings. Have you changed your mind about attempting to close the portal?
Hmm, yes. The hallway that leads from the first large area you'll find yourself in leads to my treasure chamber. This is, in fact, where I had stored the gem.
Halfway down the hallway is a defence lever. When pulled, it lets off a rather nasty spell in the treasure chamber. This should weaken any demonic beings that might have made their way there.
What do you want now? Don't be rash and attack me again.
Indeed. I made a mistake when summoning that imp and he opened up a demonic portal in my summoning chambers.
Please return when you have closed the portal. The door to the summoning chamber is behind me.
You need only kill the imp that I originally summoned and place his cursed little heart in the summoning brazier. That should take care of the portal. His name is Gulgash.
Ah, excellent. Here is a reward for your troubles. A bruised ego and the loss of a couple of magic items are a small price to pay for having my summoning chamber back.
Well, I have some work to do so we shall most likely not meet again. I could set up a teleport portal to help you get out of here, if you'd like.
Why not, my friend! Here is some extra coin!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmm. You have saved me a great deal of trouble! Here is some extra coin!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> The reward I've given you is quite valuable and quite sufficient.
Calmly, friend. There is no reason for violence. Take my last coins, then!
Goodbye.
No need to get nasty. I'll tell you.
Very well. Goodbye.
As you wish. Farewell.
Bwok, bwok-bwok...
Could I ask you some questions?
Me ask questions, yuh?
Goodbye.
Do you know anything about the cult that spread plague in Neverwinter?
Have you ever been to Charwood?
I saw a cave up past those waterfalls. Do you know anything about it?

You know stuff 'bout that plague cult in Neverwinter?
Uh... you ever been to Charwood?
Me see cave past them waterfalls. What be in dere?
You know odd things about this area?
You're sure you don't know anything else about the cult?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone who might know more?
You sure you not know more 'bout da cult?

I'd be interested in work, if you know of anything.
Are there any places of interest around here that I should visit?
Adventures? What adventures you speak of?
Me want work.
You know good places to go 'round here?
Is there anything else you can tell me about Charwood?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Do you know of anyone who might have been there?
Tell more. Me want to know more 'bout Charwood?
Wolves? Are they a threat?
Wolfies? They be threat to you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You tell me. It hurt nobody.
I'm investigating some recent events you might be aware of.
Me hear of stuff going on. Maybe you know more?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Farmlands stretch on for long time. Me need directions.
Where does the west road lead?
Where does the east road lead?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
Where da west road go?
Where da east road go?
Me need place to buy stuff.
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
No, me have other question.
Who are you?
Who you be?
I want to speak with you about Erik's brooch.
We talk 'bout that brooch of Erik's, 'kay?
Come on, darling, you can tell me, can't you?
You purty when you pout. Come, you tell Mister <FirstName>, yuh?
Be reasonable. It's all he has left to remind him of his ma...
How'd you like me to pry it from your cold, dead hands?
Slow down, I need to ask you about something else.
But it be all that remind him of his ma, yuh?
You give it or me just kill you an' bring him your corpse, yuh?
Slow down. Me ask 'bout something else.
1,000 gold? Deal.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It's a simple peasant's brooch, worth 250 gold pieces at most!
Hand the brooch over or I'll gut you like a fish!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That too much for peasant's doodad. Me give 250 gp.
You give brooch or me slit stomachs, yuh?!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Take the 250 gold. The next fool Erik sends might not be so happy to negotiate.
400 gold? Deal.
250 gp? Deal.
I'm done haggling. Time to kill you and take it for free!
Me not argue no more. Now me kill you!!
I can't afford to spend that much gold on this.
Me not got that much gold for spend on this.
I can't afford to spend that much on this.
Me not afford that much for this.
I don't have 400 gold to spend on this.
Me no got 400 gold to spend on this.
I don't believe you! Hand over the brooch... now!
Hey, if you don't have the item, I want my money back!
What do you mean you've been robbed?
Really? I guess I'll be going then.
Me no believe you! You give item now!
Hey, you no give item. Me want me money back!
What you mean you be robbed?
Yuh? Me guess me go now, den.
That's not fair!
Give my money back or I'll slit your throat!
Fine, keep the money.
That not fair!
You give me money back, or me kill you!
Fine, you keep money.
Maybe I can buy it off you...
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> He loves you Constance. Don't betray that.
For but a peasant's brooch, you'll have my undying love.
Uh, well maybe me buy it off you, then.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But he love you Constance. Be good to him.
Gimme da li'l brooch an' you have my heart, li'l lady...
Money? That's all this means to you?
Money? That be all this mean to you?
All right, tell me a little about Erik.
Uh... tell me 'bout Erik.
Why is the herd so important?
Why this 'erd be so important?
Why is the herd so important?
Why this 'erd be so important?
Why so much money?
Hello, handsome... What brings you to a lady's bedroom?
Fare you well, then. Perhaps we'll speak again.
Yes, yes. On your way.
At long last and good riddance.
I see. A little on the slow side, are we?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two. What do you want to know?
I suppose I can answer a question for you. What might it be?
I'll answer your questions if you don't take too long...
On our last trip to Port Llast, I heard a woman telling how awful the plague had been. Don't know much about the cult but they sound horrible.
Me? No, what's the point? They're pretty self-sufficient it seems and so are we.
Oh, that's the den of those wretched wolves!
Well there's always some sort of adventure to be had when you're this far from the rest of the world.
They've killed two cows already this season. You can ask me pa about it if you're really interested. He's been watching them like a hawk!
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Well... there is that fool Erik... But that's his problem, not mine...
You should talk to me pa. He's out watching over the cattle I'm sure. A helping hand is always welcome, what with the wolves and all.
I'm not sure what you would find interesting. There's our farm and then the one Erik works with his pa. Not much more than that.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> No, I suppose it wouldn't. He gave me a little something and now wants it back.
If you want to know more about it, I suggest you talk to Erik yourself. Just take the north fork and the road will take you right to his front door.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but it's his problem, not mine. If you really must know more, go find him yourself. Where the road forks, just head north.
It gets pretty isolated out here. What news there is is usually about the weather, a new calf, or a good harvest.
Is there something else you need, then?
I don't know, maybe Erik or his pa have heard something more but I doubt it...
Just take the north fork and the road will take you right to their front door. You'll know it by the corn fields and such.
Well, just that as kids, me and Erik used to tell each other the woods were haunted. Just children's stories, though. Little harm can come of them.
Do you have more questions?
Maybe Ingo, Erik's pa. Before his wife passed away, he used to have a tinkering wagon that traveled from hamlet to hamlet around the area.
Did Ma let you in here? This is a bedroom, not a bar table, I'll have you know.
Stop that! If you like me so much, then you're the last person he'll want to approach for help... I have a little something of his, that's all.
I might. What events are you referring to?
Where do you need to go?
(sigh) Make it quick.
What do you want to know?
Yes, I suppose a village idiot might be lost without a village, wouldn't <he/she>?
Follow it long enough and you'll make it all the way to Port Llast. That's the route we take on market day.
Nowhere really. Just into Charwood and I haven't seen anyone head that way in years. It's funny how the road never seems to grow over, though.
Around here? Don't hold your breath. If we can't grow it or make it ourselves, we have to trek all the way into Port Llast to find it.
Is there something else?
I'm Constance O'Deel, the prettiest girl for miles around... Also the *only* girl for miles around, but that's another story. What can I do for you?
The boy's been spreading tales again, has he? No doubt he told you I was a horrible old crone, too! Well I'll tell you what I told him:
If you're going to give a beautiful woman a gift, it's hardly becoming to ask for it back, wouldn't you agree?
Look, are we going to go over this again? I already told you this before, but I guess I have to repeat myself.
What is this, a joke? I already gave it to you, don't you remember?
Now, if there's something else I can do for you...
It's a little late for that, I'm afraid, as I've long since given it away. Honestly, you didn't really expect me to wear the gaudy thing, did you?
Is there something else I can help you with, maybe?
Really? Okay. You may have it for... 1,000 gold!
Whoa, where did that come from? Erik may want his brooch back but I know for a fact that he wouldn't have sent someone to kill me!
Look, if this stupid brooch means that much to you maybe we could work out a deal. 1,000 gold and it's yours, all right?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> *Sigh* Bargaining with Erik would have been a lot simpler, I'll have you know. Fine, then: 250...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Okay, maybe I couldn't get 1,000 for it but I sure could get 400!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Well you're the one who seems to want it so much! 1,000 gold seems like a fair enough price for memories of one's mother.
Give me a second, I have the brooch right here in my pocket...
1,000 gold? We... We could buy another half herd with this! Thank you so much, you can't know how much this means to my family!
Hey, hey, hey! Let's settle down. I'm sure Erik didn't send you to kill me! Look, I'll go as low as 250 then but no more threats from you...
Fine, but you'll have to catch me, first!
All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle... but you sure are a sweet talker.
Well, then I guess you're out of luck. 1,000 gold seems a perfectly reasonable price for memories of one's mother, wouldn't you agree?
Hey, if you don't have 250 on you, what use are you? One way or another, my family needs that money.
Well if you don't even have 400 gold to spare, what good are you? Haggle all you want, but that's as low as I'll go.
Here it is and I hope that fool Erik has learned not to give his heart so freely. Now, is there anything else I can do for you?
What the -? Where is it? It's gone! Somebody must have picked my pocket! I've been robbed!!!
You! You were involved in this, weren't you? Erik sent you to distract me so someone else could pick my pocket! I'm not stupid, you know!
Well my family and I aren't going to come out on the short end of this mess! I'm keeping your money!
Hmph. I'm glad we could reach an understanding. I guess we can consider this matter settled, then. Is there anything else I can do for you?
How dare you threaten me after all this! You're a cruel and evil <man/woman>.
Fair? Don't talk to me about fair! I've just been robbed and I *know* you were involved somehow! So I'm keeping your money, end of story.
That may be so but it will also fetch a fine price in Port Llast. Enough to by a couple head of cattle to replace those killed by the wolves, of late...
Look, 250 gold would buy us a healthy bull, let us rebuild the herd. If you really love me, you'll give at least that, won't you?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well he's a fool to do so. All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle! *Sigh* But I know you're right...
Look, 250 gold would buy us a healthy bull, let us rebuild the herd. Give me that much and you may do what you wish with the brooch.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> He loves me? He loves a good romp in the hay is all he loves and you'll not convince me otherwise!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well he's a fool to do so. All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle! *Sigh* But I know you're right...
Look, 400 gold buys us a couple of good jersey milkers to replace what we've lost to the wolves. Give me that much and you can have the stupid brooch.
*Sigh* Bargaining with Erik would have been a lot simpler, I'll have you know. Fine, then: 250...
Back again, are you?
Look, my ma and his ma were best friends before she passed on! If she would have known we were struggling, she'd have been happy to give it!
I know, I know. "He's a nice boy." That's what me ma always says and I can't say I entirely disagree...
But if he was a really nice boy, he'd spend more time helping out me pa and less time picking wildflowers, and that's all there is to it.
Me pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
Me pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
Me pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
Those stupid wolves have almost been the death of us, even if all they ever preyed on was the cattle!
Don't think I enjoyed doing this to poor Erik! I like him, honest. But sometimes things get desperate, all right? I need the 1,000 gold.
...Mooo...
Who are you?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Who you be?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What do you know of the cultists who beset Neverwinter?
I'm looking for work, if you know of any.
I need some directions.
You know stuff 'bout da cult from Neverwinter?
Me look for job. You got one?
Me need directions.
What other things are on your mind?
What be on you mind?
Where does the west road lead?
Where does the east road lead?
Where can I go to buy supplies?
Maybe I could ask you something else.
Where da west road go?
Where da east road go?
Me need buy stuff, yuh?
Me got other question.
Tell me about this favor.
You tell me 'bout favor, yuh?
What's so important about the brooch?
Can't you just buy the brooch from her?
Tell me about Constance.
Okay, I'll do it.
Why you want brooch so much?
Why you not just pay her for brooch?
Tell me 'bout Constance, yuh?
Okay, me do it.
I have some more questions about Constance.
Could give me an advance on this reward you're promising?
Me got some questions 'bout job.
Me want money up front to do this.
What's so important about this brooch again?
Tell me again where I can find her.
Tell me about Constance again.
Is there anything else about her you're not telling me?
Why you want dis brooch again?
You say again where Miss Constants be.
Tell me more 'bout Miss Constants, yuh?
There be more stuff 'bout dis job you not tell me?
I want to talk about that brooch again.
We talk 'bout dat brooch again, yuh?

You was talking 'bout job before.
I have the brooch.
Me got brooch here, yuh.
Now, about that reward you mentioned...
You said you give reward, yuh?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> She wasn't easy to convince, you know. I think you could spare a little more.
You'd better cough up more or you won't live long enough to regret it!
Thanks. It was a joy to help.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me work hard for this. You give more gold, yes?
Me want more gold! Give more or you be sorry and dead... at da same time!
Thanks, yuh? Me like work for you.
I suppose the reward is adequate.
Me guess reward be okay.
Surely you could spare more for a fellow of <race> blood?
You give me more cause we both be <race> kind, 'kay?
That's a lot of money. Are you sure you can afford it?
That be big heap of money. How you afford it?
Wanev? Who's he?
Wanev? Who that?
What would your ma think about this?
Wha' your ma think 'bout dis, you think... I think...
How do you know she doesn't want money?
How you know she not want money?
Maybe we can turn the tables: I'll flirt with her.
Maybe we turn da table, yuh? Me be da flirter.
Hey, who do you think you are barging into a man's room like that! The door was locked for a reason...
Ah, the charming lock-breaker. To what do I owe the pleasure of a return visit?
Back so soon, are you lock-breaker? I hope you're not here just to mock me and pull on heartstrings.
How goes the search? Have you recovered the brooch, or is there something else I can do for you?
*Sigh* Women... And that's all I have to say on the matter...
It's been good talking to you, <sir/madam>.
I guess I'll see you around.
I'm Erik, Ingo's son. Now, that's as polite as I'm going to be until you tell me why you broke into my room?
We don't hear much out here. I saw a suspicious-looking fellow take the road to Charwood a week back or so, though. Maybe he was one.
I can't really tell you much else. I'm sorry, but I've got other things on my mind right now. Is there anything else you need?
I know much of the area around here, so I suppose I could help out. Where exactly do you need directions to?
The west road? That takes you by the tower of that wizard fellow, Wanev, and eventually on to Port Llast.
Anywhere else you need to get to?
Into the woods, that one. Pa says it's haunted and he'd know. Apparently there used to be a village named Charwood in there but I've never seen it...
Ain't much between here and Port Llast, I'm afraid. We only go in at harvest season. Me, pa, and the O'Deel's are pretty much on our own. The O'deels live just down the road.
I suppose I have the time for a few questions. Try to make it quick, though.
No surprise there. I imagine someone like you gets lost a fair bit...
You? You can't be serious...
Hmph. I could sure use a favor right now and maybe you're a <man/woman> who can help. Interested in the details?
Your words are a little muddled, but I think I understood you. You want the details, right?
My pa might have told that I've been feeling a little down, lately. Well he doesn't even know the half of it. Sure, I'm a little heartbroken but...
It's all me pa has left to remind him of my ma... Of all the things to show Constance! *Sigh* I ought to have stuck with wildflowers...
She wanted to see me ma's brooch, so I brought it over for her. Now the witch won't give it back!
So do you think you could get the brooch? I'll reward whoever brings it to me as well as I can, I promise.
You don't know Constance. I don't know if anyone does. It's not money she's after. She just wants to see me beg. Well I won't do it!
See, she has to learn that people's hearts aren't just toys to be played with... Please? I'll reward you for the brooch, I promise.
Her hair's the color of cornsilk, her laugh's like the waterfall, her eyes are as blue as the sky... Her heart, though, it's sprung like a bear trap!
And thanks to a fool like me, she now has me ma's brooch!!! I'll reward whoever brings it back to me, I swear.
Will you? She's farmer O'Deel's daughter, the one who keeps cattle up by the waterfalls...
Do whatever it takes to get me ma's brooch back, short of laying a finger on her... *Sigh* Look at me, I still worry for her, even now...
Return to me with the brooch and you shall have your reward.
Don't worry, you'll get your reward when I get the brooch. You be good on your word, I'll be good on mine.
So do I, so do I. But go ahead, ask what you will. I'll do my best to answer.
It's all me pa has left to remind him of me ma... Of all the things to show Constance! *Sigh* I should have stuck with wildflowers...
Anything else before you get that brooch?
She's farmer O'Deel's daughter, the one who keeps cattle up by the waterfalls... Remember, don't hurt her. I just need that brooch back.
Her hair's the color of cornsilk, her laugh like the waterfall... And her eyes, they're as blue as the sky!
Well, I don't know that it matters but her pa's been having trouble with wolves, lately. Maybe you can get on his good side if you take care of that.
I already gave you a job, remember? Get me ma's brooch back from Constance, remember? Sorry, but that's the only job I had to give.
Is there anything else you need?
I don't believe it! I misjudged you. I thought you were nothing but a slack-jawed city-fool!
How did you ever manage to convince her!? Actually, nevermind... I probably don't want to know.
Yes, of course. The reward. Here you go: 500 gold pieces in exchange for me ma's old brooch.
I must admit, I didn't really like you when we first met but you've proven to be a fine friend. Here you go, 400 gold pieces.
You've been a good friend to a poor soul down on his luck. Here you go, 650 gold pieces in exchange for the brooch.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you did earn a little something extra. Very well, here's another 100 gold.
But now I must take my leave. Me pa was getting worried I'd never run those errands for him...
N-now just settle down, there's no need to get upset. No need for unpleasantness. Here, I've got another 100 gold, but that's it. Just take it, it's yours.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Well I'd rather not think about what lengths she made you go to, all right? I think I've been more than fair with my reward.
I suppose it would be cruel of me not to show more gratitude to kin like you. Very well, here's another 100 gold for your troubles.
It's money I've made off my own plot of land. I was saving it to marry Constance someday but that would be a foolish venture, I'm afraid.
Still needing more directions?
Aw, he's all full of hot air. I've seen him at the inn in Port Llast, trying to chat up the women.
I'll bet he's never done an honest day of hard work in his life.
It's that tease, Constance O'Deel - she knows she has me wrapped around her little finger, so all she does is toy with me. Oh, I'm such a fool...
Forget my stupid heart, if I don't get that brooch back, pa will have my hide instead!
If she were still alive, she probably would have given the brooch to Constance long ago. But ma's not still alive, see? That's the problem...
I feel like I don't know anything anymore. Go ahead, try to buy it from her, maybe it will work. *Sigh* Women are way too complicated...
*Sigh* She'd be all over someone like you... Oh, very well. You're sure you're just trying to get the brooch back, right?
Hey, if it gets me the brooch and maybe teaches her a lesson or two, who am I to argue. You're sure this is just to get the brooch, though, right?

No doubt I've seen you a million times by now, not that I'd ever remember it. We've got enough trouble without you.

I won't let it be known... I won't let it... It can repeat forever, but I won't let it be known...
No one cares. That's the price we paid, I guess. No one cares, and it never ends... and I'll never let it be known...
Karlat Jhereg might know what you want, but he's beyond caring about you, me... anything.

He's the one everyone's forgotten. He and Karlat were brothers and Lords of this place before we got... trapped here. He was a cleric of Lathander, once...
Karlat Jhareg? He was a wizard, and powerful too. We thought Charwood would be safe at the foot of his castle. Well we were fools, weren't we...
It's at the far end of town, beyond the gate. If you want to go there, go, but nothing but death awaits you there, endless death.

Time moves slowly here... almost stops... He stopped it... stopped all the dying... But... But it was too late for the... for the children...
