How do I put an end to this?
How me end this?
I should destroy everything! Including you! Nobody is innocent!
Me stop everything! Even you! All bad!
I'll put an end to all of this.
Me stop all of this.
I still think I should kill you too.
Me still think you die too.
What happens if Karlat's destroyed? His spell caused this.
What happens if Karlat destroyed? His spell make all this.
Here... please... You've come at last. So many stop at the village. So many fell in here... Talk to me... please...
Real live people! Real! And live! But can I trust them? I don't know about that. I'll have to see. yes, I'll have to see...
I have given all I can. I have done all I can. No more words can I say. The scepters are the key to his chamber.
You have him! You have him in the jar! Destroy him! Sanctify him! Smash him with the light of morning!
Someone has him! He's in the jar! Find them and make them sactify him! Make sure they smash him with the light of morning!
Back to me! Or not? Are you the same? I don't know! Have you the things! The stuff? I have to know if I can trust you!
Please, make sure he does not survive. The phylactery must be filled and then smashed by the light of morning. Use it against him!
I am Quint! What would you have in this place? Prithee, will you help cleanse this place?
Of course not, of course, of course. The troubles of others are so far away. The misery of others is not your concern. Of course.
Inquisitive. A good sign. Now, don't keep them waiting, Quint, you fool. Damn, I'm talking to myself. Did I say that out loud? Shut up, shut up!
Let me explain, if I may? May I? Yes, I shall try. This is Castle Jhareg, the hell I have created. I trapped them all, you see... you see?
Wisely skeptical, just as I am. Good. Very good. No, don't judge. Just explain it. And stop talking to yourself! Shut up!
But would you... prithee... take but a moment of your time to listen to what I might say? It's not much to ask. Not much.
Fair enough. Yes, fair. I will not stop you. I will not goad. It's not my place to do so... however... one thing...
Please, explore. Confront who you will. I encourage it. Given a chance, I will help you, too. Remember that. Just ask for Quint. That's me. Quint.
Er, please, I don't know if I can trust you... so much trickery... if you do some things... I will know. Grant me this, will you?
Yes, see, the thing is, I trapped them. I trapped them here, and I don't know if you will join their evil or not. I need proof...
The siblings carry scepters. Keys. Bring them and I will know you are not with them. I will tell you more... I can't until then. I can't let him free.
That's the spirit! Fight their evil, and I will talk more about it... help you get further... help you stop it all... better than I did.
Yes, yes, evil all around. But what side are you on? Show me. Bring me something from someone, and I'll tell more. Really.
Good, good, good! Simple things, these tests. You bring back the stuff you find somewhere from someone, and I trust you. Really, that's good.
Not yet! It's not time yet! You need the keys from the siblings, and the stuff from the Quint. That's me, you know.
I put it where he couldn't get it, even if he got out! That's where he must go when it's full! When it's filled! Not yet, but hang on to it!
What, like there was all that much? Don't think so. I just said I needed you to bring the scepter keys... or something... to prove your intent.
That's about it, really. I need your honest intent. Have to have it.
Not ready for that, yet! Not yet! You need the things from the others! They open the way when I know you are true!
Careful with it until then! I put it where he couldn't get it even if he got out. When it's time, that's where it's got to go back!
Evil everywhere, yes, and everyone is grey from it. I don't deny, but there is worse that needs fixing, and better than I tried.
Please, bring the things from the siblings. Scepters, I think... don't I?
You do? That's a first! I mean, some other people come, but they never got a scepter! I though I should ask nicer! What do you have?
Don't fiddle around! There's too much dead afoot for this! Please, ask as I do... as I ask... or something. Don't jerk around!
The builder! The constructor! You got it! She'll be back, but that's good! Keep it! You'll need it soon enough!
The scortcher! The burner! Marvelous! He'll be back, of course, but that's good! Keep it! You'll need it soon!
The builder and the burner! Both! Well, I suppose I can trust you well enough over that! Keep them, though, because you'll need them!
I have seen one of the scepters of my siblings. Have you another? Do you know what I ask? Were you here before?
You must know... you must know some things about this place, then. I can trust you, but do you trust me?
Of course you do. We all do. I wish I had all the answers. I wish I had the questions... I wish I could think straight!!
I'm sorry, I tried, but I failed. He got too far. We all let it get too far. Everyone was complicit. Everyone wanted to be powerful with him.
<He/She> doesn't care. <He/She> doesn't care. Why should they care. I mean, my perspective is probably biased. I mean, I failed...
They trust... am I worthy of it, I wonder? I wonder a lot. I wonder what would have been and what is... Frankly, "what is" is messed up.
The villagers were fuel, and protection and whatever else he wanted. He wanted lichdom, and we just let it get too far.
Poor villagers? There are things you don't know yet. You get another scepter and see what knowledge it carries like stench!
So long... You don't know what happened. You don't realize the consequence of waiting too long. Another scepter will show you. Too long...
You have the scepters from my siblings... you know much of what happened, but I must give you this before I continue... Please...
I tried to stop it. How could I know it was too late? Everyone died... except me. I don't know how long it's been... seasons... centuries?
Everyone dead, and trapped where they are. The villagers... Charwood... trapped by their sins... complicit... they sold their neighbors...
There is more you must discover. My mind... I cannot do these things... but you... I have another sibling... you must retrieve the scepters.
See, they are keys, and they unlock things. Bad things. Things that will need to be destroyed. Get the second, and I will give you the third.
Show me the second scepter, and I shall aid you as best I can. It will soon be time for the opening, and destruction soon follows!
That's why it went on so long. They were being killed, but not even they would stand up to fight. Why was I supposed to risk it?
A lottery to choose the lucky... the ones that died didn't have to live with the bargain. When I stopped Karlat... they paid the sins they owed...
Everyone. I attacked Karlat, but his spell was tainted... not stopped. Everyone was killed... except me. They are shades... phantoms...
They don't even know it, I think. Doomed to repeat the time just before, when their shame still lived. I killed them all by trying to help...
I don't know... I have outlived my halfelf blood... something else sustains me. How long can I live? Not as long as they will stay dead.
Nothing changes... but it creeps through. They live, but don't live. Everyone is trapped where they were. No hope for an end... until you came.
It must seem that way. I see a logic to it... but I've been mad for years.... years! Still, you now have the means to do it.
The scepters... they weren't an errand to amuse. They are the keys... they are the keys to the place where he is trapped.
See, I knew they couldn't work together... I knew they were trapped where they were... so those were the keys.
When you find him... Karlat... trap his soul where he wanted. I hid it where he couldn't get it. Smash it with the light of morning when you have him.
You know... I haven't the foggiest. Maybe we'll all die? Maybe we'll all live? Maybe everything stays the same... wouldn't that be hell?
One way or another, there has to be an end. Nothing has changed here in so long... so long...
You have that power. Everyone else came back, but I don't know if I would. I leave it up to you. I did what I could... I did...
Why do you call me Judge?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Did you write the notes in those chests?
Who are you?
What is this place? Who is Lord over this castle?
Why do you haunt this place, Spirit?
Why you call me Judge?
Huh? What this place be? Who be Lord here?
Why you haunt castle, ghostie?
Hmph. Who you be?
Tell me more...
Get to the point, will you?
Yuh? Ooh, you tell more...
Hmph. You have point, yuh? Get to it.
Tell me more...
Get to the point, will you?
Yuh? Ooh, you tell more...
Hmph. You have point, yuh? Get to it.
I have some questions first, Spirit.
Very well. I shall return to you with the oaths.
Uh, me have questions, yuh?
Yuh, okay. Me return with oaths.
I'm not your Judge and I'm *not* visiting your stupid towers!
Hmph. This 'Judge' stuff is stupid. Me go now.
Quint's one of the accused? Didn't I see him earlier?
What is this crime over which I stand in Judgment?
Will you accept any Judgment? Any at all?
What if I choose to kill the brothers Jhareg?
All right, enough questions.
Quint? He trapped up there? But me see him earlier, yuh?
You okay with any kind of Judgment? Ooh, this be fun!
What if me kill da Jhareg fellas instead?
Okay, 'nuff questions, yuh?
Uh, what be da crime?
Oaths? What oaths?
Yes.
No.
Can you refresh my memory about what's going on here?
Oaths? Why you want oaths?
Uh, me forget da story here. You tell me again, yuh?
Both Quint's and Karlat's.
Quint's.
Karlat's.
Sorry, I was mistaken. I don't have either.
Uh... Oops! Me no have nothing...
Yes, I am ready.
No, I still need time to think about it.
Yuh, okay. Me give Judgment now.
No, me still need to think it through a li'l.
I find Quint guilty. Give the phylactery to Karlat.
I find Karlat guilty. Destroy the phylactery.
I find neither Quint nor Karlat guilty of the crime.
Me find Quint guilty. You give philacta-thingy to Karlat, yuh?
Me find Karlat guilty. You destroy philacta-thingy.
Me find both Quint and Karlat innocent.
I have the written oath of the demon Belial.
Me have da oath of da demon-guy, Belial.
I have no evidence, Spirit.
Me no have evidence, Miss Spirit.
I shall take the phylactery myself.
You shall guard it as you always have, Spirit.
Uh, me take philacta-thingy meself, yuh?
Uh, you keep it, just like always, okay?
Judgment? I don't understand what's going on.
Judgment? Huh? Me no understand...
It was simple. Quint admitted his own guilt.
I found Karlat's cause to be most just.
The Judge's heart is <his/hers> alone. Ask no more.
I chose randomly between them.
Easy. That Quint guy say he guilty... out loud, even!
Uh, me think Karlat be good guy, yuh?
Haha! It easy! Me just flip coin!
That be da Judge's secret, yuh?
Yes, give me the Morninglord's account.
No. The hour is late. Let us adjourn this court.
Yuh, tell me what da Morning-guy say.
No. It be late. We all go home now.
Karlat's story didn't hold up to scrutiny.
I found Quint's cause to be most just.
Karlat be just a big, fat liar.
Uh, me think Quint be good guy, yuh?
We all must be free, be it to do evil or good.
I didn't realize this would be the consequence.
Evil? Good? It don't matter. Only freedom.
Uh, me thought this end up different...
In their own way, everyone is guilty.
In da end, everybody be guilty, yuh?
Greetings, Judge, and welcome to the Castle Jhareg... I hope you have learned your lessons well.
Not I, my child. The notes you speak of were placed there long ago by Lathander, god of the dawn, in anticipation of your coming.
I call you by what you are and what you may yet be, my child. Lathander, god of the dawn, has waited long for you.
I am a divine spirit sent by the god Lathander to watch over this place until the day of Judgment. And now that day has come...
This castle was once home to the brothers Jhareg. Now it stands trapped in time by Lathander, god of the dawn, in anticipation of your coming.
I am no mere haunting ghost, though these halls have their fair share of those...
Long ago did the crime take place and so great were its consequences that Lathander himself felt unfit to stand in Judgment over those accused...
It was a mortal crime, requiring a mortal as its Judge. So it was that this Castle and its village were placed beyond the weave of time, awaiting your arrival.
The accused are confined in their towers beyond the north door. They are known as the brothers Jhareg, Karlat in the west tower and Quint within the east.
You must learn from them the nature of the crime and from them obtain their written oath. When both oaths are in my hands, I shall hear your Judgment.
Here now, this key shall open the north door, revealing stairs to the two towers. Show wisdom, Judge, and compassion for us all...
You are the Judge. Take this key and explore the castle. When you obtain the written oaths of the brothers Jhareg, present them to me so you may stand in Judgment.
Then ask them and I shall answer as Lathander gives me leave.
Then go into the night, dear Judge, and find the dawn we have awaited for so long.
As you wish. We have waited this long without a dawn. We shall wait forever if we must. If you are not the Judge, the Judge shall come.
Before the dark befell this castle, Quint Jhareg was Lathander's cleric. When the Morninglord sealed the towers, he allowed Quint to project an image of himself into the town below.
Perhaps seeing the ghosts of the village was meant to be a special punishment for Quint or perhaps balm to soothe a wounded soul.
Lathander either loves or hates his fallen cleric. Either way, the Morninglord knew he held too great a bias to stand in Judgment over Quint's soul.
By Lathander's will, I cannot say. In telling you of the horror, I might sway your Judgment. No, you must learn of it from the brothers themselves...
How many Judgments can there be? There is guilt and there is innocence and consequences for them both.
You do not have the power in this place. The castle has slipped through the weave of time. In the same moment that they die, they are reborn.
Only I have the power to bring this place back into the weave and it is a power I cannot use until the Judge provides his Judgment.
Then do you accept the role of Judge and the task of Judgment?
Greetings, Judge. Do you bring with you the oaths of the brothers Jhareg?
Which oaths do you bear?
Thank you. Are you prepared to stand in Judgment?
Quint and Karlat Jhareg, I summon you unto the court of Judgment.
You know well the charges that the Morninglord has brought against you: On a midwinter night, long ago, the children of Charwood were brought here and slaughtered.
Now it is time for that Judge to decide the fate of us all... Judge, what is your ruling?
Karlat, you have been found innocent in the Judge's eyes. Here is the phylactery stolen from you by your brother. Take it and go.
I too thank you for my freedom, Judge. Long have I stood watch over this castle. I have but one question: What brought you to your Judgment?
When you leave, I shall seal the castle doors and you shall never return... May the Judge always know the blessings of the Morninglord.
Quint, you have been found innocent in the Judge's eyes. Be free from your madness and die knowing that your brother's soul shall not be tainted by undeath.
There is no denying that a great crime has been committed, Judge. What evidence do you bring that it was not at the hands of the brothers Jhareg?
Indeed... Belial, Lord of Fire, I summon you unto the court of Judgment.
Long have I sensed that you, too, have been trapped within this castle. The Judge has produced your written confession and found you guilty.
I stand guard over the phylactery by Lathander's will. The fate of that phylactery determines the fate of all who gather here. Even me. Even you.
By the Morninglord's power, I shall make it so, Judge. Take this vessel and guard it, unto the end of your days.
With your Judgment, the souls of all gathered here are finally free of this place. I have but one question: What brought you to your Judgment?
But - But Judge... No, I shall not argue the Judgment... Just know that, in making it, you have cursed all of us gathered here.
Here we shall stay, forever exiled from the weave of time to live out our endless lives in madness and decay. So have you Judged, so shall it be.
If you have no evidence, then you cannot make such a Judgment. I must ask you to Judge again.
Wise is the Judge who gives thought to his Judgment. Speak with me again when you are ready.
Then I shall hold it for you and keep it safe until you return with his brother's.
Then come speak with me once you do.
Well, no matter. We have waited one eternity, we can wait another...
Ah, then perhaps you are not familiar with the sad tale of Castle Jhareg.
Of course, Judge. You need but ask...
I hold the oaths of the brothers Jhareg and this court requires only the presence of a Judge. Are you ready to stand in Judgment?
You are not the only Judge in this place. But explore the castle and return to me when you obtain the written oaths of the brothers Jhareg.
Through the north door lie stairs to the two towers. Show wisdom, Judge, and compassion for us all...
Then that is both of them. Are you prepared to stand in Judgment?
Greetings, Lady Guardian. Greetings, Judge.
All of us with faces dour, waiting for the Judgment hour!
You, the accused, have each spoken in your defense and given your written oath to the Judge before you.
Our souls long for rest, Lady Guardian, and our hearts for justice.
Hold your tongue, Karlat Jhareg. You have had your say and given your oath. That is all this court requires of you.
At last! What was stolen from me has been returned and I may finally shed this half-dead form!
Judge, you grant me the suffering I have begged of Lathander for so long. For each child, I shall travel anew into the Abyss to do my penance.
That much is true. Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
Perhaps it was. Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
So be it. Sometimes Fate is the wisest Judge of all. Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
Very well. To all assembled, then, the Judge declares this court adjourned.
That a slaughter of children happened within these walls one midwinter's night is beyond refute. Less clear, however, are the events that led to such a crime.
Indeed, it was Quint Jhareg who gathered up the village children for a party within the castle library...
Yet it was his brother Karlat who tricked him into doing so and who cast the spell that caused the slaughter...
Karlat sought to become a noble baelnorn, you see, and had been told that the blood of innocents would be required...
It was the demon Belial who told him that lie, twisting Karlat's good intentions to an evil end...
The phylactery was at the heart of it. Karlat needed it, Belial gave it, Quint stole it, Lathander confiscated it, I guarded it, and you Judged its fate.
It is done. To all assembled, then, Lathander declares this court adjourned.
I did, Judge! Never will I forgive myself!
I made it quick, just a moment of pain. I was told that they would be returned to life as soon as I finished my ceremony but... I never finished...
Some of my finest work, might I add. Even now, the Dark Lords ride into battle with the name of Belial, Lord of Fire, on their lips!
No!!! The phylactery is everything!
At last, the madness ends... The phylactery has brought nothing but evil to this house.... Come, brother. Now we both can rest...
I too thank you for my freedom, Judge. Long have I stood watch over this castle. I have but one question: What brought you to your Judgment?
Wise is the Judge who sees beyond the surface. Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
Does Lathander have sudden need of my services, Lady Guardian?
<He/She> may very well find me guilty, m'lady, but punishing me shall be quite another matter. You hold no power over me, Guardian...
Decide, Judge. What shall be the fate of the phylactery?
Ha! Your Judge is a fool, Guardian! The court is closed, then, the case resolved. By Lathander's own decree, we are free to go... Even me!
The Firelord speaks true but your decision is final. Lathander has decreed that there is no turning back.
Well-spoken, then, and not without merit. Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
Then may woe follow you, Judge, wherever you may go... Do you wish now to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
No! And be trapped in this place forever!? It cannot be!
You are wiser than I surmised, my Judge... We deserve nothing more than this endless penance...
I have but one question left: What brought this Judge to <his/her> Judgment?
Even you, Judge? *Sigh* Do you wish, at least, to hear Lathander's version of this tragedy?
Intruders!
What do you guard?
What you guard?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I mean no harm to what you guard.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me no harm to what you's guarding.
Die, creature!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Jardak orders that you give it to me!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You give to me! Jardak order it!
I am summoned to protect. Speak the words of appeasement or feel my wrath!
Who are you? I guard for Jardak Jhereg, and will turn you to cinders if you do not offer explanation!
Foolish mortal! Burn!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps you are no threat. Leave this place.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You are not supposed to be here! You are a trespasser! Burn!
What I guard is of no importance to you, unless Jardak himself has directed you to receive it. It is in my otherworld domain.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> As the master wills it. Your tone is steady, and does not lie.
Back to the grave, you undead beast!
Are you Karlat Jhareg?
Why is this tower so full of fire?
Why do you sound so confused?
Be at peace. I am the Judge you seek.
You be Mister Karlat, yuh?
Why you sound confused?
Yuh, me be da Judge-guy.
Why there so much fire here?
Die, Mister Undead Beast! Die again!
Tell me more...
Get to the point.
Yuh? Ooh, you keep talking...
You got point? Get to it.
Tell me more...
Get to the point.
Yuh? Ooh, you keep talking...
You got point? Get to it.
Will you give that as a written oath?
I've spoken to Quint. He tells a different story.
This your journal?
I still have some questions.
You gives that as written oath?
Me talk to Quint already. His story different.
Me still have questions.
Why would Quint do such a thing?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> A lich's phylactery, huh? Aren't liches evil?
Who has the phylactery now?
What about Lathander and the Guardian?
But why Quint do horrible thing like that?
Who has philacta-thingy now?
What 'bout da Guardian an' her god?
All right, enough questions.
Okay, 'nuff questions, yuh?
You tricked your brother into the crime.
You sought undeath out of a greed for knowledge.
You acted on the advice of someone named Belial.
Nothing. It doesn't say anything of note.
You tricked Quint into da crime.
You greedy for knowledge. That's why you undead.
Some guy called Belial, he tell you to do stuff.
Huh? Oh, it not say anything important...
That's all it said. Will you give that as a written oath?
Uh, that's all it said. You gives that as written oath?
Judge? Judge, is that you? I don't remember -- it's so hard to string my thoughts together one to the next...
Yes. Yes, that's my name... It's been so long since I've heard someone speak it! The last one to do so was my... my brother...
I just don't know whether or not we've spoken before. I live in a constant daze. Everything's come undone since my brother... since that night...
Yes. Yes, I seek an end to this torment of unknowing! I do not even know if we have spoken before... Everything's come undone since my brother...
Fire? I - I was doing research once, trying to find something... And I found it - I did but... then my brother took it from me...
No, I have forgotten many things but not my power. The last time I used it was that night... the night my... my brother...
Quint! Yes, it was him! He was responsible! He invited all the children of the village to his tower and he began to read to them...
It was horrible... The blood, it was everywhere. Every one of them died, every child... He's gone mad, you know. My younger brother has gone mad...
I arrived there too late. I rebuked him and he groveled there before me. He said he did it for me, all for me, all for the love of an older brother!
I unleashed the fire against him but he fled and stole my most powerful artifact, my phylactery, and made use of it.
Now we are all stuck here because of him, pressed like flowers between the pages of the Book of Time.
I have the time, Judge, if not always the memory. Ask what you will.
I once had half-elven blood in my veins. Among the elves, some called Baelnorns seek lichdom that they might stand watch over their families.
I would have preserved our family had not my brother first destroyed it. When he interfered, I became but a half-lich, somehow.
If only I can recover the phylactery he stole, I can finish the ceremony and become what I was meant to be... It would free us all from this wretched place.
He was young and foolish, with no understanding of the arcane arts, no understanding of the world in which we wizards operate...
We consort with demons and keep imps as our familiars but does that make us evil?
Perhaps he performed the unspeakable act in an effort to earn my respect, my affection. Perhaps he wanted to prove himself before his brother.
Lathander gave it to the Guardian for safekeeping and she has kept it ever since.
If only I can recover it, I can finish the ceremony and become what I was meant to be... It would free us all from this accursed place.
What good is a god of the dawn if he traps us in this eternal night? My brother prayed to him before the madness came on...
The Guardian may claim Lathander did not stand in Judgment, yet Quint wanders the village freely while I rot in here forever, in this wretched half-form!
Yes, my Judge...
I have suffered here too long, tormented by forgetfulness amidst this endless pall of smoke. I would only be too glad...
Here, take it: my written oath of every word that I have uttered here. Present it to the Guardian and let us have our Judgment.
Of course he does! Did you expect him to confess? No doubt in his madness and shame, even he no longer knows the truth of things.
I have given you my story. Let him give you his. You are the Judge, not us.
Why yes. Yes, the hand is mine. What does it say? I have half forgotten...
I... I needed the blood. It was necessary. Without it, how could I protect the village? It was a high price but it would have meant a bright future...
Is a greed for Knowledge any different than a greed for Love, a greed for Justice? Before you Judge me, Judge yourself...
Belial? I - I know that name... Yes, he was a demon I consorted with. He was the one who gave me the phylactery and taught me to use it...
Why, the summoning room is just down the hall... Maybe he would know the truth of things!
Of course. Is that everything, then? Do you want my oath?
It was horrible... Quint killed the children and when I rebuked him, he wrested my phylactery from me, cursing us all to be trapped here forever.
We await your decision, Judge.
Bloodstained and desecrated, this statue of Lathander, god of the dawn, feels cold to the touch. It seems void of any divine presence.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Attack other golems. Go!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Attack living creatures. Humanoids not with me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Attack people alive, but not friends of me.
Do nothing.
<StartAction>The creature stares at you mindlessly, waiting for you to put some sort of thought in its head, if you have the will to command it.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Attack... other... golems...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Attack... attack... attack...
Attack... living... creatures... not... you...
You are a madman, that much is clear.
Are you Quint Jhareg?
Why do the undead walk these halls?
Didn't we meet before?
Be at peace. I come as the Judge.
You be Mister Quint, yuh?
We meet before?
No, me be da Judge-guy.
Why there so many undead here?
Hmm. You no make much sense.
Tell me more...
Get to the point.
Yuh? Ooh, you keep talking...
You got point? Get to it.
Tell me more...
Get to the point.
Yuh? Ooh, you keep talking...
You got point? Get to it.
Will you give that as a written oath?
I've spoken to Karlat. He tells a different story.
This your journal?
I still have some questions.
You gives that as written oath?
Me talk to Karlat already. His story different.
Me still have questions.
What role did your brother play in this?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You seem eager to confess...
Do you know what a phylactery is?
What Judgment do you long for?
What your brother do in all this?
What is this philacta-thingy?
What be da Judgment you wanting?
All right, enough questions.
Okay, 'nuff questions, yuh?
You loved the children.
You thought it was going to be a party.
You said your brother was acting strangely.
You're right, it doesn't say anything.
You loved da children, yuh?
You thought it was for big party.
You said Karlat act funny.
Yuh, that's right. It not say anythin' important...
That's all it said. Will you give that as a written oath?
Uh, that's all it said. You gives that as written oath?
Stay back, dead one! I have fire to fight fire, you know! Fire to... fight fire...
Quint - Quaintly, Quintessentially, Quint. But not Jhareg, not anymore. My dishonor brings me too much shame to ever taint my father's name...
We have and haven't, hadn't and had. Maybe it was my ghost you saw, counting woes... those I created and those that created me, yes?
You? You'll be my Judge? But I'm not ready, I've just begun a new stage of my punishment! I'm going mad, you know. It helps me feel the pain more clearly...
They're here to punish me, to remind me of what I've done, to remind me of what my brother almost was. I stopped one corpse and created more!
Yes, clear, isn't it? The madness makes the pain more clear. It's a calculated madness, self-inflicted, and no defense, no defense, no defense, you hear?
Did you see a ghost stealing children from the village? That was me! Guilt is the gift that keeps on giving, you see, over and over and over.
Blood on the pages where I read to them... Every one of them died, every child... I've gone quite mad, you know. Quite quintessentially mad...
I was too early and too late, you see? The children were dead but I stopped my brother from joining them at least!
I stole it, I stole his phylactery, and I ran, oh how I ran from him, lips full of prayer. I gave it to Lathander, you know, for him to destroy.
But it was already too late. He didn't destroy, he just tucked it away, tucked all of us away between the folds of time.
And I have answers! But are they to your questions, we'll just have to see...
Confess ten times and it becomes a habit. Confess a hundred times, it becomes an obsession... Confess forever and it becomes your destiny...
Karlat? He wanted death, he wanted everything. I stole it from him, of that I am sure. I stole death from all of us...
Yes! It is like a jewel in how it glistens, like a corpse in how it feels. I touched it, I stole it, I gave it away.
It is an abomination of the undead, a trap for the soul! I - I sought to destroy it but instead I destroyed us all...
Do what you will with me. I have my punishments planned from here unto eternity and plenty in between...
But destroy the phylactery! Destroy it, that is all I ask! Maybe then the souls of this place can know Lathander's peace once more.
Yes, and just enough answers!
Will the punishments of the Abyss be harsher than here in Limbo? Will I have a retinue of demons to lash me as I walk?
If so, I yearn for it... Take my written oath of every word I've uttered here. Present it to the Guardian and stand in Judgment.
Of course he does. He protects me and he longs for his phylactery... Half alive, half dead... All any of us want is the whole of something.
I have given you my story. Let him give you his. You are the Judge, not us.
My - my journal? I wasn't mad back then, it was before the crime. Everything was different, what bearing could it have? It says nothing!
I - I did... I read them stories and we would laugh and play... They loved coming here and now they're trapped here forever.
Yes, a glorious party! No blood, no undead brother, no phylactery, no corpses. I meant well... I didn't mean for this all to happen.
He consorted with demons. I knew that but... I wanted this to be a happy place... I shouldn't have brought children to a house of demons!
See? It is my fault, my crime! A crime of negligence, a crime of blindness, a crime of folly! I am guilty, a million times guilty.
No, nothing of use. It is all too late. Too early and too late for all the children. Take my oath, Judge, and grant me my punishment.
I read to the children and saw them die. But not Karlat, no. I stole his phylactery, I gave it to Lathander to destroy but all for naught.
We await your decision, Judge.
The candelabra's dim light does not make the bloodstained pages any more legible. Judging by the pictures and size of the font, it was a children's book...
I am not Karlat.
Me not Karlat.
What manner of demon are you?
What demon kind is you?
Foul beast! Belay your tempting tongue.
Foul thing! Me not listen to your words!
I tell you I am not Karlat!
But me not Karlat!
Divination?
Divi-whasis?
I will not speak, demon! I will destroy you!
Me say nothing, demon! Me destroy you!
Tell me of my past. What I did to get here.
Talk of past for me.
What could go wrong in my transformation?
What might go bad when me change?
What happens if I become a lich?
What happens if me become lich?
Goodbye.
What do you know of the Cult of the Old Ones?
What you know of Old One cult?
Goodbye.
I am here, Karlat. Speak to Gathoth. Do not keep me waiting.
What form do you take now, Karlat? You do not look at all like yourself, but then, you have not summoned me in quite some time.
Well, your intelligence has dropped considerably since we last spoke, especially if you think a masquerade will void our deal.
We've been through this before, Karlat. No masquerade will void our deal. You are Karlat, and I am here to serve, for now.
Will you waste further time, or are my divination powers to go unused this day? This summoning should have purpose.
Karlat, whatever form you may be in, I am still beyond the meager charms your fellow mortals might claim you have.
It would appear, Karlat, that this new form of yours is a bit too tight in the head. Your words puzzle me no end.
An impatient one. Please, Karlat, don't try to bypass our association with your disguises or feigned memory lapses. It doesn't suit you.
If that is your wish, you may be whomever you like. I take my leave, though I will still count this visit toward the debt I am owed.
Take care, Karlat. Even a lich has limits.
Really, Karlat, your memory does not serve you well. I divine information in exchange for certain services later. That is the deal.
And what would that serve? I am bound to this circle; an easy target. Perhaps you would come closer and give me a fighting chance?
The circle! The circle is broken! Free to rend these mortals! FREE!!!
Bah! Pose your questions for divination or dismiss me back to my home. Either way, stop wasting my time!
Really, Karlat, you should keep better records, though I suppose I cannot fault your mortal mind from failing after all these years.
Where to begin... a highwayman in Sembia... a petty lord in Cormyr, and a would-be lich with your personal stable of peasants here in Charwood.
Unremarkable, though the spells you have woven certainly produced some effects that are out of the ordinary.
You die, and are reborn as undead. At least, that is what would happen had this all gone as you originally planned.
Now, the spells that sustain this strange existence in Charwood would likely expire. What effect that might have... I don't know.
Such are the risks of the transformation you have chosen. Circumstances have made this situation... very unstable.
There are risks... Once your soul is contained within a phylactery, that vessel is your true body. Destroy it, and you cease to be.
You of course created a very strong one, but even that is not enough. It might be sanctified somehow, which would deal you grievous harm.
Really, Karlat, I'm not sure how much safety you expect in a procedure that *begins* with your death.
As you will, "Karlat." It has been interesting serving under you.
You have no cause to know that... unless... Very well, "Karlat," I will say what I know. They follow the oldest of creatures. The Creators.
Older than the memories of demons, and even some gods as well, they will come from the north to take back what time has stolen.
Fear them "Karlat." You will not have to search for them in the end. They will find you. With that, I leave you, false summoner.
Yes, goodbye "Karlat." If my words negatively affect your rise as a lich, you have may appologies. It is not my intention to betray.
Indeed, our deal specifically states that I am prevented from harming the man called Karlat in any *direct* fashion. Hmm... hehe... heh...
TO THE PITS!! TO THE PITS WITH THE DAMN SUMMONER KARLAT! SCREEEEEEEEE!!!!!
I WILL NOT SERVE, WHATEVER YOU LOOK LIKE, I WILL NOT SERVE!! YOU CAN'T JUST CALL ME HERE!!!
DEAL WAS DONE, DEAL WAS DONE! I WILL NOT SERVE!!!! SKREEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!
COME CLOSER AND DIE, DIE, DIE!!!!!!!!
REND YOU IN THE PITS, KARLAT! REND YOU IN THE PITS!!!!!
NO HOPE FOR YOU IF YOU GET CLOSE TO ME, KARLAT!!! RIP OUT YOUR SPINE!!!! SKREEEEEEEEEEE!!!!
CIRCLE BROKEN!! CIRCLE FOULED!! FREE TO REND YOUR SPINE!!!! SCKREEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!
I would never deal with a creature such as you!
Me not deal with your kind!
I'm listening.
Me listen.
Are you desperate? Do you fear me that much?
Maybe you desperate. Maybe you fear me.
And what would putting it on the altar do?
What putting it on altar thing do?
Are you trying to trick me?
You try to trick me?
I could just threaten you for those things now.
Maybe me just threaten you for them now.
I honestly agree, even though it is evil.
Me honestly agree, even if it's real evil.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> I agree to your terms.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Me agree to do this.
I have a bargain to make with whosoever holds my Phylactery. Speak to me, and let us make a deal.
Greetings. You will forgive me if I do not waste time on you. I will speak to the one that holds my phylactery, and no other.
I would suggest that you not get violent about it. I will simply reform, and we will have to go through all of this again. Pointless, really.
Ahh, there is my Phylactery. It does look comfortable, doesn't it? Well, perhaps not to you, but you have not been waiting uncountable years.
I will not waste words. You can do me a great service, and I will be generous in return. Do you wish to bargain?
Oh, you hurt me. You may do as you will, but I warn you, there will be a price. I have not been idle these long years.
My imprisonment will unleash the hells upon you. I will not go quietly. I think it best if you simply walk away.
Hardly. While I lack the power and mobility of a fully formed lich, I have gained the patience of the undead.
There will be others. You were not the first. In fact... perhaps those others would be of interest to you. I know a few things.
There's a good <boy/girl>. No harm in talk, is there? No. Listen to me, and understand my situation.
You possess the vessel that is to hold my soul. My son Quint ruined my transformation to lich and damned us all, but there is a way out.
If you agree, I will enter that container voluntarily, on the condition that you not sanctify it. Instead, you will place it on the altar in my summoning circle.
Heavens, no. I am quite serious. Agree to place my phylactery on that altar and I will reward you handsomely. I have much more than gold...
Oh, nothing much. You need only concern yourself with doing it. I woud be most generous afterward. I have things in the ether, trapped with me.
I also have information. You seek a group... I know things. Tell me if you agree. Do not lie. I can tell if you lie.
Fool! You could attack me, but like everyone else trapped here, I would simply reform if defeated. What threat is there in that?
You would just use up your resources in a pointless battle. There are far easier ways for us to reach an agreement.
Do not break our bargain. If I sense you removing the phylactery from this level, I will unleash a great violence. I promise it.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Yes... yes I believe you. The living are so easy to read. I would have heard the slightest hesitation in your voice.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> That was foolish. You cannot lie to me. The living are an open book, and I have opened many.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You truly are stupid to think I wouldn't see through your pathetic ruse. The living are an open book, and I've opened many.
The face or name is unimportant. All I know is that you hold my Phylactery, and I will extend my offer to you just as I did before.
Agree to place my vessel on the altar in the summoning circle and I will enter it willingly. Do not lie. I can tell if you are lying.
I choose an "Item."
Me choose "Item."
I choose an "Item."
Me choose "Item."
I choose an "Item."
Me choose "Item."
I was wrong to bargain! I'll kill you!
Me wrong to make bargain! Me kill you!
I have a reward for you. Speak with me, and we shall settle my debt.
Listen well to me, and do not walk away. If you refuse to speak with me, I will consider my debt paid and leave.
You have freed me, completed the spell I began so many years ago, and secured the doom of Charwood at long last. I am in your debt.
I will reward you with the item of your choice, be it *ITEM*, *ITEM*, or *ITEM*. You will also have information.
No, no I think you won't. You are no longer worth my time. If you wish to forfeit your reward, so be it. I take my leave.
Our deal is fulfilled, save one matter. You came this way seeking something... a cult... I know of them. You likely saw one driven mad in Charwood.
A few of them came here. I don't know why, but I know where they came from. Luskan. Look to Luskan... but...
Before I was imprisoned, I knew that there are things even I should leave alone. Others have not been as wise. Be wary.
I will not risk my new form on you! Test my pets, but I will have none of this!
Road to Charwood.
Make me more powerful by your magic!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I require the assistance of a magic item!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I command you to give me an item of the greatest power!
I come as the Judge and demand only answers.
Uh, you make me big and tuff!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Uh, me need a... a magic thingy!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me need a magic thingy. Somethin' of great power!
Me be da Judge-guy. Me only want answers.
Then tell me the tale of the brothers Jhareg...
What charade do you speak of?
Were you a witness or a participant in this crime?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You're trapped here too, aren't you...
You tell me 'bout da Jharegs...
"Charade?" What this you speak of?
Did you do this crime or only watch?
Argue your guilt or innocence while you still can...
You be guilty of da crime here? Yes or no?
Tell me more...
Get to the point.
Ooh, you talk more...
You got point? Get to it.
Then it was you behind the slaughter!?
But why did you do this?
Why are you telling me this so openly?
Will you give this as your written oath?
Huh? You was behind da slaughter!?
How come you do all this?
Why you be so honest, all of sudden?
You gives this as written oath, yuh?
Foolish mortal, you have forgotten to cast your protection charm! Belial shall rule!
Speak quickly <race> fool. Your magic protections will not last long in this place. What do you require of the Fire Lord?
Karlat, is that you?... Wait! What do you want of Belial, mortal?
The bargain has been fulfilled. Perhaps next time, I'll summon you...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Your will commands me... Take it and be done with me.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> To you I shall give a gift of an entirely different sort...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I had my reasons for giving it to him then. For you, I see no such advantage. Choose again, and more wisely.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Your heart is not strong enough to command me so. Ask something else, for that you shall not receive.
I was commanded so once before, by the mortal Karlat Jhareg... To him I gave a phylactery where his soul could rest, safe from mortal threat.
You, fleshling? You are the Judge? Then my charade is over for you command me as none other has before...
Yes, my Judge. I had not bargained on Lathander's intervention in my dealings with the wizard. Like the ghosts and mortals, I am bound unto this place...
All of us are guilty, my Judge, and all are innocent save one... That one is I.
I am Belial, prince of demons! Did you believe that such a simple spell would summon me? No, I answered Karlat Jhareg's call for my own reasons, Judge...
Where does the crime begin? Where does it end? A crime is not an event! It is a thread that must be followed through the weave...
Let the brothers tell their own tales, Judge. I am here to tell my own...
You see, it was I who first planted the seed of slaughter in Karlat's mind. He was but a weapon and it was my hand that controlled him.
Quint was a weapon of a weapon, a servant's slave. It was he who brought the children in and Karlat who cast the spell that killed them...
It was I, alone, who stayed silent in the knowledge that the slaughter held no meaning. Karlat's ritual did not require it... but I chose to tell him otherwise...
I am Belial, Prince of Demons, Lord of Fire, Scourge of the Abyssal Depths... Were you ever fool enough to expect another?
Thus is the nature of demons, Judge. Why is there needless suffering in the world? Why is there injustice and strife and tyranny? It is because of us...
For one, Lathander has bound all within this castle to heed the Judge's will.
For another, how do you intend to punish a demon? The Abyss is home to me and I long to walk once more upon its sea of flames.
If it means an end to my accursed bondage in this place, then I will gladly give it... There, take it and make of it what you will.
Very well. Quint gathered the children and Karlat killed them... But it was I who told Karlat the deed was required, though I knew it was not.
<StartAction>Read the book... </Start>
<StartAction>Leave... </Start>
<StartAction>Continue reading... </Start>
<StartAction>Continue reading... </Start>
<StartAction>Continue reading... </Start>
<StartAction>Continue reading... </Start>
By the dim light of the candelabra, you can decipher the book's ragged text...
"My research into the summoning of the demon Belial, Lord of Fire, continues. It is rugged work and my robes are little more than ashen rags as a result..."
"I must persevere, however, for only Belial knows of the phylactery I seek, a vessel that only the gods have power to destroy..."

"Yes, Belial is the Lord of Fire so, aside from the customary casting of Protection from Evil, it shall also take fire to summon him. I am sure that the belly of the fire beetle is the proper reagent, but what spell?"
"I have cast every high-level fire spell there is upon that brazier, to no effect! I have tried even those of mid-level, and there is nothing!"
"There is but one fire spell left of all those known but that can't be it! I haven't cast since I was a mischievous child! Still, I must try... "
And what if I do?
What's it to you?
I take offense to that.
What if me do?
What you care?
Me not like what you say!
I would like to see what you have to offer.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Me want see your stuff.
Me want ask you questions.
No thanks.
What's going on around here?
I need some directions.
What be goin' on 'round here?
Me need you tell me where stuff be.
Nevermind.
What do you mean?
What you mean?
I just wanted to make you say it.
Me just want make you say it. Heh, heh.
Goodbye.
Watch yer back 'round here <lad/lass>. There's lots o' folks liable to stick a knife in it.
You look like the kind o' person who knows how to live in the shadows.
In that case, I'm yer go-to guy! I've got the goods to make yer life easier.
It's just my business to notice these sorts of things. Ya might be in need of some helpful items.
Sorry <mister/missus>. My mistake. Won't bother ya no more then.
Just step o'er here into the shadows and I'll show ya.
Well, I'll tell ya what I can.
If ya need something, come to me, ya hear?
Not much. The ships come in. I have certain arrangements to procure certain types of goods. Very good stuff if ya know what I mean.
Do I have to spell it out? I'm a smuggler. I bring in stolen property and sell it here in town. I mean look at my clothes! Obviously a smuggler! Cripes, but you're dense.
Yeah, thanks. Everyone's a jester.
But look, I have other customers, so are ya plannin' to buy or not?
What do I look like, a bleedin' map or somethin'? I've got customers waitin' on some special goods, so are ya gonna place an order or not?
What's so dangerous about this area?
Where's the nearest inn?
Can you tell me the way to Luskan?
I'll be on my way.
Why this area is dangerous, huh?
Me just wants find inn.
Me looks for Luskan. Is this way?
Me go now.
The monster's leader, Dergiab, is dead. I have his head.
Me killed monster leader, Dergiab. Me got it head.
I have Leah's ring right here. She's dead.
Me gots Leah ring. She be dead.
The monster's leader is dead. I have his head.
Me killed monster leader. Me got head.
I'll be on my way.
Me go now. Bye.
It will do.
It do fine.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I think killing Dergiab is worth a bit larger reward, no?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Dergiab not easy kill. Me earns more, no?
I might have to rough you up and see what else you got in there.
Me thinking you gots more gold... Maybe me shake you up and looks.
No gold is necessary. I just wanted to let you know the deed was done.
Me no needs gold. Me just want to tell you Dergiab dead.
I see Leah made it back safely.
Me sees wife makes it back okay.
Nothing yet.
Me has no news yet.
I have some questions.
Me have questions.
Could you give me some directions?
Me want directions, please.
Hello, <lad/lass>. You best be careful treadin' the road 'round these parts. A dangerous place, these days. Listen to old Gerrol.

The hills in this area are home to creatures of all sorts... bugbears, goblins and the like. Normally they don't trouble us much. Since Luskan stopped patrolling the area, mind you, they've become plenty brave.
A pleasure meeting you. Good luck in your travels.
It's not much farther to the north, <lad/lass>. Just keep on the road an' you'll find it, sure enough.
Well, the closest inn would the Alliance Arms Inn in Port Llast. That shouldn't take you too much time to get to.
Most pleased to see you again, friend. Things are just about to right with Leah's return to the farm. To think, I thought her dead for sure.
I'll be forever grateful for what you've done for the area, too. It's safe once more. You and yours are always welcome at our humble farm.
Well, hello to you. Were you the one I told about them monsters bothering us around here - the ones who took my wife, Leah? Do you bring word?
Hello, <lad/lass>. I'd warn you to be careful of danger near these roads. You look like you can handle yourself but better safe than sorry. Listen to old Gerrol, then and watch out.
Other than that, the only inn I can think of would be the Green Griffon Inn outside of Luskan, to the north past the hills.
That is a relief, then, to be sure. We'll have none of his terrorizing anyone else in these parts. Thank you, <lad/lass>... I hope this bit of gold will do as a reward.
That she did. She has returned safe and sound, which is more than I even thought possible. Thank you, <lad/lass>... I shall be forever grateful. I hope this bit of gold will do as a reward?
Most pleased to see you again, friend. Things are just about to right with Leah's return to the farm. To think, I thought her dead for sure.
Things are just about right... but not quite. The area is still unsafe so long as Dergiab is still about.
May the gods bless you and look after you then, <lad/lass>.
And here I thought things would be safer with the monsters gone. Sigh... fair enough. It may be a bit greedy of you, but it's not like you didn't earn it.
It is the least I could do.
Most pleased to see you again, friend. Things seem a lot safer around here, but I do miss Leah dearly.
That is very kind of you, <lad/lass>. It is good to know that adventurers like you still exist.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well... while I doubt any gold I might have would compare with what the ogre mage, himself, had, I did send you that way. This is all the extra I can spare.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I imagine you got plenty from Dergiab, himself, no? I would love to give you more... I just can't spare it.
Ah. I... I had thought as much. I suppose it is good to know, at least, though it will be difficult to tell the boy.
Well, come and see me when you have something to tell me. Be careful! This area is dangerous.
Hello. It's been mighty sad around here since you've confirmed the worst. My wife is dead. How go things with the monsters that killed her?
I suppose so. What are you looking for?
I spoke with your husband, Leah. He thinks that you're dead.
All right. It should be safe for you to get out of here, Leah.
I didn't expect to find any prisoners. Can you get out on your own?
I'll go make sure it's safe. Can you wait here? I'll come back.
Me knows you husband. He think you Leah is dead.
Me killed lots of things, so be safe for you to go. Yuh, Leah?
Me not realize you is here. You make own way out?
Um... me go kill stuff, then come back. You go later, yuh?
Of course. I'll lead you to the exit. It'll be safe from there.
Yes. Just follow the trail of carnage and you'll be fine.
You be safe, if you be fast and quiet.
Who are you?
Who you is? Huh?
Goodbye.
Me can help you. Take to exit, yuh? Away from monsters?
Leah! I need to ask you some questions.
You is Leah? Me got question for you.
What can you tell me of these caves?
What me can gets told of caves?
Why did the monsters kidnap you?
Why monsters take you, not kill you instead?
You should get out of here now.
Me thinks you should get out now, yuh?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I hate to keep asking questions, but did they mention anything?
Oh? Over here! Oh, thank the - I thought I was going to die. Everytime they came close to me, their foul smells - I was so scared.
You're not one of the monsters, are you? Oh, when will this all end? I just want to be free of here.
Please, stay back. I haven't done a thing. I've been too scared to even breathe! Don't hurt me! I...
He does? He - oh... this has been so horrible. I just want to go home. Will you help me escape?
I... I suppose I could, yes. You did kill the monsters that were guarding me, right?
You want me to... wait here? In this place? I guess I have no choice in the matter, but please hurry back! Please...
Thank you so much, kind <sir/madam>. I wish I could show you my appreciation. Please come and visit me and my husband when you are done here.
I know we'll make it out of here. Thank you for bringing hope to me.
Thank you so much for all you have done!
Leah. My name is Leah. I was working on the farm when I was attacked by those beasts. They kidnapped me, and - oh...
Please, don't go! I don't want to be left in here, not alone... I'm so scared. It's so dark...
Oh? What kind of questions? What did you want to ask?
They just wanted to use me for some menial labor, it would seem. Nothing too heavy or exhausting, really. Though it didn't make this any easier on me...
Just to do some menial labor, it would seem. Nothing too heavy or exhausting, really. Though it didn't make this any easier on me...
I don't really know... it's pretty dark in here and I haven't been able to see too much. They generally just screamed at me and kept me in here.
Every once in a while, they would drag me out and force me to do something for them: menial labor, for the most part.
When I finished the cooking, stitching, what have you, they'd throw me back in here.
I've been sick, exhausted, hungry... I can't sleep anywhere, and I just want to get back to my husband.
Um... come to think of it... they mentioned something about their "master." It was more like a threat to them, though, to keep them in line.
It was as if the truly heroic monsters would be rewarded by this monster some how. Well, that's the impression that I got from it.
(sob) I miss my family!
Please! Don't leave me here again, I beg of you. My name is Leah. My husband must be so worried!
To the Port Llast Mines.
The Port Llast Mine has been closed for many years, its vein of ore long since extinguished.
East: Neverwinter Wood. South: Port Llast. North: Green Griffon Inn and Luskan.
We kills you good for the Master!!
Let me ask you some questions first.
Me can ask question first?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I accept your surrender, if the other goblins stop fighting me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me says surrender okay, if no goblins is fighting me.
I can't accept your surrender unless I get something out of it.
Me listen to offer. Me gets something, yuh?
Actually, I enjoy killing goblins. No deal.
Me likes goblin-killing too much. No deals!
Then I guess I'll have to kill you.
Me can kill you then. No problems.
Bye.
Tell me about these caves.
Me wants knowing what goes on in cave.
Where is your chieftain?
Where you chieftain is?
Master? Who's your master? Your chieftain?
You chieftain is master, yuh?
I need more than that if I'm not to kill you.
Me needs more or me kills you.
That's fine. I accept.
Me can accept that offer. Me okay.
We surrender! No hurt. We not want getting killed so much!
We is told we not fighting with you. So me not talk, neither. You talk to chieftain.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You wants us making all goblins be peaceful to you? Okays, we can do that. Yes, we talks, spreads word. You lets us go, yeah?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You wants us making all goblins be peaceful to you? We not think we can do that, no. We not sure, is we.
What's you means? You wants treasure maybe? Me gots gold. Me gives you gold if you stops with fighting us?
Aaarrrggghhh! We still is fighting with <race> kind. Kill!
What you asks us goblins, huh? We not knows so very much like you <race> kind think you knows. Er... what is question, huh?
Okay, okay! Me just kidding. Haha! Get joke? <Race> friend likes joke, yeah? We makes no goblin fights with <race> friend. Me go now?
We is left to living! We can breathe still! We runs away now! And we tells other goblins not is fighting with you, no! We is good. You see!
We is left to living! We can breathe still! We runs away now!
You wants talking with us chieftain, yeah? Okay, me tells you where find. He behind this door.
We is at wars with orcs and bugbears. One days we live here alone, now we gots others living with us, all because of master.
No, not goblin chieftain... Master is bigger, stronger, not goblin. He steals away our best fighter for his own use. Not know why, though.
Me makes other goblins not fights you, too! If me gets life saved, me can gets it done, yeah? Me do, me do!
Then me can lives? Me tells you what. Me makes sure no one other goblins fights you either. You did fair with us, so we do good to you, too. We leaves now, yes?
You not hurt chiefy!
We give up! No kill!
Defilers! Defilers of the temple! Attack! Attack!!
Do not defile temple, <race> one! Out! out!!!
What could you possibly have to talk about?
Never! Evil creatures like yourself must die!
Why? I love killing goblins!
Is there anything more about the master that you know?

No, I'd rather kill you.
Sounds like you have yourself a deal, goblin.
What about the army you mentioned?
But what *is* this Dergiab?
I have the head of the bugbear chieftain.
I have the head of the orc chieftain.
Time for you to die, goblin!
Nothing. I'll be on my way.
Well, now it's time to kill you, I'm afraid!
I'll leave you to your joy, then.
Talk? Hah! You not know how talk gooder.
Me think all evil creatures same: dead!
But me loves killing goblins. Lots of good fun!
What you tells me more of master?
Me think other chieftains pay for your head!
No. Me likes killing you instead.
Me accepts deal. Me do this.
Me gots bugbear chieftain head!
Me wents and chopped orc chieftain's head!
Me kills goblin now!
Me not want nothing. Me leave.
What you tells me more of army.
Is Dergiab monster? What it be?
Me kill all else. Now me kill you, too.
Okay. Stay happy. Bye.
I have a question.
Me can ask you question, yes?
What can you tell me about the master?
What you tells me of master?
What about the army you mentioned?
What you tells me more of army.
We hears you is wise for <race> kind, so accept offers of surrender from goblin, yes? You comes to talk with us, works out deal, maybe?
Kill the <race> intruders!!
One times, we lives in cave alone. The master, Dergiab, comes and takes cave and give to orc and bugbear, too.
We asks you for killing orc and bugbear chieftain, help us end stupid war. We then tell master go away, make other fight. We give gold for heads, too. You like?
Is good! Goblins eagerly wait for heads of other chieftains! Place on poles and dance around in glee, we will! Ha! Then we forgets whole Dergiab stuff.
Ahhh! Is double-cross! Kill it! Kill all!!
The master is great and powerful. Great magics, has he. Strong and powerful is he. Too tough for us, is he.
Me saying we is not knowing, already. We wants caves back, live without fighting all of time. We just wants left alone, okay?
Great, giant ogre with powerful magic. Would defeat even you, though you very powerful.
But you say you kill chieftains! Goblins want heads. Ha! You go gets now, yes?
But master no matter! You bring heads of chieftains or no?
Goblins wish the <race> friend goodness and stuff!
Chief of goblin sees you, <race> friend. What you want now? You gots news for us?
We waits eagerly for heads! You tough <race> friend, they stand no chance!
Bugbears dead? Is very good! Here is reward!!
Aha! Orcs are dead! This pleases the goblins. Here is reward!
Now goblins have the only chieftain! Goblins are supreme! Is very good, we dance tonight!
Now you bring us one more head and we happy goblins!
Most pleased to see you, <race> friend. You make goblin king of caves, you have! We not fights no more with bugbears and orcs!
We do know how talk gooder like you. Why you think we hear each other now? But we got offer to offer, if you listen.
He make us fight each other, take best warrior to use for own personal army. We not even know what army fights for, and we not want fighting.
What you is wanting knowing? You ask me, and maybe me knows answer.
The master is great and powerful. Great magics, has he. Strong and powerful is he. (sigh) Too tough for us, is he.
Me saying we is not knowing, already. We wants caves back, live without fighting all of time. We just wants left alone, okay?
Great, giant ogre with powerful magic. Would defeat even you, <race> friend, though you very powerful.
Not wants fighting against orcs and bugbears so much, not wanting master takes our best warrior.
Infidels! They must not reach temple!! I go and release the guardians!!
Me no kills you now, <race> friend. Talk to chief.
Who said I saved you? I'm not letting you live, beast!
Yeah, well... move along and leave this area for good.
Why were you being tortured?
You belong to me, now. You'll do as I say.
What do you know about this 'master?'
Why did you speak against the master?
I can't let you live, beast. Time for you to die.
Where is this master? Do you know?
Me save you so me kill you myself!
Go bye-bye now. You leave here.
Me not knowing why you is tortured?
Me gots you as slave now! Haha!
Me want know stuff you know 'bout master?
Why you speaks against master?
Sorry, but me must kills you now.
Master, where is? Me not know.
Save me please! I help you!!
Most thankful I am. You have saved poor I from torture...
No, no! You will kill I, I knows! Runs, must I!!
Chieftain of bugbears has imprisoned I. At order of the master, it was. I speaks against the master.
The master is large creature, giant maybe. Comes to the tribes in caves, takes strongest of us away. Me not knows why!
Be following this tunnel out of cell to north. It go a little east, then back south to tunnel down and temple. Master live down there. Never go there, I... not know more.
Master weakens tribes of caves. Takes strongest to own caves. No one knows why.
I speaks against master. Master pushes bugbears around. I say bugbears fight master. But master hears all... tells chieftain to send I to prison.
No, no! <Race> no kill I! Runs, must I!!
Yes, I goes... I leave this hills far, far behind. Most kind is you...
No! No! AAAAAGHH!!!
Who are you?
Is this an ambush? I'll not trust you.
Relax! I work for no one. Just tell me who you are.
Who you is, eh?
Me not likes trick. You move slow!
Me says stop yammering! Me wanting know name.

You tell me some stuff, and maybe I'll let you go.

How me know you not trying trick me?
Me gots questions. You answer, maybe me let go?

I don't buy that. I'm killing you.
Me not born yesterday. Me born long before! And you die now.
Fine. Tell me something.
You're worthless. Go away.
Me gets stuff told to? Okay. Is good.
Me says go away. Me not wants you here. Go!
Why are you a prisoner here? What's this war about?
Can you tell me anything about these caves?
What can you tell me of the orcs and goblins?

You tells stuff about prison? To me?
What you tells of orcs and goblins?
Me not got more questions. Me got message for you leaving. Go bye!

<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Who's the master?
Do they have leaders to their tribes?
What means you making strength? You get big, strong group?
Orcs and goblins got leaders in caves?
Army? What do you mean?
Army? What means you army?
I'll kill you now, monster!
Me kill you!
Help! Me is prisoner here. You release me, yuh? Or is you working with orc and goblin? Me just want leaving. Not like prisons! Help me! Please, help!
Me is prisoner of bugbears in this cave! Prisoner from war with orcs and goblins. Me wanting leave, but me is stuck. You help, yeah?
Me gots no weapons. Me gots no others bugbears. No one is here. You see? Me just wants not being prisoner. Gets back to war with orcs and goblins.
We not is meaning to make such fool of self, but we is desperate. Long time for we is tortured! Long time we not be in war against orcs and goblins.
Ah, okay. Me not knows much but prison bars, but we tries answer all questions. We wants out of prison, yeah!
Me gots no weapons. Me gots no others bugbears. No one is here. You see? Me just wants not being prisoner. Gets back to war with orcs and goblins.
Me prisoner is. Me gots nothing to give. But me knows stuff. Maybe you wants asking me questions? Me try answer?
We is fighting with orcs and goblins. Gets beat and taken prisoner. Everyone wants pleasing master, so needs beating other forces to make strength.
Me can tells you that caves is home to orcs, goblins, and us bugbears. We fights so much. Not safe in caves for you outsider.
Orcs and goblins is everywhere. We bugbears strong, we fights tough. But we never makes advance for long. Too many foes for us.
If we bugbear is beating orc and goblin, then master is happy with us. Take us for his army. And we be most powerful.
Dergiab is master. He big ogre, but cast magics, too! He very strong warrior, and kills many who try and take his ruling away.

Orc chieftain and goblin chieftain in caves. If killed is they, tribes would falls apart. We not know what doing without chieftain. We bugbears got chieftain, too. But we prisoner so long, not knows where.
Me not lying when me say me not know... proud warriors get taken by master, but we not know where they is go, or why.
Me in prison. You come in, me kill you, then goes back! Come, frees me so me can kill, please master!
No hurt me! Please!
Me run! Me run!
Intruders! Me release the beasties!
Die, fools!
Who's this Dergiab you mention?

I could kill you, you know.

Then leave for the surface, and quickly.
I'll not give you the chance to backstab me!
Answer my questions, and I'll consider your fate.
So you're some kind of prisoner, then?
I don't need your help. Go on.
You had your chance! Prepare to die!
If you can help me, then do so before I kill you.
Why would I want to fight him?
Dergiab was your partner?
Tell me more about this cult he fell in with.
I don't need to hear any more. You're free to go.
That's enough. Time to die!

Tell me more about this cultist.
Do you know what purpose the cult wanted the army for?
You is prisoner? Ha!
What is Dergiab? Person?
What? Me here to rescue you!
Me can kills you too easy! If me wants!
Goodbye.
Bye-bye.
Why me wants fighting Dergiab?
Me not stopping you. Go. Leave.
If you answers questions, me let you live. Maybe.

Me not like prisoner. Me kill prisoner!
Me not needs you help. You go.
If you gots stuff to say, saying it now!
That it! You say it! Me kill you!
Me not hear more. You go free.
Dergiab? Is you partner, yes?
Tells me on cult Dergiab in.
What you need army for and how big it is?
Me want know more of cultist.
What cult want army for? You know?
I don't recognize you. Have you come to finish what Dergiab started? No... you look more like intruders to me.
Ha! Are you thinking that I'll believe you actually came here to rescue me instead of simply stumbling across this cell?
Forgive me if I'm skeptical, but I'll believe I'm rescued when I taste the fresh air of the surface, not before then.
No need to make threats. If you have questions, I'll be more than happy to answer them... I assume you're here to fight Dergiab, no?
Well, yes. That's true. I am a prisoner. Dergiab betrayed me, and threw me in here when I was no longer of use to him.
I would have assumed the other denizens of these caves would have filled you in on this by now. The 'master' is all they can babble about.
Dergiab - or 'the master', if you prefer - is an ogre mage of some power... He was also my former partner until he fell in with that cult and betrayed me.
You'll let me go just like that? I must warn you, Dergiab is not to be trifled with. I could tell you much that would aid you.
As I thought! Come at me, then, <race> fool... Let me die fighting!!
I'll be glad to leave all this far, far behind. I thank you for releasing me, my <race> friend. We won't meet again.
Is there any other reason for you to be down here? Dergiab still has our small army, after all, and likely lots of treasure.
He was. At least he was until he went away and came back with that cultist. Before that, we recruited our army together.
Hmph? For what else? To gain power. We wanted to do the same as Sythsillis down in Amn! Maybe even raid Luskan...
There aren't many soldiers, yet. I was insistent on picking only the best of the bugbears, orcs and goblins in these caves... and that's slim pickings.
I don't know much about it. Dergiab came back from one of his outings with a cultist beside him. He claimed there had been a change of plans.
Dergiab only listened to the cultist after that. Said he was preparing the army for some different purpose, something greater.
I objected, naturally. Foolishly, as it turns out, seeing as where it got me.
His name's Ganon. He's an assassin or rogue or somesuch thing. I never spoke to him much, so I couldn't tell you more.
No. Dergiab would only say that they needed the forces for the "Return," whatever that means. The cultist wouldn't elaborate, at least, not to me.
I'll be here. Heck, I couldn't go anywhere if I wanted to...
Back again? Have you decided to finish off what Dergiab has started, after all?
Why are the gates closed?
Let me through the gates... now.
All right, I'll be going.
