I'm sure there's some way to get inside the city.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Perhaps I can help the city.
How about an offer, for the "city," of 100 gold?
Why is closed? Me no come in?
You lets me through gate now!
Oh. Okay. Bye.
Is no more plague in Neverwinter.
Me figures out other way into city.
What sorts of "internal problems?"
Whats mean "internal problems?"
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Let me in, maybe me helps somehow?
Me gots 100 gold to help "city" out, yuh?
Best be turning back, traveler. Luskan's gates are closed.
The Green Griffon is a good place to wait out the situation. Good day, <sir/madam>.
Is that supposed to be some kind of threat? Even if you cut us down, they still won't open the gates for you, fool.
The gates are closed to make certain that the plague in Neverwinter doesn't spread to Luskan, <sir/madam>. Can't be too careful.
Ha! Whether you speak the truth or not, we would not so easily open up our doors. We are many things but gullible isn't one of them.
Listen, why are you continuing down this line of questioning? Luskan isn't a safe city, there's plague looming all around us. Need you more information than that?
But rest assured, things will return to normal sooner or later. The gates will be open, and you may enter into Luskan then.
You're welcome to look, though I'm sure you'll find our city to be quite heavily fortified. I doubt a rat could get through this quarantine.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I doubt that, <sir/madam>. Come back later when the problem has cleared.
I don't know how you convinced the sergeant, but if he says it's okay, go on through. Luskan's a dangerous place right now, but it's your neck to risk.
And get into all sorts of trouble with the sergeant? No thanks, <sir/madam>... the gate's being too closely watched. Best you just come back when this is all sorted out.
Listen. You look like a friendly enough <lad/lass>. If you're stuck for a place to stay, you might want to try the Green Griffon. Farewell.
You seem a little dirty... Perhaps a stay at the Green Griffon would liven your spirit. At the worst, you'd have a place to stay for now. Farewell.
Aside from that, there are simply too many internal problems facing Luskan at the moment. You would be better off turning around and going back whence you came.
*Your* graveyard?
Who are you?
I'll be going.
Are there many visitors, then?
It's a rather small graveyard, isn't it?
Er... you're a loon, you know that?
And just what sorts or secrets are you talking about?
What's the Arcane Brotherhood?
Oh? And what's interesting about that?
Where did they bury him?
So what's so interesting about one of them being buried here?
So where did they bury this wizard?
You haven't gone down there?
How about you give me that key and I'll go down there?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'll give 100 gold, though I'm sure this is a scam.
All right, then, 200 gold it is.
How about I take it off your dead body, gnome?
*Your* graveyard? Me not sees you name on it.
What you do here?
Me will go now.
Why this place so small?
Oh? You gets visitors?
Me say you make no sense!
Mmm... secrets... what kind secret?
Me not know what is. Arcane Brotherhood?
Why that good secret?
Where he buried?
Why big deal one buried in cemetary?
Wizard buried where?
You not find out yourself?
Me will takes key and gets stuff.
Me gots 200 gold! You take?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me give 50 gold, and you be happy!
Me killer! Me *take* key from you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> 50 gold, and you can thank me for that.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me give 100 gold. Me not trust you more.
Eh? What's this? Someone come to disturb my graveyard?
Yes, *my* graveyard, damn it. You think these old headstones just clean themselves, do you? Ha!
I take care of all these old stones, dear <man/woman>. Keep them nice and shiny for the visitors, oh yes. 'Tis my job, you see.
Yes, well... be careful where you walk around here. Hmph.
Well... no, not really. Not since they moved the graveyard inside the city walls. As if *anyone* would want to be buried out here where the graverobbers could strip you of your last possessions.
Well, they moved the graveyard inside the city walls, smarty-pants. Nobody comes out here anymore, not that I mind.
Oh! But if only they knew! Hee hee! My little graveyard has its secrets, oh yes it does!
You think so, do you? It so happens that they buried one of the oldest members of the Arcane Brotherhood right here, they did.
Well... all right, then, listen close. They buried one of the oldest members of the Arcane Brotherhood here. Right here, oh yes.
What?! You don't know?! By Garl Glittergold's shiny arse, what kind of adventurer are you?
The Arcane Brotherhood is Luskan's great order of wizards, holed up in the tallest tower in the city! They control Luskan... but that's a secret, so shush.
This is very interesting because they carved out a whole tomb underneath the mausoleum! Full of magics and everything... or so I'm told.
Beneath the mausoleum, of course. My pappy told me the Brotherhood was very specific about the construction and what went in it.
I'm surprised they've forgotten about it. None of them wizards ever visits. I've always wondered what goes on down there, myself.
Oh, no no no! I have the key, of course. There's just, well, zombies down there and such. They come up from time to time... that's why I keep the mausoleum under lock and key.
Let you plunder the tomb? Never! Err... not for less than 200 gold pieces, anyway.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmph. Stealing from a little old gnome, eh? Ahhhh, fine, fine. Go ahead and take it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Not on your life! The wizards entrusted me with, uh, the care of their friend. 200 gold pieces or you go about your business.
Fair enough. Now git and satisfy your curiosity, damn it. I have work to do.
What?! A graverobber?! Well, you won't get the best of me, you whipper-snapper!!
I've got work to do, especially with you messin' up my grounds. Leave me be, damn it.
Eh? What's this? Are you one of my dead come back to haunt me in my graveyard?
Eh? What's this? Looking so clean as you, I'm left to wonder what you're doing in my graveyard.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmph. Are you that poor that you can't afford the... bah. Fine, fine. Go ahead and take it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Not on your life, <race> scum! The wizards entrusted me with, uh, the care of their friend. 200 gold or you go about your business.
I am not content with your defeat. It is your life that I want!
I have come for the magic gem that you hold.
No defeat for you. Death for you!
Me want you magic gem.
You are free to go. I'll find what I'm looking for in your room.
Me in room now and find gem on own. You go now.
Enough of this! Die!
No more. You die!
Enough lies. Just tell me where the gem is.
No lie no more. Me just want gem.
Without the gem, you are useless. I'll have to kill you now!
No gem, no live!
I know that you have the gem. The source was very sure.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Then why are you so carefully guarded and what is in that iron-bound chest?
Me know you have gem. Guy told me.
I think not. I have come to take the magic gem that I have been told you carry. Hand it over.
Nuh uh. Me want magic gem, not bossy lady! Give gem!
Thief! How dare you!
Though it shames me to admit it, I am defeated.
I die with a blade in my hand!
Gem? I don't have any gems! What are you talking about?
Enough! I give up!
You're taking the gem!? The shame! I have been outwitted and defeated by some petty adventurer! How can I face my women, now? The shame is too much!
Your source was lying! I am just a simple woman and have no wealth, let alone magic gems.
Fine! Take the gem! It is in this chest!
Please, just let me go now! The shame of defeat will ruin me in the eyes of my women, regardless! I am finished!
Don't kill me!! Just take the gem! It is in this chest!
So, now that my annoying guards are out of earshot, why don't you come and talk to me, honey?
Halt! You have but a moment to leave my room before I attack you!
Now that we're alone, don't be shy. Just follow my orders and I'm sure you'll be a happy man in the morning!
What! This was just a trick to separate me from my guards! I can't believe that I am at the mercy of a man!
I'm not in the mood for talk right now. Perhaps later.
Well now you have what you came for, let me go.
Destroy the troublemakers! The Return cannot be stopped!
Grrr! Aarg!!
I haven't seen you in the Green Griffon before. Are you here to see Mutamin?
I'm just here until the gates to Luskan open up. Then I'm gone.
You strike me as one of those bandits you find on the road everywhere, now that the Luskans aren't patrolling.
Had a bit too much to drink, I see, <lad/lass>. You always run around taverns without your clothes on?
Hah! Lost your clothes in a gambling bet, eh?
Are you mad, running around half-naked? Do you have a brain fever?
Those wounds of yours don't look good. Shouldn't you get them treated?
That's quite the lot of cuts you've got there. Must have been some fight.
Where did you get all those wounds?
Dim-witted folk like yourself better watch you don't get fast-talked 'round here.
I had a cousin who was like you. A simple fellow but likeable enough.
I would chat, but I'd probably talk too fast for you.
Must you brandish that about in here?
Haven't you got anything better to do rather than wave that about?
You know, you should really leave your weapons at the door. Or put them away.
We don't get many of you holy folk traveling through these parts.
Kind of odd to see a holy <man/woman> like yourself in a tavern like this...
You aren't heading to Luskan, are you? I was told they shut down all the churches there.
You know, wizardly folk aren't generally looked upon with kindness in these parts.
A magic-user on the road? Are you some kind of adventurer?
I've seen a number of magical folk like you come for the con... uh, that is, nevermind.
It's not often I encounter another <race> face in these parts. How do you do?
It's always a delight to see another <race> face around here.
I wouldn't go into Luskan, if I were you. I hear they're rounding up everyone of <race> blood and putting them in prison.
Greetings, lass. You're a fine-lookin' woman to be in the Green Griffon.
How about you and I find a private room upstairs, aye?
If I knew this tavern had women like you about, I'd travel this way more often.
My, my. Hello there, handsome.
(sigh) I knew there had to be big, strong men like you somewhere.
I don't suppose there's a chance you'd buy me a drink, handsome?
I wish I could get into the city. It's been pleasant enough waiting here, I suppose.
How do you do, my <lord/lady>? Are you waiting for the Luskan gates to open, as well?
Something you need, <sir/madam>? I'd just as soon be gone once the gates are open.
Can't be too careful out on the road. The Luskan guards aren't patrolling right now... there's beasts everywhere.
I don't have time to talk to the likes of you. I'm just waiting for the city to open back up.
Get away, you. You could have that plague I've heard so much about, for all I know.
What's that smell? Oh... it's one of you northern folk, I see.
You barbarians do know how to behave yourselves in a tavern, right?
You're on your way to Luskan? A barbarian?
A friend from the <race> lands, is it? What's with this tavern, anyway?
Hmph. I hear you <race> folk are what caused that plague in Neverwinter, you know.
Where I come from, they won't serve no <race> scum in the taverns.
And who might you be?
What competition? What are you talking about?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Oh yeah, I know all about the competition.
No, I'm not here for any competition.
Yes, I'm going into the competition.
I'll be going.
And have you won yet?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Oh, I know about *that.* I was just hoping for pointers.
How about 100 gold to loosen your tongue?
And who is me? Huh? Who is you?
Me not know what competition you mean.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Ha. Me know competition is.
No, I'm not here for any competition.
Yes. Me is here to *win* competition.
Me say time to leave.
So this is Mutamin's secret? I'll ask *him!*
Mutamin gots secret? Me ask Mutamin!
But you not win yet, right?
Ha! I just tricked you! I didn't know!
Me tricked you! Me not so dumb! Haha!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me know *that* already. Me ask for pointers.
Me gots money! Gives you 100 gold?
Hmm? Good day, dear <sir/madam>. You look like you're here for the competition, same as me.
The name's Dydd. My vast intelligence will see me through the competition, dear <man/woman>... and then everyone will know of me.
Oh. You don't know? Well, I'm not going to be the one to tell you, then. Mutamin likes to keep it a secret. Oops!

If you wish to return, simply use the platform that you appeared on, or any other platform. But it'll cost you 500 gold pieces to be teleported back.

Very well. Sssssince I am forcsssed to do ssso, I shall. Ansssswer thissss:
At a banquet where human knightsssss gather, each knight sssssat and clinked hissss glassss with the knight to hisssss left and the knight to hissss right.
If there are fifteen knightssss at thissss banquet, how many timessss did glasssssess clink, hmmm?
You are wrong, sssstupid <race> creature! Ssssso wrong! And now we dancsssse!!
Wrong you are, fool! You counted each knight twicsssse!! On one sssside, the knight hassss already clinked his glassss!! Now we dancssse!!
That issss correct. A childissshly ssssimple riddle. You may passsss. But... sssshould you wish a prizsse, ssssspeak to me again!
Ssssso... you wish my prize, do you? Do you wish to ansssswer my ssssecond riddle for it? Or shall we dancsssse?
Then passsss and begone, fool.
Asssss you wish! Lissssten clossssely, foolissssh one:
After ssslaying a dragon, a group of knightsss gave sssome of the trinketsss from a treasure horde to a group of fewer than ten human girlsss to divide.
While the trinketsss could have been divided equally amongssst the girlsss, they argued over how to divide it.
One sssuggesssted that they divide it by family inssstead of by individual. In the group, there were two groupsss of two sssisssterss, the ressst unrelated.
This division would mean that the trinketsss per family were five more than the trinketsss per girl.
Before a decision was made, one girl sssaid she desired nothing. Ssso her share wasss divided amongssst the othersss. The sharesss were equal once again.
The sssuggestion of dividing the trinketsss by family wasss then withdrawn, asss all were sssatisfied. How many girlsss shared in the division and how many did each get?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Never! Ansssswer or do not, fool!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Pfeh, <race> fool! I shall give you a hint though I doubt you will be able to anssswer my riddle, regardlesss!
The number of trinketsss mussst be evenly divisible by the number of girlsss as *well* asss by the number of familiesss and the number of sharersss once one is eliminated!
Sssss! You are correct! Here isss your gift! Now begone!!
Passss and begone!
I sssuppossse you want me to asssk it again, then? Fine, I will repeat it for you.
Which one is the one that you want?
All right... I'll do that.
Me not know which trinket you is wanting.
Me go do that then.
There are trinkets that you may collect throughout this dungeon. Place one in the chest before me, but only one.
If you give me the one I want, you will find the way out of here. The others... well, the others shall present more obstacles.
The skull is not the way out of the dungeon. Prepare yourself.
The frog is not the way out of the dungeon. Prepare yourself.
The insect is not the way out of the dungeon. Prepare yourself.
The trinket I seek is the one that answers the following riddle:
A box with neither hinges, key, nor lid, yet inside is a golden treasure hid.
The egg is the way out of the dungeon. You have completed the competition. Prepare to be returned to the surface.
The final challenge lies before you.
To Port Llast.
To Luskan.
East.
To the Green Griffon Inn.
To Charwood.
To Neverwinter Wood.

Boss say no hurt you.
Nice cave, yuh?
Now boss go, we live in mines.
Ungh, no attack now. You go.
I am a member of Zamithra's Blackguards! You can talk to her if she's in the mood for conversation.
I suspect the mistress will be happy in the morning. She always gets what she wants from men.
Mistress Zamithra's gem has been stolen. I have failed the mistress!
Zamithra seems distraught. Probably the fault of some man. I hate men.
Back away male! Perhaps Mistress Zamithra will put up with your leering but I will not!
Shaldrissa, right? I'm <FirstName> and your father sent me to rescue you.
I'll rescue you now, but don't get in my way.
Wait right here.
Shaldrissa? Me now you rescue, yuh.
Me rescue you, girly.
You stay here now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Settle down and tell me what's going on here.
Save the story for your father. You must go now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> No understand. What happen?
Dumb dumb! We go right now!
You had better tell me what you were talking about or I'll make you sorry that your father ever hired me.
No. Me want know what happen. Talk or get hurt.
It's all over now. You should be safe to go home.
You safe now. You go back to you dad.
Yesgar told me that you were the one who planned this and wanted the money.
Bad guy say you take money. You trick father.
Hmm. Well, you seem sincere, but it's your father's problem now. You can go home to him.
Yuh, probably. You go to dad now.
(sob) Huh? Who are you?
I'll be good! Please don't hurt me!
By the gods! Haven't you monsters tortured me enough? Just leave me alone!
Rescue? (sob) Wait, you... you're the one who saved Neverwinter. Does this mean the gods have forgiven me? Is it possible, despite my stupidity?
I will. (sob)
I shouldn't have believed him! It was going to be a grand adventure and I would be a true hero... like you. Oh, gods! I'll never be able to return home.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> *Sob* I'm sorry. I'm calm now and I'll tell you what happened.
I... I'm sorry. I don't think I can talk about it. I'll be safe now if I just go home.
I didn't mean for anyone to get hurt! I just want to go home! (sob)
Home! This town means everything to me! Thank you for saving me, <FirstName>. I will never do anything so foolish again!
I must be going. My father wishes me to stay in our house for awhile. I can't really say I blame him. Goodbye!
(sob) I'm so afraid to face my father. I... I wish I had listened to him in the first place. Thank you for rescuing a foolish child. Goodbye and good luck <sir/madam>.
I'l tell you! Please don't hurt me!
After you started returning with the ears of the other prisoners, I was approached by a man in a cloak. He said that he knew I was looking for adventure. He talked strangely but he was nice to me.
It all seemed so mysterious and exciting. He gave me wine and we talked about how he was a Count from Waterdeep who was framed for a crime he didn't commit and had escaped from prison.
I don't know why I believed him. Maybe it was the wine. I guess he just fit my childish image of a noble hero. We snuck away at night and travelled to the mines.
There were all these horrible orcs waiting for us and when I went to ask him what was going on, he just laughed and knocked me down. Then he... he did things to me... I... I can't talk about it.

I figured out who he was. I had heard my father talk about him. Yesgar told me that he was going to hold me for ransom and once he had bled the town dry, he was going to take me away to sell into slavery.
I should never have gone with him! My father must be so worried! (sob) I'm sorry... so sorry. (sob)
What?! I would never do something like that to my father or to Port Llast! I know I had a bad attitude, <FirstName>, but they are still my family and friends. I would never wish them ill.
Help me!
How, exactly, can you help me?
Pleased to meet you. My name is <FullName>.
What is my mission?
Aribeth told me I should speak to you.
Yes, yes, let's just get on with it.
How you help me?
Me pleased to meet you. Me called <FullName>.
What my mission?
Aribeth say me shoulds talk to you.
Yeah, yeah, you just gets on with it.
She said you would explain the details.
Just tell me what I need to know.
I'm still not clear on what I'm supposed to be doing.
She say you gives me details.
You just tells me what me needs to know.
Me not clear on what me must do, still...
I want to know about the other places I should search.
I would rather talk about something else.
I'll go now.
Me wants to know 'bout other places me searches.
Me want ask 'bout something else.
Me go now.
Why is Luskan closed?
Tell me what you know of this city.
Why do you think the cultists might be in Luskan?
How do I get to the Neverwinter Wood?
What do you know about the place?
Why do you think the cultists might be there?
How do I get to this South Road?
What do you know about the place?
Why do you think the cultists might be there?

What you know 'bout city?
Why you thinks cult in Luskan?
How me gets to Neverwinter Wood?
What you knows about it?
Why you thinks cult there?
How me gets to South Road?
What you knows about place?
Why you thinks cult there?
